Right about 2000 I had these friends, a married couple that I knew from community college and with whom I had reconnected when I moved to a new town for a job. We became rather close friends, hanging out quite a bit. One day as I was leaving their place something came up in conversation (I don’t remember what, exactly) and I mentioned seeing the moon during the day.
 
“What do you mean?” he said.
 
“The Moon. When it comes out at daytime. You kno
Continue Reading
I’ve been debating for a while whether or not to post this because I’m still having a hard time believing it happened, but what the hell, a story’s a story.
 
Right about 2000 I had these friends, a married couple that I knew from community college and with whom I had reconnected when I moved to a new town for a job. We became rather close friends, hanging out quite a bit. One day as I was leaving their place something came up in conversation (I don’t remember what, exactly) and I mentioned seeing the moon during the day.
 
“What do you mean?” he said.
 
“The Moon. When it comes out at daytime. You know,” I responded.
 
“I don’t understand,” he said, a blank look on his face that puzzled me. He seemed to be serious.
 
“What do you mean you don’t understand. Surely you’ve seen the moon during the day?” I asked, unable to believe he had never seen the moon during the day and that he must be trolling me (even though “trolling” wasn’t a thing yet).
 
“No,” he said, completely seriously. “The moon is never out at daytime. You can only see it at night.”
 
“Of course,” she said. “You know that.”
 
I was dumbstruck. I literally stammered for words. These were not stupid people. They had many faults, but blind stupidity was not, I thought, one of them. I was quickly revising that opinion.
 
“No… But… Seriously… You can’t… Um…” I tried to gather my thoughts. “You’re telling me you have never seen the moon during the day?”
 
“Never,” they both said.
 
“So, when the moon sets and goes to the other side of the planet, where it’s daytime…” My disbelief inhibited me from forming a complete sentence.
 
“When the moon sets, the sun rises. Everybody knows that,” he retorted.
 
“So what about solar eclipses? The moon has to be out during the day for that, right?” I said, thinking I had to convince him with that.
 
“I’ve never seen the moon during an eclipse, have you,” he asked his wife.
 
“No, never,” she responded.
 
“But the moon is what causes a solar eclipse, right?” I asked, desperate to reach some working logic center of their brains.
 
“I don’t know, I’ve never really thought about it,” he said offhandedly.
 
I considered this for a moment and realized the moon would have to be at the new moon phase during an eclipse, so It’s reasonable they wouldn’t have seen the moon then, and eclipses are rather rare anyway. I was stuck. Short of dragging them outside when the moon and sun both occupied the sky I didn’t think I would be able to crack this breathtaking level of ignorance. I then realized that they were both recovering from substance abuse and they might have been too high most of their lives to ever notice the moon in the daytime sky.
 
It was at that moment I realized I needed a higher caliber or friends.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
It’s 2012, a month before the presidential election. I’m finishing a meeting and we start talking about politics a bit. It’s Obama vs. Romney and his binders of women. “Nobody puts baby in a binder”, I say and we’re laughing.
 
Except one man. He’s in his 50’s (and so was I) and he’s white. As I’m walking out, he walks next to me and starts to speak to me. Loudly.
 
He “schools” me-If I know what’s good for me and my country, I’ll vote for Romney. That Kenyan Muslim, Obama, is going to rape (his word) this nation. He only wants to be re-elected to finish what he’s started!
 
I can only say, “Excuse me?

It’s 2012, a month before the presidential election. I’m finishing a meeting and we start talking about politics a bit. It’s Obama vs. Romney and his binders of women. “Nobody puts baby in a binder”, I say and we’re laughing.
 
Except one man. He’s in his 50’s (and so was I) and he’s white. As I’m walking out, he walks next to me and starts to speak to me. Loudly.
 
He “schools” me-If I know what’s good for me and my country, I’ll vote for Romney. That Kenyan Muslim, Obama, is going to rape (his word) this nation. He only wants to be re-elected to finish what he’s started!
 
I can only say, “Excuse me?”
 
And then the fun REALLY begins.. “Women need to get it through their heads that they have a place and it’s time they figured that out again. Women belong at home, not in the office and women today think they have a “right” to take all the jobs just because we “got the vote.”
 
Are you freaking KIDDING me?
 
And so I say to him, “Let me get this straight-you are suggesting I exercise my right to vote in such a way as to lose other rights?”
 
“Don’t you get it?”, he sneers, “You’re one of those stupid liberal women who think abortion is OK. Everyone knows it’s only LIBERAL women who get abortions because the conservative women are God-fearing, good women who know better than to have sex before marriage. Why, you liberals use abortion as a form of birth control and it’s time the US became a Christian nation once again and the only way to do that is to vote for Romney! There’s nothing better for America than women being back in the kitchen, barefoot and pregnant.” The man is so close, he’s spitting in my face. The more I step back, the more he steps towards me.
 
STUPID doesn’t begin to cover it.
 
I looked at him and told him he was dumb as F**k and he needed to educate himself. And that sent him into spasms all over again.
 
How dare I speak to him that way? How dare I use that word? Who did I think I was? This man was like acting like a demon possessed.
 
And so, I said it again. I couldn’t help it; I started to laugh. And I laughed and laughed and laughed. I told him to step back and to stay away as I walked to my car. And I just kept on laughing. The entire episode was ludicrous.
 
I had talked with plenty of conservatives during that time and while they were passionate, they weren’t like THIS. I knew within seconds this wasn’t a person I could have a meaningful conversation with. Nor did I even want to.
 
This was the first time I was fully confronted with people who live in this alternate reality and it showed me just how bad they really are. It’s scary to think this kind of thinking actually exists in our society. But it does and to make sure the rest of us know it, they voted for Trump.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Well, THIS guy wasn’t American, he was Welsh. However, as there are more peeps who boast Welsh descent in the Americas than there are in Wales itself, I think he will be eligible.
 
It was back in the Sixties during the height of the Cold War. Kruschev was banging his shoe on a table at the UN in a temper. Kennedy was telling peeps all over the World that he was a “savoury Berlin Sausage” (Which is what the phrase “Ich Bin Ein Berliner” actually means) and we were all expecting a Nuclear warhead to explode over the Cenotaph in Maesteg, South Wales (which we were certain was on the Kremlin’s ‘firs
Continue Reading
Well, THIS guy wasn’t American, he was Welsh. However, as there are more peeps who boast Welsh descent in the Americas than there are in Wales itself, I think he will be eligible.
 
It was back in the Sixties during the height of the Cold War. Kruschev was banging his shoe on a table at the UN in a temper. Kennedy was telling peeps all over the World that he was a “savoury Berlin Sausage” (Which is what the phrase “Ich Bin Ein Berliner” actually means) and we were all expecting a Nuclear warhead to explode over the Cenotaph in Maesteg, South Wales (which we were certain was on the Kremlin’s ‘first strike’ hit list).
 
At this time, I was in the final year of School before leaving for College or University (In the UK, that would be the Second Year Sixth Form, age 17 going on 18) and we indulged in an extra curricular activity which took the form of Debates on various subjects. One Proposer and Seconder from each side of the debate (Pro and Anti) to state their proposition , followed by Q and A with the audience. Following what I believe is an almost Universal practice amongst School debating clubs, the “Pro” team and the “Anti” team picked their preference at the start of the debate so all teams would have to be well read on BOTH sides of the argument and be prepared to back up their arguments EVEN WHEN the proposition was against their personal beliefs.
 
One of these was on the subject of Nuclear Arms and the arguments for and against Nuclear Weapons as a whole. I was seconding a guy called Nigel (the Head Boy) and a friend of Mine, Eddie, was seconding Peter the Deputy Head Boy. We were Pro (or the dirty, stinking Warmongers) and Eddie and Peter were Anti Nuclear Arms (God’s favourite children). The result, a forgone conclusion, but, hey, a good excuse for a nice, dirty, verbal scrap.
 
Things became heated and rules of courtesy and tact disappeared as immoderate statements were made by each team (and their supporters) impugning the motives, ethics and morals of the Opposition. During this period, Eddie and I got into one of these verbal ‘scrap’ and I was asked by him what I would do if I heard the famous “Four Minute Warning” sound across the Town.
 
I retorted, quick as a flash “”I’ve read all about the things we are likely to expect in a Post Holocaust World, and I wouldn’t want to stay here and watch it happen. If that Missile was falling on Maesteg, then I’d want to try and get directly underneath it….”.
 
Eddie laughed. It was a scornful laugh. It expressed a depth of contempt for my words that, quite frankly, hurt a little. When his laughter had subsdided, he looked at me and said, EVEN MORE scornfully :-
 
“Stand underneath it ???!!! Do you KNOW how much those fuckers WEIGH ???”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I took a train ride across America in late October/early November 2008 during the closing weeks of the first Obama election. I was travelling on my own but that was no problem on these trains, I had a roomette which entitled me to eat in the dining car and chat to people. The way the dining car works is that you get seated in the next open seat at a table of 4 as you turn up, so it generally works out that you're seated with different people for each meal. As these were the last few weeks before the election, a lot of the talk was about just that. I had my opinions on the candidates of course 
Continue Reading
I took a train ride across America in late October/early November 2008 during the closing weeks of the first Obama election. I was travelling on my own but that was no problem on these trains, I had a roomette which entitled me to eat in the dining car and chat to people. The way the dining car works is that you get seated in the next open seat at a table of 4 as you turn up, so it generally works out that you're seated with different people for each meal. As these were the last few weeks before the election, a lot of the talk was about just that. I had my opinions on the candidates of course and with me being European, I would be naturally more aligned with Obama and Democrats. However I was very mindful that this was not my country and not my place to start heated discussions so I was careful to keep a neutral tone in my conversations. The demographics in the dining car of a long distance Amtrak train are quite old. There are lots of retired people who now have the chance to see America at last and they head out on a great Amtrak adventure.
 
So I was on the California Zephyr heading towards Denver from San Francisco and I went along for my evening meal. I'd had breakfast earlier in the day with a very ancient man who was convinced that Obama was a ‘'damn moslem’ and I was a bit nervous that I'd get him again. Instead I ended up sat opposite a couple in their mid 60s or so and eventually the conversation turned to politics. This is now well over 8 years ago for me so I can't remember how the conversation led to this point but it got on to the topic of GW Bush and how the husband thought that Bush had been a fantastic president so with me in my best neutral tone, the conversation went something like this
 
Me: So you think that Bush handled 9/11 and the aftermath well? That John Kerry may not have handled it differently or better?
 
Husband: Well we haven't had any terrorists attacks since then have we! So it obviously went really well!
 
Me: But other places have had attacks, Bali have, hundreds were killed in the Madrid attack, my own town of London was attacked and some of my friends were very close to being caught in it
 
Husband: Yeah but WE weren't attacked! *defiant look, straight in my eyes*
 
Wife: *squeezes husbands arm in a ‘ you should shut up now honey’ kind of way and has a panicked look on her face*
 
Me: *silence*
 
And a very awkward rest of the meal after that
 
So maybe not the most ignorant in terms of not knowing how many states there are, but thinking it's ok for other countries to take the hit resulting from your foreign policy so you don't have to and having the gall to say that to someone from one of the cities that took the hit is massively ignorant and offensive

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

Okay, so I was visiting with my grandmother, who lives in 
Snohomish, Washington
 an awesome little town with a lot of character and culture.
 
I once thought that everyone there was just great. They were always nice, respectful, and I’d even been able to strike up some very intelligent conversations with total strangers around town. But on this one day, we were walking down the street and my grandma pointed to a woman waiting for a bus “Look Jon! I see my friend!” (she speaks poor english and often exclaims loudly). I thought it would be nice to meet one of m

Maybe not ignorant, just totally crazy.
 
Okay, so I was visiting with my grandmother, who lives in 
Snohomish, Washington
 an awesome little town with a lot of character and culture.
 
I once thought that everyone there was just great. They were always nice, respectful, and I’d even been able to strike up some very intelligent conversations with total strangers around town. But on this one day, we were walking down the street and my grandma pointed to a woman waiting for a bus “Look Jon! I see my friend!” (she speaks poor english and often exclaims loudly). I thought it would be nice to meet one of my grandma’s friends, especially one who lived in Snohomish. WRONG!
 
This woman literally thought she was a prophet. She believed that she was speaking with god on a daily basis.
 
“Hello, this must be your grandson!”
 
normal enough
 
“I’m riding the bus, I have to go to a party with my bible study group. I’m going to Israel next month, you know.”
 
Ok, still normal
 
“I’m selling all my things for this trip! Selling everything and going to Israel because the lord commanded me to go”
 
Um…
 
“I’m a Prophetess you know! God speaks to me! Always has. I’m going to Israel and staying there while these secular people destroy America! Things are going downhill from here, me and my group know it! You know why? Because the lord speaketh!”
 
Wait, did she just say speaketh?
 
“When Donald Trump was a young man, he prayed to god, ‘Dear god, make me a successful businessman!’ and look where he is now! And he’s said some things in the past, but now he’s become humble and GOD WILL USE A HUMBLE MAN I TELL YOU!”
 
dafuq?
 
“I’m an evangelist you know and a prophetess, did I tell you that? I can speaketh with the lord himself! And I’m going to Israel. I know this Televangelist who’s going with me and his son, well he’s the prodigal son, THE PRODIGAL SON from the bible. And he strayeth from the lord, but the lord forgiveth him! He and I put posters up, all over the city and BY THE MIGHT OF GOD we marched the ENTIRE TOWN OF SNOHOMISH down to Olympia (the state capitol, 90 miles away) and DE-E-E-E-MANDED they obey god! This year we’re going bigger, WE’RE GOING TO SUMMON THE ENTIRE COUNTY!”
 
People are starting to stare as she screams “the will of god” at me and my grandma, and I am thoroughly terrified of this woman. She then 
PUTS HER HANDS ON ME, AND STARES AT ME WITH HER PIERCING EYES.
 
“Dear lord I pray for this man that you’d touch his life and turn him away from the E-E-E-EVIL ways of sin! I pray you guide him through the apocalypse which is soon to come, and I pray you FORCE THE DEVIL OUT OF THIS MAN’S LIFE! In JE-E-E-ESUS NAME A-A-A-AMEN!”
 
Probably the most terrifying experience of my life.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

(1) Who is Angela Merkel?
 
I was genuinely shocked when he asked that question since we are supposed to be stationed in Germany for a few months and she is one of the most influential and longest standing politician in the world.

Continue Reading
I've never been to America but I have met a few ignorant americans overseas. In fact, this group of people happens to be the most ignorant people I have ever encountered.
 
I am a Singaporean and was in Germany for a little study exchange where I happened to meet a bunch of Americans (about 20ish years old) and I complied the many ignorant questions they have asked.
 
(1) Who is Angela Merkel?
 
I was genuinely shocked when he asked that question since we are supposed to be stationed in Germany for a few months and she is one of the most influential and longest standing politician in the world.
 
(2) Is that the West Side Gallery? Oh it's the wall I see on instagram.
 
He meant the East Side Gallery which is a huge landmark in Berlin and honestly, anyone who has remotely read about the WW2 (which i assume was thought in school, would have known about the Berlin wall and the many historical backstories it comes with)
 
(After i've said i'm from Singapore)
 
(3) Wait so is that part of China?
 
No. In fact, Singapore is 6 hours away from Beijing, which is not exactly near. But I wouldn't fault him for this. Singapore has many Chinese and is tiny so it's easy to misunderstand.
 
(4) So you are Chinese?
 
Yes I am ethically Chinese. I look 100% Chinese so I don't really understand the point of this question. It is like asking a very obvious white, Are you white?
 
at this point i realise their mind is a bit blown, how can a chinese that speaks chinese not be from China?
 
(5) How could you speak English so well?
 
English is the first and official language of all Singaporeans. English was the first language I was taught, english is the language i work and study in. And this seems to confused them.
 
(6) What English is your first language? That can't be it, what “asian language” do you speak?
 
at this point i'm already a bit pissed. What do you meant by “asian language”? I already told you i speak english (in fact we converse in english) and that they heard me speak a bit of chinese. They could have just asked “so do you speak any other languages?” in which i would have politely replied no, i only speak english and chinese, instead of asking me what other “asian” language do i speak? lol and he had that condenscening tone which makes it worst.
 
To be fair, Singapore is a fairly small country and I wouldn't expect everybody to know much about our country but even my French roommate chip in and agreed that she too had met many ignorant americans. In fact, she said an american she knew thought that Paris and France were two different countries!
 
p.s. not throwing shade, probably sure there are ignorant people all around the world in different countries just sharing my experiences.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Years ago, I was (rear-ended) in an auto accident and sufferred damage to my brain (front left, close-head injury) which severely affected my cognitive skills; to include short-term memory, speech, movement, and a host of other functions.
 
They called it MTBI (Mild Traumatic Brain Injury), a term that still confounds me, as I am at a loss to understand how a condition can be simultaneously 
mild
 and 
traumatic
.....especially when the two words are thus juxtaposed.
 
Moving on……..
 
Post MVA, I spent years with a team of doctors (who were similarly stumped!), who occupied themselves prodding, probing, an
Continue Reading
Years ago, I was (rear-ended) in an auto accident and sufferred damage to my brain (front left, close-head injury) which severely affected my cognitive skills; to include short-term memory, speech, movement, and a host of other functions.
 
They called it MTBI (Mild Traumatic Brain Injury), a term that still confounds me, as I am at a loss to understand how a condition can be simultaneously 
mild
 and 
traumatic
.....especially when the two words are thus juxtaposed.
 
Moving on……..
 
Post MVA, I spent years with a team of doctors (who were similarly stumped!), who occupied themselves prodding, probing, and playing guessing games (because even after all these decades of research, the brain still remains largely terra incognita to the medical professionals), trying desperately to tell me something more substantial than,
 
''Hmmm, I am not sure. This is only the second case of 'this' that I have even seen."
 
Dear Doctor, just a parenthetical note: That statement instills such confidence in a patient! (NOT!)
 
On the team was an esteemed neuro-psychologist, who played a pivitol role, as he was the one who proctored the battery of neuro-psychological testing, used to determine the extent of the damage, and my residual cerebral funcionality. His findings were the determiner for the selection of treatment received, and also the referent for further testing. He was the key player in the panel of around eighteen ''professionals.''
 
In his illustrious report (which of course became the sine qua non in the legal proceedings), he opened with the usual biographics such as name, age, birthplace, and the problem.
 
The next line, which would highlight his subjective observations, and lead into the objective findings, began with:
"Ms Morgan is a very intelligent woman, considering that she was educated in South America.''
 
Thank God the legal case was based on assessing the extent of the damage, and was not a qualitative measurement of my cerebral inheritance!
 
Yes, he still practises psychiatry. In fact, he is cited as being ''one of the most famous doctors in Tacoma,'' with decades of ''diverse'' experience.''
 
Edit: Hey guys, thanks to all of those who felt the need to explain definitions to me, as if suffering a car accident has rendered me brainless. This post is riddled with satire, and if you missed it, I am sorry. Having lived with MBTI for some 17 years, I do believe that I could get a PhD in it now, without dint of study, so please stop explaining it to me. The focus of this article is on a totally unrelated topic, which has nothing to do with “What is the definition of MBTI?” But thanks for reading and caring enough to provide a((n) unsolicited) definition.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
Yes, there are lots of poor people. Including me…
 
A few years ago, I lived in a pretty nice trailer, with my mom, aunt, and brother. We had a stable income, and we could afford all the necessities, like fast internet, fast computers, etc…
 
At some point, the landlord decided that it was completely unacceptable for us to be living with my aunt, who was paying the rent. They made us move out, and we were forced to find somewhere else to live.
 
Since we no longer had someone else paying rent, we couldn’t afford anything nearly as nice as that trailer. We settled on a small apartment and moved into the
Continue Reading
Yes, there are lots of poor people. Including me…
 
A few years ago, I lived in a pretty nice trailer, with my mom, aunt, and brother. We had a stable income, and we could afford all the necessities, like fast internet, fast computers, etc…
 
At some point, the landlord decided that it was completely unacceptable for us to be living with my aunt, who was paying the rent. They made us move out, and we were forced to find somewhere else to live.
 
Since we no longer had someone else paying rent, we couldn’t afford anything nearly as nice as that trailer. We settled on a small apartment and moved into there.
 
We lived there until just a few months ago. During our stay, we could barely afford food, and regularly got fast food, or random free food from someplace (can’t remember).
 
On top of that, the machines we owned were aging and breaking down. So I got a 2008 MacBook from FreeGeek. It beat my old Windows laptop at everything, despite being around 5 years older (I can’t remember which year the PC was, it was an HP Notebook 2000).
 
We had cheap internet from Xfinity, the monopoly in our area. Back then, I wasn’t nearly as interesting as I am now (lol), so I did pretty simple things on that machine.
 
It survived until my cousin decided it would be funny to throw a tea bottle right at the screen to get my attention. She’s… not too bright. The screen shattered… but still works to this day.
 
I begged and begged and begged for a MacBook Pro, but it seemed clear I wasn’t going to get one…
 
…But fuck that, I ended up getting a MacBook Pro anyway thanks to some effort from my entire family (parents, grandparents, Boeing discounts, everything).
 
And a few months ago, some idiot in the apartment above us decided it would be funny to flood us. Twice.
 
So, long story short, the apartment got ripped up while we were still living in it for 2 weeks before they finally allowed us to move out to another “identical” apartment.
 
And the new apartment has…
 
HARDWOOD FLOORING. (and it’s also mirrored)
 
Hardwood flooring is an evil, evil thing. In the past, I was able to walk on the floor, carpet, without hurting myself. Well, this hardwood flooring is 100% evil and does not like feet (or paws). All the humans were complaining.
 
At least it didn’t soak up the crap from a box full of rotting meat left by the retarded moving company. Carpet would’ve been ruined and then we would’ve had to move again…
 
Anyway, my MacBook Pro still survives to this day, and it also allows 
me
 to survive while my internal organs are being fucked with. Yay. Stuck in bed now. Sucks.
 
P.S. this answer has been a draft for months. Just added like 2 paragraphs to the ending and revised a bit.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
As with all fitness questions, it depends.
 
There are two conditions that I’ll put on a “yes” answer:
You’re not pushing yourself at an extreme level (keeping it under 80% intensity)
You still take a rest day every microcycle (every 1–2 weeks).
If you work out 
hard
 every day your body won’t rebuild and metabolic fatigue will set in quickly (it’ll set in if you work daily, also even where your workout is >50% <80%). You could set experience 
overtraining syndrome
, where your body cannot recover enough between workouts.
 
Additionally, your body requires a certain amount of time to recover between workou
Continue Reading
As with all fitness questions, it depends.
 
There are two conditions that I’ll put on a “yes” answer:
You’re not pushing yourself at an extreme level (keeping it under 80% intensity)
You still take a rest day every microcycle (every 1–2 weeks).
If you work out 
hard
 every day your body won’t rebuild and metabolic fatigue will set in quickly (it’ll set in if you work daily, also even where your workout is >50% <80%). You could set experience 
overtraining syndrome
, where your body cannot recover enough between workouts.
 
Additionally, your body requires a certain amount of time to recover between workouts. If you’re providing enough stimulus to your muscles this is usually between 36 and 48 hours (
depending on the muscle worked (muscles like your core tend to recover faster
), your gender (
women tend to recover faster than men)
, the intensity that you worked the muscle (
the harder you worked it the longer it will take)
, your age (
over 60 you will require as much as 96 hours rest to recover between workouts), 
the nutrition applied, and your hormone profile (
more testosterone, HGH, IGF will lead to quicker recovery when coupled with adequate amounts of protein and glucose
)).
If you don’t give it enough time, you won’t build up past your initial baseline, and your muscles will suffer.
 
As metabolic fatigue builds up, even in lighter intensity training, you’ll feel it all over. It could be something simple at first — you stop improving in your lifts, for example. Eventually you start getting worse. Soon you start getting injuries that aren’t healing. You start to feel depressed. Even one day off with complete relaxation or even a light walk could be enough to clear you out, if you catch it early enough. Serious cases of overtraining could require more time.
 
To re-iterate:
If you don’t work it over 80% intensity every day
If you 
do
 take a break once every 1–2 weeks
You’ll be fine.
 
If you notice things going wrong — you start feeling weaker, you stop improving, you start feeling like crap in general, you start getting injuries…take a step back. Rest. Recover.
Brief anecdote as illustration
 
Once I was really working my pull ups. I was stuck at 18. I would do them daily, at least 4 sets. I hit 18 every time in my first set, I ended up doing about 50 a day. At first I was gaining daily, I went from 8 to 10 to 14, to 18…but then the growth stopped. I was stuck there for a couple weeks.
 
I took 2 days off from doing pull ups.
 
The next time I stepped up to the bar I did 25 in my first set.
 
I’m not saying that you’ll have dramatic results like this, but sometimes the missing part of your workout is actually 
not
 working out.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I once heard a commercial on the radio that stated that the United States was founded in 1876! I actually called the car dealership that was running the advertisement and corrected them and then they ran a new commercial and thanked me on air in their new commercial for correcting their mistake!! On May 9, 2008 then candidate for president Barack Obama stated that he was going to campaign in all 57 states of the United States…. But cut the guy some slack, he was only a junior Senator right? Never mind that most second graders could tell you there are 50 states in the United States and there ha
Continue Reading
I once heard a commercial on the radio that stated that the United States was founded in 1876! I actually called the car dealership that was running the advertisement and corrected them and then they ran a new commercial and thanked me on air in their new commercial for correcting their mistake!! On May 9, 2008 then candidate for president Barack Obama stated that he was going to campaign in all 57 states of the United States…. But cut the guy some slack, he was only a junior Senator right? Never mind that most second graders could tell you there are 50 states in the United States and there have been since 1959.
 
But neither of those prior stories which are true, compared to the most ignorant person I have met in America. I was working as a technician for a satellite company and when I was picking up equipment I asked one of the warehouse workers who had been issuing me equipment for many years why he didn't step up and become a satellite Tech, which was a position that could pay easily four to five times what he was making?
 
He was a black guy and all of his co-workers in the warehouse were also black guys at that time. He told me the reason that he could not become a technician was because I had “white privilege”!! I was very perplexed by this and ask him what the hell he was talking about ?!
 
He asked me if I was a homeowner and I said yes I am… white privilege, he responds.
 
He asked me if I had Investments in a stock portfolio? I said yes …White Privilege he responded!!
 
So I asked him, when you applied for your job did they violate the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and refuse to hire you because you're black ?
 
“ No”
 
When you filled out the application to move into the house that you're in either as a renter or a homeowner did they violate the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and refuse to rent or sell to you because you were black ?
 
“ No”
 
“Do you think that the stock broker who helped me open my investment account stopped me before he handed me the portfolio account application to make sure that I was a white guy because he wasn't about to help a black person or any other minority invest?
 
…by this time he was getting the point of the questions I was asking and he realized how ignorant he was behaving, in addition to being racist towards white people. Judging somebody based on the color of their skin is despicable regardless of who the victim is.
 
This guy's worldview was that he was not allowed to succeed because he was black. In America this attitude is completely ignorant because if anybody in the United States truly wants to succeed all they have to do is try. If a person is discriminated against, it is illegal in most circumstances.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My wife and I were living in Rome. One day, we took a day trip to Florence. It was a pretty straightforward goal: take a train, get off the train, walk around, have a nice meal and a glass or two of wine, and return home.
 
Florence really makes the best of a bad scenario. The bad scenario is that its central district is completely overrun by tourists. But despite hearing far more English than Italian, it’s still possible to get a little bit of a feel for Florentine culture and history.
 
Everything was going according to the plan. We had randomly chosen a restaurant, and had enjoyed a nice meal. I 
Continue Reading
My wife and I were living in Rome. One day, we took a day trip to Florence. It was a pretty straightforward goal: take a train, get off the train, walk around, have a nice meal and a glass or two of wine, and return home.
 
Florence really makes the best of a bad scenario. The bad scenario is that its central district is completely overrun by tourists. But despite hearing far more English than Italian, it’s still possible to get a little bit of a feel for Florentine culture and history.
 
Everything was going according to the plan. We had randomly chosen a restaurant, and had enjoyed a nice meal. I went to the restroom to… make room for more wine.
 
This restaurant had one door to both men’s and women’s bathrooms, then obviously individual doors for each gender beyond that. (I can’t remember why this made sense, but it did. Maybe there was only one sink in the “antechamber” for both bathrooms?) The exterior door was labelled “bagni” (“bathrooms”) and the interior doors were labeled “donna” and “uomo.” I won’t translate those two exotic terms, for reasons that will be soon be evident. But for now, pause for just a moment and take a guess… a wild conjecture… as to what those two terms mean.
 
I’ll give you a hint. At the moment I was heading to the bathroom, there was a woman who stood in apparent paralysis inside the “bagni” door, but outside the “uomo” and “donna” doors. A man then emerged from the “uomo” door. The woman remained, utterly confused. She wondered aloud, “which door do I use?”, not necessarily talking 
to
 me, but perhaps hoping I could help.
 
I did. I directed her to the “donna” door. I can only assume she found the relief she was looking for, as did I inside the “uomo” door.
 
I came back to my seat and relayed all this to my wife. She was as perplexed as I was, how someone could get so far — to plan a trip to Italy, to get on a plane, to make it from some airport or another all the way to the center of Florence — without somehow picking up a 
little
 vocabulary. And even if she literally just woke up magically transported from her home in ‘merica to this restaurant, how she couldn’t put it together that a 
man
 
walked out of one of the doors
.
 
As I wrapped up my brief narrative, I saw her emerge from the bathroom and take her seat. Turned out, that seat was right next to us. She then explained, exasperated, the intricate system at play in the restroom to her traveling companion, who I can only assume was her husband. I don’t remember all of what followed, but for the first time I was really embarrassed to be an American. The depth of their collective ignorance was really quite staggering.

Let me tell you my story.
 
My 4th day in America, i went to visit my friend( American) house for lunch, her father was not very welcoming though, so she introduced me etc and we sat for lunch, I have been told you should always respect your elders, atleast everybody from Indian familes teach to thier kids. So i am natuarlly respected him.
 
We sat for lunch, and i felt uncomfortable eating with spoons,fork and knife, so i asked them do they mind if i eat with my hand. The coversation is below:
 
Me: Do you mind, if i eat with my hand?
 
He: its ok, you can.
 
Me: Thanks and started eating with my hand..
 
He: so, everyone in India eat with hands?
 
Me: No sir, depends on Person but my family has been eating with hands always. I think many indians eat with Hands, its just comfortable for us.
 
He: thats weird,
 
Me: I also prefer eating sitting on the floor , ofcourse i didn’t ask them that. Lol.
 
By his discussion, i came to know he has patchy ideas of India .. ok lets get back to the conversation.
 
He: what? On the floor? Oh, Boy you guys have to learn a lot.
 
Me: *smiled*
 
He: i believe India is poor Country and lots of population.
 
Me: Couldn’t say No.( obviously he was comparing with USA)
 
He: So, i see many indians come here, thats why.
 
Me: couldn’t say No ( i didn’t know what to reply)
 
He kept belittling about India ofcourse with his patchy ideas..
 
Me: felt uncomfortable, but i decided to speak up. And waiting for him to say one more thing…
 
He: so, many Indians are not civilized.
 
Me: Thats it, i thought enough is enough in my mind. I started saying…
 
Yes, Sir, We eat with our hands, many of us still sit on the floor and eat, But you are talking about Civilization.. do you know, where was the First human civilzation started in this Planet?
 
He: no, where?
 
Me: India, the First civilization started in in the at Sindu River, they call it Sindhu Civilization. We are the guys , who started using fire for the first time.
 
He: Really? I don’t think so..
 
Me: I can show you in Google, or you can refer 5th grade history text book.
 
He: *silent*
 
Me: So, we are the guys who introduced civilization to the world. But still many of us eat with hands and sit on the floor not because we don’t know how to make dining tables, its because there are specific reasons why we are doing that.
 
Ofcourse, i made him realise many things about what India is , and he changed his perception about India.
 
Note: i think whatever i told him is true, but i may be incorrect. But i couldn’t bear his discussion about India so i spoke. And yes we are good friends now.
 
No offense to anyone.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I’m not going to give a specific example but I have generally found that American Tourists are worse than Americans in America. Maybe being surrounded by a different culture/language gives them more opportunity to demonstrate their ignorance. I am British and have been all over Europe, and around a few other countries as well, I’ve been to the US once, for four weeks, and I was surprised how nice everyone was. Based on American tourists I’ve met in Europe I was expecting them all to be unbearably annoying. Maybe the more ignorant Americans are more noticeable, especially abroad, they talk loud
Continue Reading
I’m not going to give a specific example but I have generally found that American Tourists are worse than Americans in America. Maybe being surrounded by a different culture/language gives them more opportunity to demonstrate their ignorance. I am British and have been all over Europe, and around a few other countries as well, I’ve been to the US once, for four weeks, and I was surprised how nice everyone was. Based on American tourists I’ve met in Europe I was expecting them all to be unbearably annoying. Maybe the more ignorant Americans are more noticeable, especially abroad, they talk louder and argue more.
 
If you want a story about someone very stupid but not American (in case you’ve read all this thread and now think Americans are the worst):
 
A girl in my Biology class at school (when we were 17) exclaimed with surprise: “What? Pigeons lay eggs?!” The teacher said “yes, of course. All birds lay eggs.” And she said “Really? Like ducks?” “yes, like ducks. You can buy duck eggs in the shops.”
 
This girl, like me, was white, British, middle-class. My parents knew her parents, they were nice and had just as much money. She went to the same primary school (even the same pre-school) as me, so we’ve have the same formal education since we were 4 years old. She has had every opportunity to learn but she went her whole life knowing that chickens lay eggs and she was never, ever bothered to ask about the reproductive arrangements of other birds, or absorb that information when it was given to her (as in must have been at some point, she was 17). Last I heard she went to university, but I don’t know what she studied.
 
When I was a child I had a brain like a sponge, I wish I could learn as easily as I did then. I was also very curious about everything and always asked “why?” I’ve heard this said about children in general, that children are naturally inquisitive and love to learn, and most people I meet agree that this is the case, my own children certainly are. But it seems that some children really don’t care what lays eggs, what language they speak in France, why is the sky blue, what does “coincidence” mean, what are your kidneys for, why is your blood red, what are the Egyptians (these are the sorts of things my son asks me, and other parents say the same sort of things). Sadly it seems that some children simply don’t care, so long as they know the names of the members of the latest pop-band they will be accepted by their peers, and they don’t care about anything else in the world. Some people, it seems, never question anything, even as children, and its not just an American phenomenon.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
You can always work out at home and have a decent muscular body. Here are some exercises .
 
1. CARDIO: Always warm up your body before workout. U can go for a run. Skipping rope is my personal favorite. And after warm up do some stretching. Try some yoga positions and make sure ur entire body is ready for work out.
 
2. PULL UP: This is by far the best and most difficult exercise. It targets variety of parts on upper body. It focuses on your SHOULDER, BACK, ARMS, FOREARMS. For beginners its really hard to do repetitions. So just make it a point to do 20 pull ups every day taking enough rest but com
Continue Reading
You can always work out at home and have a decent muscular body. Here are some exercises .
 
1. CARDIO: Always warm up your body before workout. U can go for a run. Skipping rope is my personal favorite. And after warm up do some stretching. Try some yoga positions and make sure ur entire body is ready for work out.
 
2. PULL UP: This is by far the best and most difficult exercise. It targets variety of parts on upper body. It focuses on your SHOULDER, BACK, ARMS, FOREARMS. For beginners its really hard to do repetitions. So just make it a point to do 20 pull ups every day taking enough rest but complete 20. Soon your body well get use to your body weight and will become easy.
 
3. CHIN UP: Chin up is a little different from pull ups. Here ur palms are facing towards u and the gap between two hand is less and arms are parallel to each other unlike in pull up position where arms form a V shape. This focuses on 
BICEPS, FOREARMS, BACK.
 
4. PUSH UP: This is one of the basic exercise for upper body. U can change hand position to apply focus on different parts.
 
-- WIDE GRIP : Focuses on CHEST, BICEPS
-- CLOSE GRIP : Focuses on CHEST, TRICEPS
 
U can increase the intensity of workout by making it difficult by keeping ur legs on elevated platform.
 
5. BICYCLE CRUNCH : Best for abdomen. U can google it to see how it is done.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
There are lots of poor people on Quora. Lots and lots of them, literally from every country around the world.
 
By American, Canadian or British standards I am poor, but by living standards in other countries such as India or Pakistan I am wealthy. It’s all relative.
 
By Brazilian standards, which is where I live, I am… let’s put it this way… very comfortable.
 
Internet service at home costs me R$147.00 (US$30.00) a month. That’s for a velocity of over 700 megabytes per second, which is really fast, and there’s no limit to how much I can upload or download.
 
But for many Brazilians, that’s really expen
Continue Reading
There are lots of poor people on Quora. Lots and lots of them, literally from every country around the world.
 
By American, Canadian or British standards I am poor, but by living standards in other countries such as India or Pakistan I am wealthy. It’s all relative.
 
By Brazilian standards, which is where I live, I am… let’s put it this way… very comfortable.
 
Internet service at home costs me R$147.00 (US$30.00) a month. That’s for a velocity of over 700 megabytes per second, which is really fast, and there’s no limit to how much I can upload or download.
 
But for many Brazilians, that’s really expensive, it’s 10% of their monthly salary for 2/3 of the population. So for the majority of the country internet access isn’t cheap.
 
Internet service on my phone is R$60.00 (US$12.00) a month. It gives me 22 gigabytes of 4g before my connection speed is reduced to 32k, which works well for text emailing, but that’s about it.
 
This price also gives me unlimited calling and unlimited text messages to any landline or cellular phone in Brazil independent of who their or my cellular provider is.
 
It’s accompanied with free inter-state roaming, and because it’s a pre-paid plan it’s not linked to the purchase of a phone, so really, it’s not a bad deal.
 
Yet, that still means that a family of four, with both parents working minimum wage jobs, as over 1/2 the country does, is paying R$387.00 (US$78.00) a month for internet and cellular services.
 
When a family makes R$2500.00 (US$500.00) a month, that’s close to 18% of their income, that’s a lot.
 
Now add in the cost of the phones, which are often financed for two years at interest rates of 10% a month which is 420% a year, yes, you read that right, 420%.
 
Borrowing money in Brazil is comparable to borrowing money from the mafia in other countries, yet so many people do it, because they want an internet connection.
 
And add in the cost of things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney and Apple+ on family plans, which aren’t expensive in Brazil, all four cost R$75.00 (US$15.00) a month, much less than in many other countries.
 
Still, it’s easy to see that for many Brazilians access to the internet is expensive, for half the country it literally affects the amount of food you can eat and what neighborhood you can afford to live in.
 
So, yes, there are poor people on Quora, even if internet services in Brazil are 20% of the price they are in the United States.
 
The other answers I have read to this question also say the same thing. For a large percentage of people, the internet isn’t cheap.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My entire adult life I’ve either been in the US Army, or worked for them as a contractor. In my travels I’ve encountered pockets of astonishing ignorance ranging from people not knowing that there are other countries in the Americas (hint: there are) to people not knowing the Christianity didn’t exist prior to Jesus (he was a Jew), to people believing that autism is caused by vaccines (the one thing we do know is that it *isn’t* caused by vaccines), to others thinking that prayers alone could cure cancer (sadly, this is untrue as well).
 
I think my favorite one of them all is a woman who was dre
Continue Reading
My entire adult life I’ve either been in the US Army, or worked for them as a contractor. In my travels I’ve encountered pockets of astonishing ignorance ranging from people not knowing that there are other countries in the Americas (hint: there are) to people not knowing the Christianity didn’t exist prior to Jesus (he was a Jew), to people believing that autism is caused by vaccines (the one thing we do know is that it *isn’t* caused by vaccines), to others thinking that prayers alone could cure cancer (sadly, this is untrue as well).
 
I think my favorite one of them all is a woman who was dreadfully ignorant of … well… pretty much everything really, but her lack of understanding about anything involving Hawaii amused me.
 
As we were waiting for our children (who were classmates and friends) to get out of school she lamented to me that her husband was being reassigned from Fort Huachuca, Arizona to Fort Shafter, Hawaii. I asked her what the problem was with moving over there? Was it the economy and how expensive some things were over there? No. Was it being so far from family? No. Was it because they had to board pets in quarantine for a while (I couldn't remember if they had pets)? No.
 
After I finally ran out of reasons why the move could be so traumatic, I flat out asked her. It turns out she was feeling overwhelmed by all the things needed to be done in preparation of the move, and the need to get a passport.
 
"Passport? That's cool, plan on doing a little traveling on the way to Hawaii? Where are you going?"
 
She looked at me like I suddenly grew a leg out of my head. "We're just going to Hawaii."
 
Befuddled I asked why they would need to get a passport if they weren't planning on doing any foreign travel. "Because it's Hawaii!"
 
"You do know that Hawaii is one of the states in the US, right?"
 
"Of course, I'm not stupid."
 
"I only said that because passports are only needed for foreign travel, and I can't imagine a flight from here would take you to a foreign country"
 
"It's because we have to fly over the ocean."
 
"..."
 
Because apparently flying over the ocean means you have to obtain a passport. She was also worried about learning a new language... she didn't believe me that English was the primary language spoken there.
 
Heh.
 
I ran into her randomly last year in the DC area and asked if they ever managed to get in some foreign travel since they already had their passports (because of course she went got them since I was clearly wrong). Turns out that no, they didn't manage to get their passports stamped after all.

Continue Reading
Oh my goodness…where do I start…
 
I am not an american btw…
 
My ex-boyfriend (from the U.S) asked my dad once if Ontario was a state, or a country.
 
My friend (from Texas) told me she doesn’t know how she is alive because she never drinks water. She said she drinks gatorade after track, but was genuinely amazed she was still alive because she didn’t drink plain old water.
 
One time, our Canadian hockey team was playing against a Michigan team… over the phone I asked a customer at work (from Michigan) if he watched the game. He said he did, but he wasn’t sure where British Columbia was in the U.S.A, and assumed it was somewhere near New York.
 
A Montana server asked me if i lived in an igloo, and later, if I knew what Walmart was.
 
A police officer who stopped me in Utah asked me who our president was in canada, I said we have a prime minister. He said “No, I said CANADA… not England”. I just agreed with him, i didn’t want to end up in Provo prison for being a smart ass.
 
In Wyoming, I once was asked what language we speak in Canada. When I said “english” the woman responded “You must know we hate French people, otherwise you wouldn’t be lying about your native tongue!” and then winked at me. I still don’t know if she was being sarcastic or genuinely thought i was lying. I don’t even know how to ask for directions in french…why would I speak french when i sound like I talk through my nose and say ‘eh’ after every question… Even Quebec people don’t even sound french…
 
My south african cousin asked a woman in best buy for “iphone hook-ups” and she thought he was hitting on her. All he wanted was a charger for his phone, she asked him why he didn’t just say that in the first place. She also said she liked his British accent, he said he was South African, and she laughed and said he was funny.
 
During a visit in 2015, one woman on the NYC subway loudly asked her friend why ISIS named themselves after an Americas Next Top Model Contestant. I’ve seen that season… although momunental for the LTBTQ crowd, it certainly wouldn’t have influenced muslim extremists. What made it worse was her friend said “I think they did it to mislead the public or something…” and when a helpful commuter said quietly “its an acronym actually” they both looked at him as if he had two heads and said “we don’t really need your help thanks…”
 
NOTE: most of these people were so so lovely, but i was just surprised at the small world some people live in. I’m sure this rings true in other places in the world, but man… i’ve had a lot of run-ins with ignorance.

Continue Reading
Poor sounds such a negative word which makes any individual with little money and/or possessions are somehow a lower level of society. Really the opposite is true.
 
I have only little money in the bank and few possessions which are much more than some but a lot less than others. I budget right down to the last penny and make sure my partner and I do our best to spend our money wisely. We often have little food in cupboards but not completely empty.
 
I struggle everyday with physical and mental difficulties which are difficult plus I care for my partner too. We have been together 10 years and have 2 gorgeous beautiful cats who we love very much. I also now have a small family due to loss and grief but I still have some family, ones who I am very close to. Currently I am studying Higher Education Certictifcate in Children and Families and after I hope to gain a BA degree, maybe even one day an MA!!
 
Yes I am poor as I have little money and only a few posssesions but what I do have is family, a partner I love plus his family, 2 cats who bring us both joy, one lovely and very supportive friend, a kind heart, a decent enough brain, passion, determination, and the drive to work hard and succeed in life.
 
I don't want to live off others I want to help others. I want to learn and I want to learn from others who are experienced and knowledgable in thier field. They inspire me everyday with thier hard work and love of wanting change in the world. I know what it is like to be judged and to be seen as something you are not. I know what it is like to be a very highly sensitive child and have a need for reassurance and security, I know what it is like to be a ‘service user’ or ‘patient’ of both physical and mental illness and feel frustrated with the difficulties of health and social care services.
 
I want to work my way up to a place where I am no longer ‘poor’ as in having little money but will stay wonderfully rich in all the other areas of my life maybe even more so. Also keep my morals and principles, being the fair and decent person I like to see myself as and still in 20, 30 or 40 odd years time or however long I have on this earth when I will hopefully be reunited with my loved ones I have lost. I have to have faith in that as if i didn't have faith I would have nothing.
 
So yes there are poor people on this site but most will only be poor in one area or part of thier life with regards to money. Most other areas will be rich and full of love and life. When you have little money you value what is actually important in life.

article:
Not knowing the year in which the declaration of independence was signed doesn't define whether a person is ignorant or not. Conversely someone can be extremely ignorant and still know every date there is to learn.
 
Anyhow, I have a funny story to share regarding this matter. Before I start I want to state that I do not judge Americans as stupid people, I genuinely believe that there are stupid people in every country and in all classes of society. At least they give us a good laugh from time to time.
 
So, last year I went to Los Angeles for a conference. I arrived quite late, I was alone and supe
Continue Reading
Not knowing the year in which the declaration of independence was signed doesn't define whether a person is ignorant or not. Conversely someone can be extremely ignorant and still know every date there is to learn.
 
Anyhow, I have a funny story to share regarding this matter. Before I start I want to state that I do not judge Americans as stupid people, I genuinely believe that there are stupid people in every country and in all classes of society. At least they give us a good laugh from time to time.
 
So, last year I went to Los Angeles for a conference. I arrived quite late, I was alone and super hungry, so I decided to get some dinner at the hotel I was staying at. Personally I don't fancy the typical American food that much so I just ordered a salad. Now, I know salad dressings are a big thing in the US but I asked the waiter for some olive oil on the side instead. Probably that triggered his foreigner-radar (of course my accent already did that but it's less cool in the story) and after bringing my food he started chatting with me.
 
“So where are you from ?”
 
Being familiar with my country being easily overlooked in geography classes around the world I decided to go for the safe option:
 
“I'm from Europe” ( I've always felt very European by the way).
 
“What like Italy?” he asked while giving me a handsome smile.
 
At that point I felt kind of flattered because I love Italy and I've even been learning Italian for several years now. However I don't look Italian at all, but okay, thanks for the compliment.
 
“I'm from Belgium,” I told him.
 
“Oh, so you are German !” He said this not even as a question but as a simple factual deduction.
 
I honestly didn't know whether I should start laughing or feel sorry for the guy. After pretending to take a sip from my glass (I was laughing so hard inside that it was both physically and mentally impossible to actually drink) I tried to explain myself a bit better.
 
“Well, I know it's hard to believe but actually Belgium is a country, you know, like Italy and Germany are also countries.”
 
He stares at me blankly (he was kind of cute actually).
 
I gave it another try:
 
“You've probably heard about Brussels? There was a terror attack two weeks ago.”
 
“I'm so sorry to hear that. Is Brussels far from Belgium ?”
 
At this point I could just stammer something in the sense of “actually it's our capital...”
 
I still don't know how I did not burst out with laughter right in his face, but I didn't and we chatted a bit more, but geography did not make it to the conversation anymore.

title: What is a good at home workout routine for intermediate beginners?
article:
How do you get the best results possible with the least time invested?
 
Full-body workouts.
If you are a beginner do them twice per week, and if you are intermediate or advance then you can do them three times per week.
 
I would also add in that another great option for advanced trainers is a 4-day upper lower split. But that is for people with especially good recovery abilities.
 
It amazes me how much the bodybuilding industry has confused the shit out of people. Telling them to workout 6 times per week, eat 2 grams of protein per pound of bodyweight, and other useless nonsense. Sure that works for 
Continue Reading
How do you get the best results possible with the least time invested?
 
Full-body workouts.
If you are a beginner do them twice per week, and if you are intermediate or advance then you can do them three times per week.
 
I would also add in that another great option for advanced trainers is a 4-day upper lower split. But that is for people with especially good recovery abilities.
 
It amazes me how much the bodybuilding industry has confused the shit out of people. Telling them to workout 6 times per week, eat 2 grams of protein per pound of bodyweight, and other useless nonsense. Sure that works for the guys taking steroids, but all it does for a natural trainer is lead them nowhere. Yeah, you might experience results in a few months, but after that you’ll stagnate.
 
Full-body workouts on the other hand, are the perfect routines for natural trainers. They offer enough volume, but not too much to where you can’t recover from. In addition, you’re joints and central nervous system get more of a break and time to recover because you’re not training as often.
 
All you need in a full-body workout is a major push, a major pull, and a major legs exercise. The intermediate and advance could also benefit from some assistance exercises for the arms and calves. But other than that, this is all you will ever need to grow. I currently am 6′1 and weigh 203 lbs, at 11 percent body fat. And I have been on a maintenance routine only lifting weights twice per week and sprinting on a third day. I haven’t gained any mass (hence the maintenance routine) but I still have continued to gain strength. One of my example workouts was this:
 
Weighted Dips: Work up to max set of 5 reps
 
Weighted Chin-ups: Work up to max set of 5 reps
 
Squats: Work up to max set of 5 reps
 
Calf raises and forearms: 2–3 sets of 10–15 reps
 
Will you get to be 250 at 5 % body fat and become some absolute beast?? Hell no, not even close. But no natural trainer will ever get that close. If you are around 6 feet tall, the most you can ever expect to weight at 10 percent body fat is probably 215 to 220. And those numbers are for someone with very great genetics.
 
I love how people think they need to follow the split routines 6 days per week because everyone else is doing it.
 
Well, how many people do you see that are big and strong? Not many. How many people do you see at the gym following those splits who are actually big and NOT taking steroids? Probably zero.
 
I talk about this in great detail in my book which you can find here: 
Basic But Brutal

I'm not sure what is your definition of perfect body but I will share the exercises that helped me improve my fitness to get in best shape of my life till now. As requested, here are my before & after pictures:
 
Before Transformation (100 kgs at 5′8″)
After Transformation
 
(72 kgs at 5′8″)
It took me two and half years to achieve this transformation. I couldn't afford a personal trainer and I also wanted to know everything about fitness so that I can keep myself fit for lifelong without becoming too much dependent on others. So, I read and learned everything I could about various kinds of exercises & diets. I experimented with various split & full body routines. I tried various kinds of diets such as ketogenic & carb-cycling. I achived different level of results with all.
 
So, based on my experience, I can tell you that there are many ways to achieve the transformation you want but you can't and shouldn't limit yourself to just three exercises. That's why I am including more than three exercises, but only those that are the best. If you can create a program around these
 
ten exercises, you will be making good progress :
Barbell Back Squat : 
It's
 
the best exercise for your lower body. If done in correct form, and if you go below parallel, it will work not only your quads but also hamstrings, glutes and core.
Deadlift
 
: 
Along with squats, deadlift is one of the best exercise to build overall mass and strength. It targets your posterior chain including hamstring, glutes, erector spine & lats. Your core gets a good workout and it also improves your grip strength & forearm size.
Standing Calves Raise
 
: 
I do it on smith machine standing on step board. It's best for calves.
Flat & Inclined
 
Bench Press : 
Best exercise for chest but also works your anterior deltoids(front shoulders) and triceps. You can also do pushups for same effect but you won't be able to use as much weight as in bench press.
Military Press : 
Best exercise to target shoulder.
Bent Over Barbell Rows : 
Good exercise for lats, middle back, biceps & core.
Pull Ups & Chin Ups
 :
 
Best exercise for lats & biceps.
Parallel Bar Dips
 : Best for triceps.
HIIT : 
For cardiovascular health & fat loss. Sprint for 30 seconds and then walk for 30 seconds. Repeat for total 15 to 20 mins.
Yoga Poses : 
For flexibility & proper alignment of body.
P.S. : I know Yoga is not a single exercise but I included it to put emphasis on importance of flexibility & mobility work. Other kinds of flexibility & mobility routines will work too.

“Poor” is a very relative term. Unless of course, you define it yourself.
 
Any one earning any less than $60 a month, is qualified to be classified as a “poor” person, one, particularly, UNDER the Below Poverty Line (BPL) classification.
 
Lets begin with my background. No, I am not poor, not as described by the government. I was 
extremely lucky 
to have been born into this house hold, wherein, my father is a very renowned professor and researcher, and my mother is a school teacher, and also a researcher at an University. We have a total income of about 2300$ every month, and that is WAY more than enough for all the luxuries one can think of in a span of 3 seconds.
 
We have a car, a 2 BHK flat, 2 inherited bungalows, and a rich heritage. I know, for a fact, that both my parents had to face very hard days, in his childhood, but I don’t have to, thanks to their sincerity in attaining education.
 
Oh, and I study in THE most premiere, and oldest school of my nation.
 
Then, what do I lack? Why am I even answering this question on Quora?
 
The answer, lies in my first sentence. I feel poor everyday. Why? Because, in the school I attend, all students are from extremely wealthy families, with an estimated average income of about $15,500. Pretty much everyone has at least 2 cars, with a chauffeur at their command at all times. They go for expensive dinners and trips. They all have iPhones, Gucci and Versace threads, expensive suits, and a lot of admirers.
 
On the other hand, I travel by public transport. My family has ONE car. I don’t have expensive watches, nor phones (not that I need them). Only the usual ones. I have common clothes (not cheapskate, but just 
normal
). We dine out at normal restaurants, and I have never been abroad. Only domestic.
 
Spending hours with these kind of people from societies that I don’t belong to, had been a very sad part of my life. I did not want to attend school anymore. I didn’t want to use public transport anymore. I was tired, sick of my life. The poor kid sleeping on the road would be jealous of my life, but I was sick of it.
 
Then, I thought about it, I thought how hard my parents work, just for my benefit. I thought, that I must give my parents, what I desire. Not expect them to give it to me. And here I am today, renowned all over my school, as THE artist, THE physicist, THE swimmer, and THE debator.
 
Yes, it was my self confidence, that helped me change myself. I am proud of my parents, and forever shall be. Thanks, mom and dad.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
I’ve been running every day since May 24, 2021 (today was Day 631!).
Yeah, I’m addicted to it now.
 
I’m sharing my story because when I first tried running every day back in 2020, I injured my ankle during a run and was sidelined for a few weeks. I would have avoided that if I listened to my body. This is your warning that
 running every day is risky
.
 
And even when you start running every day, remember, keep your easy days easy!
If you are a beginner, this is not for you.
 
It is better to build a foundation over months and years of easy runs and recovery days then it is to run every day.
 
Play the long 
Continue Reading
I’ve been running every day since May 24, 2021 (today was Day 631!).
Yeah, I’m addicted to it now.
 
I’m sharing my story because when I first tried running every day back in 2020, I injured my ankle during a run and was sidelined for a few weeks. I would have avoided that if I listened to my body. This is your warning that
 running every day is risky
.
 
And even when you start running every day, remember, keep your easy days easy!
If you are a beginner, this is not for you.
 
It is better to build a foundation over months and years of easy runs and recovery days then it is to run every day.
 
Play the long game first then come back.
 
Once it becomes hard to take a recovery day off then that is when you know you are ready.
Running becomes a habit
.
 
All right, here’s a checklist on how to make running every day easy:
Track your Streak: 
One of the best ways to build a habit and stay motivated for the long-term is to see how for you have come. Each milestone (10, 20, 30, 60, 90, 100, 200, 300, 365 days) gives a huge mental boost. The first 100 are the hardest, but then it feels easy.
Who You Run With: 
Never run alone. If you are not running with a friend or a run club, listen to your favorite artist for motivation. Create a Spotify playlist that makes you want to dance. Runners and Artists give you energy.
What to Prep: 
Set your shoes and clothes out the night before your run. If you run in the morning, set it in your room so you see it right when you wake up. If you run at night, pack your clothes and shoes the day before in a gym bag.
Where to Run
: Create a portfolio of your favorite routes near your home or work. Where have you already been training? You know these tracks, trails and streets like your own home, so you are confident going into these runs.
When to Run
: Run at the same time everyday. Block out the time on your schedule when it is the best time for you to run. The more consistent you are, the easier this gets. If your health is a priority, do it first thing in the morning every day after waking up so there are no excuses.
Listen to your Body
: You will know your body better than anyone if you built a base first. Recovery is key. If you aren’t recovering between runs, then walk. Go back to the foundations. Easy days, healthy nutrition, and adequate sleep are the foundation.
Why Do You Run
: There will be days that are going to be hard. Shitty weather. Low energy. Always remember why you started and who you are running for. We get to run.

article:

It happened during Boston bombing period.
 
I used to take train from Connecticut to NY. One day we heard about the Boston bombing and that Police are looking for details. It wasn’t clear as to who did it yet. At the same time an Indian guy named Sunil Tripathi went missing. It wasn’t clear if he had any links to bombing.
 
I was in train sitting beside window with my ear phones on. A white old lady entered the train, she looked around and was displeased that the only place available was beside me. Very unhappily she sat beside me. She started saying something

It could be ignorant or racist American.
 
It happened during Boston bombing period.
 
I used to take train from Connecticut to NY. One day we heard about the Boston bombing and that Police are looking for details. It wasn’t clear as to who did it yet. At the same time an Indian guy named Sunil Tripathi went missing. It wasn’t clear if he had any links to bombing.
 
I was in train sitting beside window with my ear phones on. A white old lady entered the train, she looked around and was displeased that the only place available was beside me. Very unhappily she sat beside me. She started saying something to me, I removed my ear phones and said sorry I couldn’t hear you.
 
Then she started bashing me and all Indians saying that we don’t have manner and are rude and we come to USA only to bomb people there. You can imagine all kinds of racist rants. I was surprised and trying to understand what was going on then ticket collector came saw everything going on saw the lady, he just ignored and walked off. He was the same guy who used to smile and had a little talk whenever he came to check my ticket. That day he gave me very cold look. The lady continued.
 
I started getting scared and seriously didn’t understand why she was shouting at me. Then she asked another black guy who sitting on another seat if he would like to trade places with her, he just replied saying “no way, I am not sitting beside her” with an expression on face as if I am some kind of parasite. I was shocked that Blacks are victims of racism and he still did the same to me.
 
There were some school girls they told the old lady to calm down and told her to sit somewhere else if she has a problem with me. High school girls were much better people that lady, man and TC. Then I answered her that she is bothering me unnecessarily and that if she has a problem with she can stay away from me. She started lecturing me about manners and I told her that she doesn’t have the right to lecture unless she pays my bills.
 
She continued to rant, I put my ear phones on trying to ignore her and trying hard to control tears and anger. I got down at my station with that lady shouting behind me. After some time Sunil’s name was cleared that he committed suicide for his personal reasons and had nothing to do with bombing. It became clear that people who bombed are not Indians, then TC started being nice to me. I couldn’t be normal with him anymore so I stopped talking when he did. I used to just smile and nod and not answer.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
There is no 'typical' gym workout. 
 
The most important things:
Have a habit-based goal (i.e. I will train 3x per week)
Have a clear, measurable, outcome-based goal (i.e. I want to add 50 pounds to my 1 RM deadlift)
Habit-based goals reward behavior independent of outcome. Outcome based goals inspire you to constantly improve. These two things will dictate the nature of your workout sessions. 
 
Is your primary goal related to body composition? Size gain? Feeling good about yourself? Trying to be more active? 
 
We can take an unlikely lesson from Alice in Wonderland:
Alice
: I was just wondering if you 
Continue Reading
There is no 'typical' gym workout. 
 
The most important things:
Have a habit-based goal (i.e. I will train 3x per week)
Have a clear, measurable, outcome-based goal (i.e. I want to add 50 pounds to my 1 RM deadlift)
Habit-based goals reward behavior independent of outcome. Outcome based goals inspire you to constantly improve. These two things will dictate the nature of your workout sessions. 
 
Is your primary goal related to body composition? Size gain? Feeling good about yourself? Trying to be more active? 
 
We can take an unlikely lesson from Alice in Wonderland:
Alice
: I was just wondering if you could help me find my way.
Cat
: Well that depends on where you want to get to.
Alice
: Oh, it really doesn't matter...
Cat
: Then it really doesn't matter which way you go.
 
In other words, you must be clear on the destination before you begin the journey. 
 
Before we go on, let's dispel a common myth: 
There is no 'perfect' workout. There are simply degrees of effectiveness based on your goals, training age, training history, genetics, etc. 
 
If you want to get strong, functional strength an upper body and lower body split is a great way to go. 
I prefer to use primarily free weights (barbells and dumbbells, and bodyweight), which tend to recruit a higher percentage of muscle fibers
Your idea rep range will depend on your goals. Check out Prilepin tables for a rough guide:
Your rest periods will depend on your training. The heavier you're lifting, the longer rest you need between sets. If you're training in the 1-5 rep range, you may need 4-5 minutes rest between sets. This will decrease as you move to lower rep ranges. If you're training with 9-12 reps, you may only need 30-60 seconds of rest between sets. (Keep in mind this is just a rough guideline)@
Push yourself to technical failure (not absolute failure). Meaning: once your form stars to deteriorate, you should stop within 1-2 reps. Remember: your body ALWAYS adapts to EXACTLY what you do and continuing to train after technical failure will engrain bad movement patterns. 
Definitely listen to music! Anything that helps get you in the right head space and contributes to a positive training experience is a huge bonus. Music has powerful psychological effects and it is smart to harness these in training. 
Some recommended books that helped me early in my journey:
Starting Strength by Mark Rippetoe
5/3/1 by Jim Wendler
Stretching Scientifically by Thomas Kurz
How to Eat, Move, and Be Healthy by Paul Chek
