Recently, I have. I’ve started working out because I want to have a good physique when I am older and because of the Beep test, the Beep test is a test of endurance and stamina in which many students participate in. I’ve started working on my stamina, endurance, strength and overall fitness.
 
I return from school at 4:10 pm, once I get home, I sit with a healthy snack and watch some YouTube and study. At 6 pm. That’s when I start lifting, I don’t have my own dumbbells/weights, so I use my tenant’s (I have permission to). Simple, easy lifting, I don’t know how much the weight is but I am just 13, so it’s not so much. I lift for 30 mins - 1 hr. Then I take my dog for a walk, after walking my dog, I put her back inside and go to jog. First several seconds I brisk walk, then I walk a bit faster, after, once I’ve reached the end of the sidewalk, where I must turn right to continue onto the sidewalk, I start to jog, once I’ve crossed another patch of the roads, I start to run, then jog, then brisk walk, then just walk. Sometimes I try and run the whole way, but it usually doesn't work.
 
After that, I head back inside, by the time I’m back, it’s usually late (around 7:40 or 8:15 pm), still, I continue to exercise, Russian twists, jumping jacks, squats, push-ups (modified), stretching, etc…
 
It feels nice to use the energy I have after school instead of sitting around and playing video games until 12 am, that’s what I used to do, but once I realized just how important my health is, I started working out. You can use this schedule too, but if you don’t have dumbbells/weights, I recommend using filled milk cartons or something heavy which you can grasp and lift. I am also thinking about getting a gym membership and a gym nearby, so maybe get one of those, they cost money but it’s worth it.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
This was early in my medical school days, I was in my second year and the year was 1985.
 
I was schooling in the Peoples republic of Bulgaria.
 
So I went on holidays back to Nigeria. There I bought a lovely English language textbook of Anatomy. To aide my study since I had just learned Bulgarian. Chamberlain text of Anatomy I think it was called.
 
Passed via London to do some shopping before heading back to Sofia. Landed at Gatwick.
 
Sitting on the Gatwick express train for London. I was reading from the book when I was noticed by a group of middle aged Americans. It became clear that I was the item o
Continue Reading
This was early in my medical school days, I was in my second year and the year was 1985.
 
I was schooling in the Peoples republic of Bulgaria.
 
So I went on holidays back to Nigeria. There I bought a lovely English language textbook of Anatomy. To aide my study since I had just learned Bulgarian. Chamberlain text of Anatomy I think it was called.
 
Passed via London to do some shopping before heading back to Sofia. Landed at Gatwick.
 
Sitting on the Gatwick express train for London. I was reading from the book when I was noticed by a group of middle aged Americans. It became clear that I was the item of their attention and discussion. Then a lady from their group stretched over and asked me.
 
Lady : Excuse me, are you a medical student?
 
I: Yes I am.
 
Whole group in unison : Really!
 
Lady: Where do you school?
 
I: Bulgaria.
 
Whole group in unison : R E A L L Y !!
 
Lady: Is that not behind the iron curtain?
 
I: Yes it is in the South eastern Europe.
 
Lady: Well I never.
 
To be honest I was pretty much offended. What is so special about a dark skinned boy reading an anatomy book in London that should attract their attention?
 
Did they feel there are no medical schools in eastern Europe?
 
Or is an educated dark skinned guy so rare where they come from?
 
As a redeeming Grace for the U.S.
 
Stayed at Sheraton Heathrow hotel ( as I was flying out of there and they had free bus rides to London central )
 
Met a lovely couple with their daughter and son at the pool. He was with the U.S. military and attached to their Embassy in the USSR. They had been there a few years.
 
We had very educated conversation over dinner. They invited me
 
The conversation was in Russian ( My mother tongue )
 
They were probably the most down to earth and educated Americans I ever met.

Anyway, as the ox got heavier, the man carried it. Eventually when the ox was a big mature ox, the man had very big muscles and could lift an ox. Which weighs a few hundred pounds. He went from carrying a baby ox to something huge.

Continue Reading
So there's this story of a Greek man who bought an ox. Everyday he had to carry it up mountain to let it drink from a spring. I think the movie Holes showed this to some extent. Anyway, as the ox got heavier, the man carried it. Eventually when the ox was a big mature ox, the man had very big muscles and could lift an ox. Which weighs a few hundred pounds. He went from carrying a baby ox to something huge. 
 
This story is a simplified example of the principle of overload, specificity, and profession. 
 
To grow muscles you need to overload them. To an extent. Small micro tears from training will stimulate new repairs and extra bulk be added to the muscle fibers. So if you had to carry or life a 50 pound object everyday, at first it will be hard, eventually it would get easier until it'll be no effort at all.  But eventually the body will adapt to the point where you need to add more weight if you want to get stronger or bigger. 
 
That's the principle of overload and profession. 
 
The principle of specificity basically says, if you want to get good at running, run more. Specify in what you want to achieve in. If you want to be able to life more weight, life more weight. If you want to be a good mountain climber, climb more mountains etc.
 
So there you have it. To get stronger you need to do more. Stress the body more. 
 
Look into nutrition. Much of "reaping the benefits" of training occur in the kitchen. Consume healthy fats and proteins. Limit carbs but keep in mind that carbs are needed for insulin which help stimulate muscle growth. 
 
Also if you ever do get back into the gym. 
1-5 reps = strength 7-10 = mass 11+ = endurance 
 
As for now, purchase some body weights and train with those. Doing pull-ups with an extra twenty pound weight on your chest is hard! Good luck.

title: Is it good to do weightlifting every day?
article:
In 1999, I was a rookie with the Detroit Tigers. After a game, I strode confidently into the Kansas City Royals’ weight room, rested the weight bar on my shoulders and settled in for some heavy squats.  I rocked my hips back and dropped into my form, feeling totally in control. On the way back up, I got stuck. I leaned forward and the bar spilled over my neck. More than 500 pounds went violently crashing to the floor and members of both teams turned to look.
 
Luckily, nothing was injured that day other than my pride.  It could have been much worse.  I was over-trained; I had an intense weight tr
Continue Reading
In 1999, I was a rookie with the Detroit Tigers. After a game, I strode confidently into the Kansas City Royals’ weight room, rested the weight bar on my shoulders and settled in for some heavy squats.  I rocked my hips back and dropped into my form, feeling totally in control. On the way back up, I got stuck. I leaned forward and the bar spilled over my neck. More than 500 pounds went violently crashing to the floor and members of both teams turned to look.
 
Luckily, nothing was injured that day other than my pride.  It could have been much worse.  I was over-trained; I had an intense weight training session the day before and was just coming off playing nine innings.  “More is better” was my mantra, but I was naïve.
 
At 23, I lifted heavy weights every day. Now, I lift three days a week. I’m not quite as strong, but I’m inching closer to that 500 pound threshold now that I understand the importance of rest and recovery.  If I understood how the body repairs itself when I was a rookie, I would have been stronger, healthier, and a better baseball player.
 
It’s essential to incorporate recovery days into your program so your muscles can adequately repair themselves, grow and become stronger. When we train with weights, we actually create small tears in our muscle fibers. Those fibers then repair and rebuild bigger and stronger while we rest.  If you don’t build in that downtime, you break the muscle fibers down further reducing the chance for solid growth and increasing the risk of injury.
 
If your ultimate goal is size and strength, avoid weight training, even targeting separate muscle groups, on consecutive days.
 
Your body only builds muscle when you are not weight training.  Trust the process, believe in the value of rest, and you’ll be significantly stronger as a result.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
The answer depends on your diet, age, workout history/starting point, genetics, intensity, volume, and frequency of compound training. If you miscalculate and overestimate your tolerance and neglect proper recovery and neglect dietary considerations, in time, you will overtrain, leading to a complete stop and often ends with injuries.
 
If you are Powerlifting, 3 -4 weekly sessions of Powerlifting movements such as variants of deads, squats, bench, and assistant exercise is enough. At one point, I trained 5 days a week, but for the rest of the week, I ate and slept a lot.
Any more training with co
Continue Reading
The answer depends on your diet, age, workout history/starting point, genetics, intensity, volume, and frequency of compound training. If you miscalculate and overestimate your tolerance and neglect proper recovery and neglect dietary considerations, in time, you will overtrain, leading to a complete stop and often ends with injuries.
 
If you are Powerlifting, 3 -4 weekly sessions of Powerlifting movements such as variants of deads, squats, bench, and assistant exercise is enough. At one point, I trained 5 days a week, but for the rest of the week, I ate and slept a lot.
Any more training with compounds, you will be wasting your time unless you have mastered your diet and sleep schedules, or, training for competition. In that case, you increase training frequency, reduce stresses while joggling volume and intensity. Usually, you would be working with a decent coach.
If you are Oly lifting, all movements are compound and multi-joints. You can train every day as long as you don't go heavy every time you touch the bar. In the past, I have trained Oly lifting at a high weekly frequency when learning to Snatch and Clean. I visited the Weightlifting Club thrice-weekly, working with a coach, and I trained another two weekly sessions solo to keep up with the homework. That's five days of weekly training. In that case, you need to rest, or you will pay the price.
 
It is an art.
 
Cheers,
 
Pic: Me - Heavy (heavy for me ) training. Light-Weight Training
 
Disclaimer:
 
Mansour’s disclaimer:
 
Don't do anything stupid and get hurt lifting big weights after reading some of my answers. It would make us both quite unhappy. Consult a 
Medical Doctor
, a 
Strength Training coach
, and 
common-sense specialist
 before doing anything you may read in some of my answers.
 
Medical Considerations

I experienced walking kilometers to stores to ask if they would let us have bas

I had never considered our Family poor… even in the past where we struggled to keep food on the table 3 times a day. As a family of 9 I know my parents had struggled a lot to send us to school. They are both Farmers and in the Philippines being a Farmer is hard, Farm necessities are expensive and the prices of the produce just depends on the prices in the market as Farmers are just Price takers. I had seen my mama cried because my older Siblings needed money for school and nobody would lend her the money she needs. I experienced walking kilometers to stores to ask if they would let us have basic goods like salt and sugar for credit only for them to refuse as we still have outstanding balance. Most of the time we don’t have money to buy snacks at school. Almost all my clothes are handdown from my sisters. But all this things doesn’t made me feel poor. Mostly because of my Mother’s teaching…she always say we are not poor; we have a roof over our head, we are able to go to school, we have food despite the difficulty and most of all we have each other to lean on. This I had strongly believed was and will always be my greatest treasure in life. No one is poor as one way or another we have wealth in each of us, and this wealth can never be measure by how much money you have in the bank or how expensive your gadgets are. Knowledge is wealth, good health is wealth, love is wealth, genuine Friends is wealth and Everyone in this world is born and raised with these Wealth all around us. This is the world’s way of being fair to Everyone, by being unfair; No one can have it all. In a world where people see themselves of what they lack and take for granted what we already had, I hope I made you felt Rich. Everyone is Poor as Everyone is Rich in their own ways. Have a great day Everyone!

Hang in there, some people might not get parts of this.
 
So I used to work in technical support for around 13 years. I don’t anymore but I used to. I've had the (dis)pleasure of talking to some fairly ignorant people who can't figure out tech to save their lives. Probably the most ignorant of all, though, was when I had a customer lose data because he had incorrectly modified a database entry via our product’s GUI. The call went something like this:
 
Me: I see in the database that an inclusion was changed to a exclusion, and that's why your data was deleted from the backup.
 
Customer: well I want you on open an engineering ticket because it's a flaw in your product.
 
Me: Sir, I could do that, but there is no fault in the product here. Someone changed a drive inclusion to an exclusion, causing the drive to be removed from your backups.
 
Customer: Nobody edited anything, we've only added inclusion/exclusions, nothing edited.
 
At this point, it's clear this guy doesn't understand what I'm trying to tell him, so I send him a screenshot showing the row edited is not the last row in the database (which would mean a new entry vs an edited row)
 
Me: So as you can see, someone edited the entry and did not insert a new row. Is it possible someone else changed it?
 
Customer: are you calling me a liar? I'm the only one else who has access to the application.
 
Me: well sir I didn't edit it…
 
This call went on for over an hour…and despite the fact that I even showed the guy an event log showing his user account updated it, this guy still refused to admit he changed something instead of adding an additional entry. To top it off, this guy was the director of IT for his company, a position that I would assume would have some basic understanding of how databases worked.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:

Pre-Workout meal-

Warmup 
- Get your blood flowing a little before you hop on a bench and start pressing. Warmup your muscles before you start lifting heavy, create a mind-muscle connection and then start your actual workout.
After workout-

Continue Reading
Before workout-
Pre-Workout meal- 
It’s necessary to have something before you’re heading to the gym, you can’t push your limits on an empty stomach. If it’s a heavy meal then let your food digest first, wait for 3–4 hours before you start lifting and if it’s just a small snack then an hour is enough.
Warmup 
- Get your blood flowing a little before you hop on a bench and start pressing. Warmup your muscles before you start lifting heavy, create a mind-muscle connection and then start your actual workout.
After workout-
Post-Workout meal
- If there was a pre workout meal, then there has to be a post workout meal. Why? Because you just hammered those muscles, your body is depleted of energy and that’s why this meal is the most important meal of the day. 
Yes, the most important meal of the day. 
I see folks in my gym who smoke cigarettes and consume a packet of chips after lifting weights. Please, don’t do that.
Water
 - Water is your body's principal chemical component and makes up about 60 percent of your body weight. It’s important to stay hydrated through out the day, I drink a liter before my workout then a liter during my workout and then a liter after my workout. If you’re drinking enough water then your body will stop holding on to it. Hence, weight loss.
Sleep - 
We sleep in cycles.
 
And our body recovers during deep sleep.
 
So, longer sleep results in longer deep sleep and longer deep sleep results in better recovery.
 
NO RECOVERY = NO GAINS
Supplements
 - I believe it’s really hard to get all necessary nutrients from our regular diets, some people can do that, I agree, but not me. And there are so many of them, choose a supplement according to your goals. I’m currently taking Omega 3, Multi-vitamins and Creatine Monohydrate.
Let The Gains Begin!

Establish a workout routine with these 6 elements as most experts agree a well-balanced exercise program should have these 6 elements:
 
1. Aerobics - Cardio Fitness and Training
.
 
2. Strength and Resistance and Core Exercise Programs
 
3. Additional Strength and Resistance Program and Core Program for Variety as this variety will keep you motivated.
 
4. Stability and Balance Training.
 
5. Flexibility Maintenance - Stretching.
 
6. Variety in Workouts.
 
Exercise programs become boring. It’s important to know how to keep your exercise program interesting and something you look forward to doing. We wrote a book “Golf Fitness: An All Inclusive Workout Program for Golfers Only” which has all six elements plus different exercises which are important to change your routine and keep you motivated and help you make workouts become more interesting.
 
Most of us have a daily routine of getting up in the morning, going to work, coming home, etc. Visualize yourself going to the gym as a vacation or a holiday from your daily routine.
 
You should change your exercises if you’ve been going to the gym on schedule and you don’t see any improvement. If you train the same way every time you go to the gym, your body tends to adapt.
 
Even though it’s generally good to change your routine every 4 to 6 weeks, you can change your routine any time any of the exercises become boring. New exercises present new challenges.
 
You should come out of the gym energized and stimulated. If you find you are not as energized as you were before, substitute new exercises.
 
Talk to your gym about these six elements you need to keep yourself fit and establish your routine and change exercises every 4 to 6 weeks.
 
A workout buddy is also helpful to keep you motivated.

In January 2010, my then fiancé (she’s now my wife) went to Meteor Crater in Arizona; we went there as part of a larger holiday we were doing around the USA. As we were at the ticket booth, the middle aged lady from behind the counter asked us where we were from.
 
US: “We’re from Australia!”
 
Her: “Oh that’s far away”
 
Us: “Yep, 14hr flight”
 
Her: “So tell me…I’ve always wanted to know. Ya’ll have farms in Australia?”
 
Us: “Farms? Like to grow food?”
 
Her: “Yeah, where ya’ll get your food from? You have to import all of it right?”
 
Us: “Err…no, we have farms.”
 
Her: “Oh, what kind of farms?”
 
Us: “Errr… everything I guess. A lot of produce is grown in Australia. We also have a very big cattle industry.”
 
Her: “No way” (sounded incredibly surprised - like…her whole opinion of Australia just got turned on its head)
 
Us: (sensing we’re talking to someone who’s as surprised about Australia as when mankind first discovered fire) “Yeah we grow all sorts of things - it’s tropical in the north of Australia, and cold in the south. So we grow everything inbetween.”
 
Her: “Excuse me… tropical in the north? You mean it’s colder in the north?”
 
Us: “Errr…..no the north of Australia is a much warmer climate. The south is where they have the ski fields and the snow in winter.”
 
Her: “In the south…it snows?”
 
Us: “Err…yes.” (now we were the ones slightly confused)
 
She had no idea that A) Australian’s were able to sustain themselves by having their own agricultural industry; and B) that the southern hemisphere (if indeed she knew that’s where Australia was), has the opposite climatic regions as the northern hemisphere. My wife and I still joke about sometimes, wondering if when we go back to Meteor Crater, if she’ll still be there.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
As a Canadian, it's sometimes fun to mess with southerners. My favourite trick, pull out a toonie (Canadian $2 coin- google it if you don't know it). Tell them it isn't a single coin, but 2. When we use it, we only spend the middle coin. It's just so small, we hold it in the outer coin.
 
Then ask them to pop it out for you. It's funny how many fall for this.

As a Canadian, it's sometimes fun to mess with southerners. My favourite trick, pull out a toonie (Canadian $2 coin- google it if you don't know it). Tell them it isn't a single coin, but 2. When we use it, we only spend the middle coin. It's just so small, we hold it in the outer coin.
 
Then ask them to pop it out for you. It's funny how many fall for this.
 
Also, there are many Canadian jokes about Americans, many of which may paint them as the butt of a blonde joke (mean, I know) to things like tourists crossing the boarder with skis strapped to the roof of their cars. In summer! It doesn't help that some Americans reinforce these stereotypes when visiting.
 
There's a joke around Niagara about Americans thinking that the Niagara Falla are turned off at night. The funny part is the number of Americans that actually think this is true.
 
A friend of mine was working at a classy restaurant in downtown Niagara, right along the falls. It was 9:50, 10 minutes to closing. The last customers were finishing up and leaving when in walk a loud group of Americans demanding to be seating. She has no choice and decided to seat them anyways.
 
They were there eating and talking for over an hour.
 
When 11:15 rolled around, she was pretty pissed that they were still there, slowly meandering their way through dessert. When she asked how everything once, one of the tourists asked “So, when do they turn off the Falls?”
 
“The Niagara Falls?”
 
“Of course the Niagara Falls!”
 
Felling like having some playful revenge, she said, “Oh, I'm so sorry. They turn them off at 10:30. You've missed them for the evening.”
 
Extremely dejected, the group left.
 
The irony: their seat was along a window overlooking the falls. All they had to do was turn their heads and see it.

"You've got ingredients that are going to increase blood flow, increase heart rate, increase focus, increase blood flow to the skin and give you a little tingle," Moon told Live Science.
Pre workouts aren’t completely necessary. If you’re going for a casual workout, there’s really no need. There are other alternatives that give you a lot of energy before a workout…
 
For example:
Pretty much every Fruit (Bananas are the best).
Coffee
Fruit Smoothies
Oats
Chicken with Rice and Vegetables.
Greek Yogurt
Pros And Cons Of Pre-workout Supplements
Pros
Caffeine has been shown to block pain in the muscle during workouts (good for a one off race or event.)
A small study done with high level athletes taking high amounts of caffeine and carbohydrates after training had 66% more glycogen in their muscles four hours after finishing intense glycogen-depleting exercise than athletes who didn’t.
Improves focus
Improves stamina
Improves motivation
Improves energy
Cons
Over stimulating
Dehydration
Increased blood pressure
Addiction
Insomnia
Adrenal fatigue
Drug test fail (if a competing athlete in particular sports)
Energy crash
As you can see, there are multiple reasons for why you should or should not take pre workout. I personally don’t take pre workout supplements, instead I have foods (mainly fruit) before a workout.
 
If you find are consistently tired or demotivated at the gym, maybe it’s time you try some pre-workout. You can visit my website (last link in my bio) to find out some information on the supplements or indeed buy them. (When you reach the website, go to the “Items” page, and there you will see the pre workout supplements).

The last few years we’ve seen self-improvement guru’s telling people your workout needs to be done by 5 AM.
 
NOT TRUE!
 
There is even scientific evidence proving you should workout in the afternoon or evening.
Arnold Schwarzenegger definitely solved this problem by training twice a day in preparation for the Mr Olympia!
 
MUSCLE MASS DIFFERENCES MORNING VS EVENING
 
One study looked at people doing their strength workout between 6:30AM - 10:00AM and one people working out between 4:30PM - 8:00PM.
 
They found the men working out in the evening had 
more muscle mass
 than the morning group after 24 weeks.
 
STRENGTH DIFFERENCES MORNING VS EVENING
 
Another study looked at strength differences. The results won’t surprise you at this moment.
 
People working out in the evening increased there strength more than the morning group.
The famous strongman Hafthor Björnsson was at one point training thrice a day(!). He admitted that that might have been a bit too much though.
 
BODYBUILDERS’ BODY COMPOSITION
 
This study looked the body composition of bodybuilders. Unsurprising at this point:
 
The bodybuilders that worked out in the evening had better body composition than those who worked out in the morning.
 
The evening group had more fat-free mass and lower body fat percentages.
 
HOWEVER THE MOST IMPORTANT THING IS…
 
As always, we’re talking about averages here. And you are not a statistic.
 
If you have more strength and energy in the morning, you should hit the gym in the morning.
 
But don’t do your workouts in the morning just because some people tell you it’s better!
Thank you for reading and hopefully enjoying my answer.
 
Follow me on 
Quora
 to learn more, or follow my 
Twitter
 for daily tips and following my journey!

Year 2003 , I visited a small town in mid-west (in Kansas) . I lived in Germany those days but I was holding Indian Passport. I had traveler's check and wanted to cash in them. My friend lived in the town and he had a bank account so he advised me to go to the same bank with him.
 
I went to teller and the conversation starts
 
Teller Guy: do you have account with us Sir,
 
Me : no
 
He: May I see your ID please.
 
Me : I showed my Indian Passport. (I had a DL from Germany but I did not want to show an ID that is not in English)
 
He: Sir I want ID (Shows me his DL)
 
Me: This is Passport and It is also an ID.
 
He looked confused and asked to me go over a desk.
 
A lady was sitting there and I explained the issue. She did not have any idea about passport.
 
She called someone from the desk (She puts the speaker on and I guess in the same office or head office)
 
She: Hey there, here is a gentleman who has Passport for his ID. Do you know what is a passport?
 
Phone Voice: Hmmm, let me check …so Passport , yeah …this is a document that is used for international travel and sometime for domestic travel also. It has signature and photo and yes we can accept as an ID. (It looked like he was referring some notes)
 
She: okay , sounds good
 
Phone Voice: Hey, can you check, which state the passport is issued from !
 
Me: I show the passport to her. Cover page reads “Republic of India” .
 
She reads, It is republic…hmm…Indiana , Yes it is from Indiana
 
Phone Voice: We are good, this is from close by.
 
I did not say any word after that, showed my signature in the passport, signed the travelers check and cashed them in. Got the cash said thank you and just went out.
 
After we went inside the car, my friend and I laughed a loud.

We have to define poor. I'm certainly not rich. I live in a rented one bedroom apartment. I'll never fully own property. I don't have a car or have learnt to drive. I've gone bankrupt once (owing over £60,000), I can't get a fair credit card and I won't ever choose to get another loan. Most of the tech in my flat are gifts or castoffs. I built my own laptop firstly around 2000, although everything apart from the case and the soundcard have been replaced and upgraded as and when I can save money for a part. I have worked although due to a life changing accident 21 years ago there are many jobs I can't do. I have a university degree but I never worked in that field so it's useless. I chose not to breed and even had a vasectomy (free in the UK)
 
As for things that I do that poor people don't: I have a gym membership, and that certainly doesn't get wasted. I have Amazon prime, including the TV stick. When I was working I bought myself a motorcycle which is insured, taxed and maintained. I have a partner. We have a takeaway meal once a month. I have a principled objection to weekday daytime TV so will go the gym and have a shower there to keep my water bills even lower. We are partial owners of an 11 acre woodland site with clearing with a clubhouse (all the functions of a normal house except bedrooms). It does however have a 8 person hot tub and a proper sauna. My sofa is large, about a third of the size of the room it is in. I bought it brand new for £1042 although that was part of my redundancy I had left after I paid to go bankrupt.
 
So am I poor? When I go the supermarket do I have look at “luxuries" before deciding against them? Sometimes. Do I have a beer “out"? Sometimes. I never fly to exotic holiday destinatio nd (actually I don't fly).

There is no fix routine. Experiment and choose what works for you. Everyone has a different body and a different structure. For a start, you can follow a very basic routine as follow. I'm assuming your goal is muscle building.
 
Start every workout with a good 10–15 mins warmup and end with stretching.

Add Push-ups in warmups
 
Flat Bench Press
 
Yes Inclined/Declined Bench press
 
Dumbbell flyes
 
Skull Crushers
 
Triceps push downs
 
Parallel bar dips
 
Day 2 : Cardio
 
Walk/Jog/Run. You can do variations on treadmill and incline it in between. 15 mins
 
Spinning. No stopping and increasing & decreasing resistance. 15 mins
 
Cross Trainer . Try different type of training everytime. 15 mins
 
You can add more cardio if you want. Swimming, cycling, Rope skipping etc are also very good.
 
Day 3 : Back & Biceps
 
Add wide grip Pull ups in warmup.
 
Deadlifts
 
Lat Pull downs
 
Seated row
 
Rowing Bent over/ one arm dumbbell / T-bar
 
Biceps curls with dumbbells or barbell.
 
Preacher Curls
 
Hammer Curls
 
Day 4 : Complete Rest
 
Day 5 : Legs & Shoulders
 
Add bodyweight squats, twisters and some cycling in warmup.
 
Squats
 
Leg Extension/Leg press
 
Leg curl/Walking Lunges
 
Deadlift
 
Front Barbell raise
 
Shoulder press
 
Side lateral raise
 
Day 6 : Abdominals
 
Abdominal Crunches
 
Side crunches
 
Leg raise and hold
 
Russian Twist
 
Plank
 
Day 7 : Complete rest
 
For all exercises, do 8–12 reps and 3 sets each. Choose weight for which you can do these much sets and reps. Follow a routine for 45–60 days and then change to stay away from plateaus. These exercises are interchangeable on same days. Hit and trial and see what works best for you.
 
All the best. Keep lifting :)

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
It is possible to use single set/everyday training successfully. The main trick is NOT to train to failure and use a submaximal weight (80–90% of 1 rep max).
 
Training sessions need to be short too - under 35–45 minutes, to reduce the chances of overtraining.
 
Everyday training may not be that effective for gaining muscle size, but apparently it’s VERY EFFECTIVE for gaining strength.
 
The Bulgarian Olympic Weightlifting teams of the late 1980’s-early 1990’s, used to train 5–6 days per week, 5–6 times per day using short (under 45–60 minute) training sessions and limited their exercises to the compet
Continue Reading
It is possible to use single set/everyday training successfully. The main trick is NOT to train to failure and use a submaximal weight (80–90% of 1 rep max).
 
Training sessions need to be short too - under 35–45 minutes, to reduce the chances of overtraining.
 
Everyday training may not be that effective for gaining muscle size, but apparently it’s VERY EFFECTIVE for gaining strength.
 
The Bulgarian Olympic Weightlifting teams of the late 1980’s-early 1990’s, used to train 5–6 days per week, 5–6 times per day using short (under 45–60 minute) training sessions and limited their exercises to the competitive lifts (clean & jerk and snatch) and some auxillary exercises (squats, presses, etc). This high frequency training worked and the Bulgarians dominated Olympic and World Championship weightlifting, beating out the dominant weightlifting power at the time, the Soviet Union.
 
Pavel Tsatsouline and Steve Justa have written articles and books detailing their own versions of everyday, single set training.
 
I do think that single set, everyday training is probably more effective when multi-joint, compound exercises are used rather than single joint, isolation exercises. The compound exercises allow one to train the entire body using just a few exercises (squats, deadlifts, presses, rows, power cleans) and the training session will be short (under 45 minutes) which will allow proper recovery and avoid overtraining. I think that training the entire body with single set, isolation exercises would take too long and would impair proper recovery.
 
BUT, I do think that single set, isolation exercises can be effective if used to build up a lagging bodypart, like biceps or calves, and the rest of the body is trained with compound exercises.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
Creating a workout routine at home without any equipment and limited space can seem challenging, but it's totally doable! Let's dive into a workout plan that targets your entire body without needing fancy gym gear or a lot of room to move around.
 
First things first, warm-up time! Get your blood pumping with some jogging in place or high knees. Swing those arms and legs, twist your torso gently, and throw in some jumping jacks for good measure.
 
Now, let's tackle the upper body. Push-ups are your best friend here; aim for 3 sets of 10-15 reps. Need something for those triceps? Grab a chair or use 
Continue Reading
Creating a workout routine at home without any equipment and limited space can seem challenging, but it's totally doable! Let's dive into a workout plan that targets your entire body without needing fancy gym gear or a lot of room to move around.
 
First things first, warm-up time! Get your blood pumping with some jogging in place or high knees. Swing those arms and legs, twist your torso gently, and throw in some jumping jacks for good measure.
 
Now, let's tackle the upper body. Push-ups are your best friend here; aim for 3 sets of 10-15 reps. Need something for those triceps? Grab a chair or use an elevated surface for tricep dips, doing 3 sets of 10-15 reps. Don't forget about your core – plank variations like the standard plank, side plank, and plank with shoulder taps are excellent choices (hold each for 30-60 seconds).
 
Time to work those legs! Body-weight squats are fantastic; aim for 3 sets of 15-20 reps. Throw in some lunges (forward or reverse) with 3 sets of 10 reps for each leg. Want to activate those glutes? Try glute bridges or hip thrusts, doing 3 sets of 15-20 reps.
 
Let's give some love to your core muscles. Bicycle crunches (3 sets of 15-20 reps each side) and Russian twists (3 sets of 15-20 reps each side) are great picks. Finish off with leg raises or flutter kicks for 3 sets of 15-20 reps.
 
Feeling energetic? Add some cardio or high-intensity moves like jump squats, burpees (3 sets of 8-10 reps), and mountain climbers (3 sets of 30-45 seconds).
 
Finally, cool down with a slow jog or walk in place. Stretch out those muscles with gentle stretches for your hamstrings, quads, calves, chest, back, and shoulders.
 
Remember, listen to your body, take breaks when needed, and stay hydrated throughout your workout!

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
I hate to answer a question with a question, but I have to in this scenario: 
which routine are you actually going to stick with?
 
In undergrad, I did bro splits because 1) I went to the gym with my roommate and he did bro splits and 2) I was a college kid and had a lot of time on my hands. I could get to the gym five days a week because it was right there on campus; I had nothing else to worry about aside from classes.
 
I took about a decade off from the gym (let’s say from 2009 to 2017) and when I found my way back, I was thirty with a full-time job - I didn’t have the same amount of time to play
Continue Reading
I hate to answer a question with a question, but I have to in this scenario: 
which routine are you actually going to stick with?
 
In undergrad, I did bro splits because 1) I went to the gym with my roommate and he did bro splits and 2) I was a college kid and had a lot of time on my hands. I could get to the gym five days a week because it was right there on campus; I had nothing else to worry about aside from classes.
 
I took about a decade off from the gym (let’s say from 2009 to 2017) and when I found my way back, I was thirty with a full-time job - I didn’t have the same amount of time to play with. I opted to go with a push-pull-legs split - I figured I could at least get three days in. Ideally, it would have looked like this:
But a funny thing happened: if I had any kind of conflict at all, I skipped leg day. Board meeting runs late? Skip leg day. Get in an argument with my girlfriend? Skip leg day. Looks like rain outside? You get the idea. No excuse was too trivial.
 
Eventually, I realized that “leg day” - devoting an entire workout session to some of the most taxing exercises you can do - was psychologically overwhelming. So I moved to total body because it ensured that I worked legs and worked with my schedule. Yes, I still had to do squats and deadlifts, but 1) I didn’t have to do them on the same day and 2) I got to follow them up with what I like to call “dessert” exercises - curls, triceps pushdowns, etc.
 
However, just because total body works for me doesn’t mean it’s the best option for you. You know your schedule better than I do. And, more importantly, you know yourself - your tendencies, your weak areas, etc. Take all of that knowledge into consideration and then choose the option that works best for you.

article:
I realize I’m not sticking to the question, but I feel I need to offer a counter point.
 
I’m a California native with generic western looks and when travelling in the East (20 years ago) have encountered plenty of funny ignorance about the US and Americans like the idea that we all carry guns and shoot at other people at the drop of a hat.
 
I was in Singapore when that American kid was caned for vandalizing cars. Everyone was shocked there that the President of the US would actually step in to intervene, to prevent a juvenile delinquent from getting a simple punishment, the equivalent to our makin
Continue Reading
I realize I’m not sticking to the question, but I feel I need to offer a counter point.
 
I’m a California native with generic western looks and when travelling in the East (20 years ago) have encountered plenty of funny ignorance about the US and Americans like the idea that we all carry guns and shoot at other people at the drop of a hat.
 
I was in Singapore when that American kid was caned for vandalizing cars. Everyone was shocked there that the President of the US would actually step in to intervene, to prevent a juvenile delinquent from getting a simple punishment, the equivalent to our making a kid spend a couple of days in juvenile detention. No wonder America is so lawless and crime ridden, if you can do anything without fear of punishment.
 
I’ve received shocked comments regarding the fact that I can eat with chopsticks, or that I actually like sushi. I once had a host refuse to tell me what kind of soup I was eating (fermented sour fish belly) for fear I would freak out and throw up (I happily asked for another bowl). In general, most locals thought I ate nothing but fried chicken, steak, hamburgers, and meatloaf everyday. (Actually, that might not be far off for some Americans).
 
In Perth, Australia, everyone seemed to believe that I ran into movie stars on a daily basis and many people, complete strangers, asked if they could stay at my house if they were ever lucky enough to be able to make it to LA, which they considered to be some kind of paradise.
 
On the other hand, on my first visit to London, I asked the locals where I could get some fish and chips, only to be told that I would have to search out a tourist oriented place as mostly they were the only ones that ate it. The locals preferred pizza and Chinese.

Little time to spare for workouts

Continue Reading
That totally depends on your fitness goal
 
Full body workouts are usually performed for following reasons
Little time to spare for workouts
 – Full body is a great way to make sure every muscle group is engaged especially when you have just a day or two in week to workout along with incorporating cardioi.
Goal is just to have basic fitness
 – Again you want to make sure you follow very basic minimal fitness routine, full body is the way to go.
Secondary muscle engagement 
– What I really mean here is a lot of people love to just focus on cardio as their primary workout. However to be effective in cardio one has to develop basic muscle strength (like lower body and core) which could be developed by focusing on full body workout.
Working out 5 days a week usually is done by those
Who wants to focus in isolation on every single individual muscle group in order to make those muscles pop out
In case of an injury – if you have any specific injury its ideal to distribute your workout and perform each exercises slowly. This would prevent any further injury.
For people who are thin and want to put on muscle mass doing strength training in isolation is better than full body work out
Above points are just 
my perspective
. Every body type have different needs. For me, full body work outs work best to burn fat and gain agility. However 5 day workout with focus on different muscle groups each day with combination of cardio kind of helps me with better aesthetics and I feel much more stronger.
 
I usually do combination, if I want to take a break or give rest to my body by not doing tedious strength training workouts, I do full body workouts just to make sure I keep my body and muscles mobile 3 days a week and take rests of the days off.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
When I was a freshman in a public high school*, there was a whole new assortment of students… all of the public junior high kids were now thrown in with the local private school kids whose schools didn't go past eighth grade. There was the big Catholic institution and a bunch of smaller church schools that many of us had never heard of. After an adjustment period, most kids adapted without too much of a problem.
 
Then there were these two girls from one of the tiny church schools.
 
I was in a couple of general courses with them and I had never seen anything like it. I don't know that they were tau
Continue Reading
When I was a freshman in a public high school*, there was a whole new assortment of students… all of the public junior high kids were now thrown in with the local private school kids whose schools didn't go past eighth grade. There was the big Catholic institution and a bunch of smaller church schools that many of us had never heard of. After an adjustment period, most kids adapted without too much of a problem.
 
Then there were these two girls from one of the tiny church schools.
 
I was in a couple of general courses with them and I had never seen anything like it. I don't know that they were taught anything at all. They were fourteen, fifteen years old and they could barely read. The teacher would ask them to read a paragraph aloud and they would stammer and sound out words until she took the awful pressure off them and chose someone else. They didn't know basic geography. If you said something about India, they would give you a blank look and say something like, “My aunt says she’s part Cherokee.” They couldn't do basic math, find Africa on a map or explain to the home ec teacher why bread dough rises. The mean-girl joke at the time was that they knew how to make Popsicle-stick crosses and sing “Jesus Loves Me” but not much else.
 
This wasn't a fringe religion or an entity like the Amish, who keep isolated schools with rules about how far children are to be educated. This was a mainstream American Protestant religion, which was what was so incredible about it. Maybe the teachers were just completely indifferent and ran it like a daily Sunday school. I have no idea, but I know that it did the girls a real disservice when they joined us.
 
*in most American high schools, “Freshman” is the first year, or ninth grade.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I didn’t exactly meet this person but saw them on TV.
 
Twenty years ago I was home from work sick, I mean REALLY sick so that I barely had enough energy to keep my eyes open. The TV was on and a really stupid game show called ‘The Newlywed Game’ came on. I wasn’t interested in it but couldn’t get together enough energy to get up to change the channel (this was before remotes).
 
The premise of the show was that they got newlyweds to show how much they knew about each other. First they sequestered the bride and asked the groom what he thought his wife would answer to a series of questions. Then they
Continue Reading
I didn’t exactly meet this person but saw them on TV.
 
Twenty years ago I was home from work sick, I mean REALLY sick so that I barely had enough energy to keep my eyes open. The TV was on and a really stupid game show called ‘The Newlywed Game’ came on. I wasn’t interested in it but couldn’t get together enough energy to get up to change the channel (this was before remotes).
 
The premise of the show was that they got newlyweds to show how much they knew about each other. First they sequestered the bride and asked the groom what he thought his wife would answer to a series of questions. Then they’d bring the bride out and see how well he knew what his new wife would answer.
 
One question that stuck in my mind was “How many states in America do you think your wife could name?”
 
The man’s answer was “5”.
 
The MC expressed some surprise that he thought his wife could only name 5 states and then went on to ask the rest of the questions.
 
Then it was the wife’s turn to answer the questions. She said “2”.
 
The MC started to go to the next question but couldn’t help himself. He had to go back and ask her if she was sure she could only name two states.
 
When she confirmed that was all she knew he asked her which two states she could name.
 
The answer? “California, and Mexico.”
 
She probably knew California because that was the state the show was filmed in and that’s where she lived. Then she got her second one wrong, naming a neighbouring country instead.
 
I found that amazing. I can not only name all 50 states, but with a blank piece of paper I could draw a map of the U.S. and include all the states and probably a good approximation of their boundaries - and I’m not even American. Do they even teac geography there?

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

The most ignorant person in America is my nephew. Not only he is very ignorant, but it also cost me $1000 to find out how ignorant he is.
 
But first, let me introduce you to my nephew and I:
The one standing is your truly, and the one down is my nephew. The picture is not really correct, but it gives you a general idea how I want to do with him
 
Now, once when he was in college, I gave him $1000 for him to spend a summer vacation with his best buddies in their homeland in South Korea
 
One or two years later, he graduated, and during graduation week, he sent me an email with some urgent note to tell me to make sure I watched my local TV at certain time
 
So that time came, and I watched, and on the screen, there was a young TV reporter in my nephew’s campus, talking about how ignorant American students can be when it is about geography; then she rolled out a big world map and asked the audience if someone could correctly pick out the country of South Korea from the map …
 
Then the very first person volunteered for that question was my nephew. Dancing and grinning from ear to ear, he went to the map and pointed to …. Japan! Much to my horror!!
 
But on the screen, I saw his (S Korean?) friends laughing, and I overheard one of them said to my nephew “… and all that free food my Mum gave you in Seoul..”
 
A few days later when I caught up with him, I asked him what Mickey Mouse stuff he tried to pull on TV, and he said:” But uncle! But had I given the correct answer, I wouldn’t be on TV, would I?”
 
The point is, many students in that screen knew it was a joke, but the reporter didn’t, or that she knew, but she was playing along for good sport, and that was how I saw my $1000 wasting away in Seoul. [Grrrr
r..]

So this happened when I was in fourth standard, me and my parents were vacationing in 
Jim Corbett National Park.
 
Its a famous tourist attraction among wildlife enthusiast and famous of Tiger and elephant sighting, although i never had the fortune or misfortune of sighting a tiger myself, but forest itself it pretty beautiful. Since the majestic tiger is not easy to come by so near by resort and forest guesthouses arrange small events and gatherings for the guests to keep things interesting and fun. At one such barbecue I happen to come in contact with this rather friendly Amarican lady who was seated on the table next to us along with one of her Aussie friend, perhaps they met at the resort or otherwise, anyways after a courteous head nod she started taking to me, she was an elementary school teacher(ironical) and was teaching children my age back in US, so furthering the tradition small talk I happening to ask he about her visit and whether or not she saw the tiger?
 
Her answer was not something I expected. She told me that she was rather disappointed with Corbett as she wasn't interested in seen tigers, as she can see them at the zoo any time she wanted. 
She wanted to see Indian tree dwellers, apparently someone in her friend circle bragged about how she met people who live in trees and hop from one tree to another like a monkey, hence she decided to come to India to see people living on trees herself and she haven't found them yet
. I didn't know how to respond to that, may be she was joking, but making a joke like that in front of a fourth grader didn't made any sense at all. In all honesty it threw me off!! I was visibly offended and all I could manage to say was that we live in houses and not on trees.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
While I’m certain I’ve met dumber Americans than Veronica, it’s her story that comes to mind now. She was a young, incredibly voluptuous, if quite ditsy, receptionist at one of the first companies I’d worked for, and she had apparently screwed up something with a multimillion dollar contract pretty good because of something she said to a customer. Veronica was the daughter of a neighbor of the company owner, and assumed unfireable, but apparently my boss had had a few things to say about that particular screwup with Veronica’s boss.
 
I was their International Markets Analyst, and my boss, the Ex

While I’m certain I’ve met dumber Americans than Veronica, it’s her story that comes to mind now. She was a young, incredibly voluptuous, if quite ditsy, receptionist at one of the first companies I’d worked for, and she had apparently screwed up something with a multimillion dollar contract pretty good because of something she said to a customer. Veronica was the daughter of a neighbor of the company owner, and assumed unfireable, but apparently my boss had had a few things to say about that particular screwup with Veronica’s boss.
 
I was their International Markets Analyst, and my boss, the Executive VP of Marketing & Sales, was a very cool guy who’d done a stint as a CIA Agent in Moscow, and after speaking with her boss he’d come into my office to discuss something else with me and the Inside Sales Manager. We’d just begun when Veronica burst into the room sobbing profusely, and managed to stammer out between wails, sniffles, and blowing her nose in a tissue that she was sorry for screwing everything up, but it had really hurt her feelings that he told her boss that she 
“was as dumb as a box of rocks!”
 More wails and sobs…
 
My boss just raised his eyebrows at her and said, “But that’s not true, Veronica, 
I never said that you were DUMB as a box of rocks. She was mistaken. I said that you were as SMART as a box of rocks!”
 
To the total amazement of both the Inside Sales Manager and I, she immediately brightened and cheerfully said, “Oh, then she got it completely 
backwards,
 I see now.
 
Okay.” With that, she turned and walked back out to go correct her boss. Our EVP shakes his head as he watches her walk out, then turns to us with a grin and says something about the impossibility of fixing stupid.
 
.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

——
 
Who is the most ignorant person I've met in America? It's actually a tie. I'm related to both. They are my daughters. When I first met them, they were totally ignorant of almost everything. They were both vaguely aware that being cold was bad and how to suckle. With time they've both become less ignorant, but neither still have any idea about the year the Declaration of Independence was signed or how many states there are in the US. I'd 
Continue Reading
This is such a mean question. It keeps popping up in my feed so I feel compelled to answer so I can at least partially address why it's such a mean question.
 
——
 
Who is the most ignorant person I've met in America? It's actually a tie. I'm related to both. They are my daughters. When I first met them, they were totally ignorant of almost everything. They were both vaguely aware that being cold was bad and how to suckle. With time they've both become less ignorant, but neither still have any idea about the year the Declaration of Independence was signed or how many states there are in the US. I'd guess most newborns are this ignorant, but they are the only two I've actually met.
 
Probably not the answer the questioner wanted, but demonstrably more ignorant than all the other examples I've read up to now.
 
—-
 
This is such a mean question because it gleefully celebrates someone's negative attributes. Largely in a condescending way. I get it. Most people on Quora are smart (to look at self-reported IQs you'd think mere geniuses are the dunces), so it's a safe place to make fun of a the unintelligent or, even more unforgivable, the unitellectual.
 
There are basically three reasons why someone is ignorant about a particular subject:
It isn’t important
They are undereducated
They aren't that smart
None of which are really good reasons for making fun of someone.
 
What I'm really curious about is where on the intelligence scale it goes from being hilarious to make fun of the stupid person to being cruel to make fun of the intellectually disabled person. Does it change if the person had the audacity to be raised by a religious conservative and have accepted what they were taught since they could listen?

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I didn’t actually met the person in real life, but online. I used to participate in an online forum of a computer game. There was also a section for world news. It was usually filled with forwarded news piece from all over the world. As you may guess, some topics would invite opposing views and heated arguments.
 
It was in 2009, during the height of the Afghanistan campaign by NATO. A pair of tanker trucks supplying NATO forces were hijacked by the Taliban. They got stuck in a rural Afghan village, and the Talibans then simply let the villagers siphon fuel off the trucks. They were spotted by a 
Continue Reading
I didn’t actually met the person in real life, but online. I used to participate in an online forum of a computer game. There was also a section for world news. It was usually filled with forwarded news piece from all over the world. As you may guess, some topics would invite opposing views and heated arguments.
 
It was in 2009, during the height of the Afghanistan campaign by NATO. A pair of tanker trucks supplying NATO forces were hijacked by the Taliban. They got stuck in a rural Afghan village, and the Talibans then simply let the villagers siphon fuel off the trucks. They were spotted by a German contingent that ordered an airstrike, which was carried out by an USAF F-15E Eagle. Over 100 people were killed, with dozens of children among the victims.
 
2009 Kunduz airstrike - Wikipedia
The news was forwarded to the forum, and people began arguing about it. How it would gift the Taliban more recruits, NATO forces (especially American) would be more hated etc. It was mostly civil, and an American service member even said that he’d feel really really bad if he had caused the death of children even inadvertently, and he felt sorry for the pilot who must have had an enormous feeling of guilt.
 
Then another American, posted something quite offensive; (I’m paraphrasing) “The American should not feel bad about the deaths of the Afghan kids, because they are not American kids. They are just some brown people who would not have much to live for in a dump like Afghanistan anyway. And their parents didn’t really love their children there. There isn’t much loss here to make a fuss about.”
 
It generated just one page worth of angry postings at him before the moderators promptly ban him and lock the thread.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
It depends on how many days you want to workout?
If you are able to train 4 days I like 2 lower body days, 2 upper body days. If you are training 3 days then 3 full body workouts would be best.
 
I think sticking to compound movements, lunges, rows, pull up, chin ups and some core exercises will give you more bang for your buck.
You could do isolation exercises at the end of your workout but I would stick to the big movements.
 
The rep range will vary. Depending on how much experience you have with compound movements, especially if your just starting out I would stick to the 3-6 rep range for your 
Continue Reading
It depends on how many days you want to workout?
If you are able to train 4 days I like 2 lower body days, 2 upper body days. If you are training 3 days then 3 full body workouts would be best.
 
I think sticking to compound movements, lunges, rows, pull up, chin ups and some core exercises will give you more bang for your buck.
You could do isolation exercises at the end of your workout but I would stick to the big movements.
 
The rep range will vary. Depending on how much experience you have with compound movements, especially if your just starting out I would stick to the 3-6 rep range for your first movement and then go from there. Its not set in stone but my second movement is usually in the 6-12 rep range this would be your lunges or other accessory movements. From there you will be moving to possibly your last movements and maybe core work if you are doing it that day and will be your 8-15 rep range.
 
Now, this is just a guide line, and can be toyed with a little. 
 
Your breaks will change from movement to movement. A guide would be  2-3 minutes for the first movement and all compound movements, 1-2 for the second movement, and then 1-1:30 for the rest of the movements.
 
The rest can change sometimes, there will be times where you want to keep the rest very limited and then there will be times when you want to rest a little extra. Your goals will dictate your rest for the most part.
 
Depends what you want to get out of your training. The harder you push yourself the more you will get out of it. You don't need to spend hours in the gym a day but when your there push yourself. 
 
Music? Yes!
 
Hope this helps, feel free to email me at rossy@mattrossignol.com if you have any questions.

This happened in 2003. My wife and I were on our honeymoon in Italy. It had just started raining and we ducked into a cafe. The cafe must have been closed and the proprietor was cleaning up. Seeing the man cleaning, we apologized and were leaving when he called us back. He made us some coffees and a hot chocolate for my wife. We all sat at a table outside under the awning, looking at and talking about the Duomo in Firenze. We were having a nice conversation, though he was speaking Italian with a few English words and me speaking in Spanish we managed fairly well.
 
A tourist bus must have emptied out somewhere because a large group of American tourists walked up. Maybe 20 or 30 people. In front was a loud obnoxious American woman. Blond hair, average height, quite overweight, with a mid-west accent and way too loud. She complained about everything. She complained about how Italians didn’t know who to make spaghetti, they didn’t know how to make pizza, and (being at a cafe) how they didn’t know how to make coffee. By now she had walked up to the table we were at, and then demanded to know where the waiter was at. I was beyond embarrassed that these people were my fellow Americans. I was trying trying to figure out anything to say when this woman started yelling that she couldn’t believe how these Italians didn’t speak English. The cafe owner said in Italian, that he did not speak English. He then went inside and locked the door.
 
So we were in Italy, where this American was yelling at us for not speaking English.
 
My wife and I never said a word, just put down some money and left completely mortified. That woman was the most stupid and obnoxious American I have come across so far in my life.

article:

I have a friend, Candy. She’s a pretty okay person.
 
But the thing is, Candy is a little… slow. I think her mother was on something when she was pregnant with Candy.
 
She’s usually pretty nice, but sometimes she can have pretty bad judgement. And sometimes say pretty… weird… things.
 
For example, one time we were talking and she brought up her boyfriend. I was surprised to find out she had a boyfriend because
 
a) She didn’t have the most interesting personality
 
b) She wasn’t super intelligent
 
c) She wasn’t astonishingly pretty, I think whatever her mom was taking also affected her development looks-wise
 
d) We were in eighth grade, and most people weren’t dating yet.
 
But I acted interested to be polite, and we started chatting about him. Apparently, he is fifteen (she was thirteen at the time), but that was okay because he was still in eighth grade as he was held back. He also lived in Ohio, while we lived in Connecticut but she went on vacation every holiday to see him.
 
Twice.
 
He had also cheated on her a few times, and seemed to me like a bit of a jerk, but I decided that it wasn’t my place to tell her who she should and shouldn’t date.
 
She then asked me if I had a boyfriend, and I went on my usual “eww boys suck” immature 7 year old girl spiel. In reality, I hadn’t really met anyone I hit off with that much, but I was just joking.
 
Candy laughed, 
then literally said, “
Oh yeah, I totally know what you mean! In fact, 
I was lesbian for a year
 
one time
.”
^My reaction but not really because we were in art class and I wasn’t actually drinking tea^
 
But, 
really
??
 
I was lesbian 
for a year
?
 
Like, what?
 
That’s not really something that changes, no?

article:

She started talking to me, using “like” and “oh my god” every 3 seconds, while smiling all the time. The conversation went like this:
 
-What are you doing in Croatia?
 
-I am hitchhiking the Balkans
 
-(excit
Continue Reading
I was stuck in a gas station outside of Zagreb, during a hitchhiking trip around the Balkans. There, an old lady, politely asked to sit next to me and we started chatting. She explained that she is from Croatia, but she fled the country during the war and she lives in the US ever since. After five minutes, arrived her daughter, a 30 year old woman, that looked like a Jersey Shore character to me. She started talking to me, using “like” and “oh my god” every 3 seconds, while smiling all the time. The conversation went like this:
 
-What are you doing in Croatia?
 
-I am hitchhiking the Balkans
 
-(excited) Oh my God! I could never do it! Like, where did you start?
 
-Budapest
 
-Oh my god, where is this like?
 
-Hungary, a country in central Europe.
 
-So cool!! And where are you from?
 
-Athens
 
-(small pause, smile gone)
 
-….Greece
 
-(smile is back) Oh my goodness! And how is life in Athens?
 
-Not very easy, there are a lot of refugees, and we are helping them, but things are hard in general
 
-Oh my god, like where do they come from?? And why do they come to Greece???
 
At this point I couldn’t believe the ignorance of this woman. All these stereotypes about Americans were suddenly in front of my eyes. She was also a war refugee, she was born in Europe, and lived through part of the Yugoslavian war, but growing up in the US, probably turned her into this. I can’t believe she lives in a country that has been bombing several others and knows nothing about it. I can’t believe she never heared of the huge refugee wave in Europe. Hungary and Greece are both not far from Croatia, but she has no idea where they are. I really hope she educates herself, but I don’t believe she will.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
I get the feeling this question is incredibly misguided in its interpretation of what each of these things means.
 
Comparing apples to oranges.
 
Theoretically the gym offers more variety and considering most people should engage in some form of regular cardiovascular AND some form of resistance training AND some form of flexibility training, then the gym certainly presents a better option
 in theory
.
 
However, theory and actuality doesn't always mean the same thing.
 
A person who runs regularly, and does some resistance training at home and learns how to maintain and manage mobility/flexibility will be
Continue Reading
I get the feeling this question is incredibly misguided in its interpretation of what each of these things means.
 
Comparing apples to oranges.
 
Theoretically the gym offers more variety and considering most people should engage in some form of regular cardiovascular AND some form of resistance training AND some form of flexibility training, then the gym certainly presents a better option
 in theory
.
 
However, theory and actuality doesn't always mean the same thing.
 
A person who runs regularly, and does some resistance training at home and learns how to maintain and manage mobility/flexibility will be better off than the person who goes to the gym every day and hops on the elliptical machine only.
 
It's all relative.
 
Running only on its own is really incomplete in the long-run, but it's better than nothing.
 
Going to the gym can definitely be just as incomplete on its own, if all you do is the same thing when you're there, but would still also be better than nothing.
 
I'd say if you maximize the options present at the gym, it is actually better than running alone. But if you run in addition to doing other things, then it's probably better.
 
At a bear minimum, doing something, will always be better than doing nothing, so always do first and foremost what you can do. Once you’ve got that down though, make sure you do a little variety of things.
 
At this point, ideally participate in at least one activity that:
Challenges your heart (
a cardiovascular endurance activity like running
)
Challenges your range of motion (
mobility/flexibility training
)
Challenges your neuromuscular system to produce force (
lift, jump, etc…challenge your bones, tendons, and muscles
)

This happened few days back when I went to the National Museum of Nature and Science, Tokyo (
National Museum of Nature and Science,Tokyo
).
 
It had been a long tiring day and after touring the museum, I decided to sit outside to rest my legs. Here comes an American women (seemed to be in her 30s) with a Japanese girl (seemed to be her English student) who sat a few steps away from me. I recognized the two as I had earlier “heard” them in the museum (the American women was way too loud).
 
As I was sitting alone and had no one to talk to, I started listening to their conversation (couldn’t help it as such - the lady was way too loud!!!). They were discussing about the moon. The American lady first explained (in great lengths!!) how we see only the same portion of the Moon’s sphere always and never the other side. Her explanation of this phenomenon seemed pretty good and so I got more interested in their conversation.
 
The next question comes from the American - “Who owns the moon?” The Japanese girl meekly replied that she had no idea. This somehow annoyed the American lady to great lengths. She explained (read “Screamed”) saying that “Since we (Americans) were the first to land on the moon and erected our flag there, it’s we (Americans) who own the moon. If anything happens to Earth in future, the Americans will be the first and only people who have the right to move to the moon. Though it’s not written anywhere, everyone knows the truth.”
 
I couldn’t help but laugh out loud. Both of them looks at me - the Japanese girl smiling and the American lady giving me a death stare!! And I got my cue to leave.
 
P.S. If anyone wants to know who owns the moon - 
The Outer Space Treaty

Few years ago, I was travelling from Vancouver to Los Angeles, as part of a round the world trip.
 
When in San Francisco, I went to In-N-Out Burger to try it, it was crowded, so I shared a table with 2 German girls, who were planing to visit Yosemite Park the day after.
 
Then joined a American girl, from Houston if I correctly remember. And then, the most unrealistic discussion (for me) started :
 
US Girl
, to one of the other girl : Hi, are you on a diet? You only have a milk shake.
 
German Girl 1
 : We are vegetarian.
 
US Girl
 : Ah, I see… (It seems to be a lot of thought for her).
 
US Girl
, after a while : So, what is the name of your church? (German girls felt uncomfortable to speak about religion, but I understood that the last 2 questions where related)
 
Me
 : Being vegetarian has nothing to do with religion, it’s just that they do not eat any meat.
 
US Girl
 : Ha, sure! I sort of knew it.
 
(She stayed silent for a while, searching for a good question to ask)
 
US Girl
 : Do you eat chicken?
 
German Girl : no, we don’t.
 
US Girl
 : I knew it, you are vegetarian, right?
 
US Girl
 : Is there any barbecue in Germany?
 
German girl 2
 : Yes, it is quite popular in Summer time.
 
US Girl
 : Is Germany in Europe or in Bavaria?
 
The three of us, all together : 
Where by chance have you heard about Bavaria
 ?
Anyway, we enjoyed the discussion, and learned quite a lot about how someone who only lived in Texas, and visited Nevada and California once could think. She was a 
huge fan of horses
, and also constantly replied “I knew it” for some obscure reasons.
 
I hope she also learned stuff from us and how people from elsewhere understand the world.

But still, I believe the one who plays with his thoughts and wants to share his thoughts will stop for nothing. In this era, one can find a lot of resources. So one who wanna write and wants to keep writing, wants purple should read him then he will stop for nothing.
 
Someone quoted this -
Not everyone comes with great talent, but a great talent can come from anywhere.
A writing means sharing. Whether it is knowledge or some random facts and thoughts writing can help him share it to various people.
 
And obviously, Quora plays a big role here. It might become a true basement or platform to share his view and let it reach to the whole world.
 
So, Quora isn't just for rich people or only poor people. Writing and sharing are not just for poor or rich people. Everyone has ideas and everyone jas a new story. A story to share to the whole world.
 
Poor or rich, when there a pen in his hand and thoughts in his mind, there is always a story.
 
Everyone has a story. Poor and rich everyone has to say something.
 
So yes poor people exist in Quora.
 
Have a great day!
 
Yours, Lord Sparos

Had a business meeting (located in Sri Lanka, and I’m a Sri Lankan) with some people who were also based in Sri Lanka for their work. There were 4 of us Sri Lankans, one American guy, one British woman and two guys from the Netherlands. It was quite a formal meeting and we were all sitting at a big table and someone was about to start a presentation when 
the American guy put his legs up- like up touching the freaking table
!!
 
We all just stared at him and then he said “what?? it’s completely normal in the United States to put our legs up and make ourselves comfortable…it’s going to be a long meeting right..”. So first thing, err…no. I have attended a few business meetings in the US as well and 
I can't really say I’ve noticed anyone behaving so sloppily
. Although I have attended an American university and it constantly surprised me to see students sometimes in pyjamas and some students actually did put their legs up. But at a business meeting, no I had never seen that.
 
So then a Sri Lankan colleague of mine tried explaining to him that 
while he may have done that in America, over here in Sri Lanka it’s considered extremely bad manners 
and to please put his legs down. 
He went off on a tirade!! Calling HER rude and racist! 
We were just STUNNED. And slowly everyone was getting really angry. Even though technically we COULD have ignored his legs on the table and continued with our meeting, we didn’t WANT to. It was the height of entitled rude behaviour. After wasting much time, my immediate supervisor ended up calling his boss and it took his boss telling him to sit properly, for this silly man to sit!! Jeez…like in kindergarten.
 
Goodness that was a trying meeting.

Honestly, the most beneficial aspect of physical activity, I will be precise, of daily physical activity is the wellbeing and the good looking aspect, either clothed or half-naked ... lol ..and yes, it certainly brings much more countless benefits like self-esteem, health , good sleep and mental strength and clearness.. but in reality they are really endless to be listed.
 
I can just talk of my own experience which is that I have found my way back to the gym and exercising this year after about 15 years of totally unhealthy lifestyle, at my current age of 52. I never felt better or fitter all my life although I have previously also trained hard and of course built some muscles back then which were reactivated rather quicker now thanks to the effect called muscle-memory. But for some reason and maybe due corona I felt a wave or surge of energy this year which gave me a kick in the ass to get up and change my heavy overweight and do something about it.
 
So I started in February of this year with a weight of 111 kg and followed quite a strict trainings schedule which culminated after the lockdown in the summer in twice daily training sessions, namely early morning running for 6–8 km and every evenings of 90 minutes weights workouts. Sometimes I used even to combine running, bicycle tours (65km) and swimming(2km) altogether in one day. I ignored completely the common rest one day rule and all that is written and just listen to my body and curiously I found that the body is indeed capable of taking well care of itself and is asking me literally for being used and pushed to its limits daily, that’s why I didn’t yet miss a single day of exercising at least once daily since then.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I am an Indian and I was traveling from Dallas, TX, USA to Singapore with a layover in Dubai, UAE. Emirates has this scheme if you have a layover of more than 8 hours in Dubai (Economy), you can get free hotel stay and UAE visa for the layover period. Presuming I would be severely jet-lagged I opted for it.
 
I was having lunch at the hotel and one of my co-passengers, who was a US citizen, asked me if she could join me. We were making small talks and she asked me what do I do. I told her I am a PhD student in Electrical Engineering in Singapore and I was in the US for a conference. We talked in 
Continue Reading
I am an Indian and I was traveling from Dallas, TX, USA to Singapore with a layover in Dubai, UAE. Emirates has this scheme if you have a layover of more than 8 hours in Dubai (Economy), you can get free hotel stay and UAE visa for the layover period. Presuming I would be severely jet-lagged I opted for it.
 
I was having lunch at the hotel and one of my co-passengers, who was a US citizen, asked me if she could join me. We were making small talks and she asked me what do I do. I told her I am a PhD student in Electrical Engineering in Singapore and I was in the US for a conference. We talked in general about places to see in Dubai, how electrical power is reliable in the US, and something about her mother’s town facing a power outage for two days because of some natural calamity.
 
After I came with a fresh plate of serving, she asks where I am from and what religion do I practice. I told her I am from India and am a Hindu. And then she asks, do I practice Voo-doo. I was flabbergasted and said no. Then she went on saying that she met an Indian once and that person practiced Voo-doo. I said it could be possible, it is a country of 1.25 billion people and some of them may practice Voo-doo. She seemed convinced that I was lying and not telling her about my Voo-doo sessions. By her body language and conversation, it seemed to me that she believed all Hindus practiced Voo-doo. I was quite taken aback by this whole conversation, but didn’t want to seem impolite and didn’t want to help her form another stereotype. After a few more bites, I said my good-byes to her and wished her well for her stay in Dubai.
 
This was in 2014 and the lady was college educated and lived in Dallas.
