I once mentioned on an online message board that I wanted to take a refresher course in Welsh because while I was at Uni I had forgotten everything I learnt for my GCSE - I think the thread was about useful things you’d like to learn or something - and being able to speak at least a bit of Welsh is a desirable ability in the jobs market in South Wales.
 
I got an incredibly condescending message from an American man/boy (not sure on how old he was) who 
told 
me that I shouldn’t waste my time on “bullshit made-up” qualifications like GCSEs and that Welsh was a made up language like Elvish, and that I ought to concentrate on a “proper” qualification like his GED ( I have a Batchelor of Science Honours Degree which he ignored) and should consider a real language like Klingon.
 
My reaction was pretty much WTF? and deciding not to bother reply because this guy was either stupid or a troll. I did keep an eye on the thread though because it was kind of interesting what people wanted to learn.
 
Some other forum members did reply though and got into a dispute with the American Idiot and it turned out that he honestly believed that all schools in all countries followed the same educational system as the USA, that Klingon - ie the language Worf speaks in Star Trek - was a real language as you can apparently study it in some US universities and by the same logic Welsh was something made up by the forum as he’d never heard of it before.
 
TL:DR - American mansplained to an internet forum that all countries have the same education system - the one that is in the USA - and as he hadn’t heard of it Welsh was a made up language. Oh, and a GED is the “best” qualification one can get.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I visited Amsterdam again a year ago as I only live a 2½ hour drive away in Germany.
 
My friend who was with me spent the afternoon in the Rijksmuseum while I was shopping in the downtown, after which we met at the Museumplein, drank a coffee together and then headed towards the nearby toilet house.
 
There are several accepted payments methods to gain access to the toilets from the vestibule. My German bank card was fine so I went in and did my business, washed my hands and as I turned towards the exit, saw someone standing puzzled at the turnstile. He was tall, corpulent, donning a fedora, and em
Continue Reading
I visited Amsterdam again a year ago as I only live a 2½ hour drive away in Germany.
 
My friend who was with me spent the afternoon in the Rijksmuseum while I was shopping in the downtown, after which we met at the Museumplein, drank a coffee together and then headed towards the nearby toilet house.
 
There are several accepted payments methods to gain access to the toilets from the vestibule. My German bank card was fine so I went in and did my business, washed my hands and as I turned towards the exit, saw someone standing puzzled at the turnstile. He was tall, corpulent, donning a fedora, and emanated quite a physical presence. I instantly recognized him as an American.
 
As I passed by him he turned towards me and addressed me in English in a somewhat mumbled intonation; I was aware that probably his credit card had not been accepted. Many businesses in Europe don’t and only accept debit cards, domestic/EU bank cards and cash.
 
He was holding his open wallet and rather than the pastel colors of euro notes I caught sight of a considerable bunch of gray dollar notes. He was walking around in the middle of Amsterdam with 
only dollars on him
. I don’t really remember the few fleeting words we exchanged, but seeing his difficulty I handed him a Euro coin, which was of course accepted in the coin slot, and in turn received a one dollar note.
 
That American gentleman then moved into the toilet area and at the same moment my friend got out, only to witness me laugh at George Washington’s likeness gazing at me from the dollar note i held unfolded in both hands.
 
My first dollar later found a home in my foreign currency bag next to about €6 in Hungarian forint coins.

title: What is a good weekly workout?
article:
There isn’t a one-size-fits-all answer to this question. My question to you is how are you doing?
 
At a certain age basic life tasks become harder. It is your job to maintain your body to do basic life activities. If you follow me on issues of senior fitness you have read me repeat ”if you don’t use it you lose it”. It is very serious advise.
 
You need to be able to reach up, bend over, get up from a chair, get up from the floor. Pick things up that are on the ground or your life becomes difficult.
 
How is your balance? The biggest problem as people age is poor balance and falling. Can you stand on 
Continue Reading
There isn’t a one-size-fits-all answer to this question. My question to you is how are you doing?
 
At a certain age basic life tasks become harder. It is your job to maintain your body to do basic life activities. If you follow me on issues of senior fitness you have read me repeat ”if you don’t use it you lose it”. It is very serious advise.
 
You need to be able to reach up, bend over, get up from a chair, get up from the floor. Pick things up that are on the ground or your life becomes difficult.
 
How is your balance? The biggest problem as people age is poor balance and falling. Can you stand on one leg for 30 seconds? Whether you can or cannot, you should do this regularly 30 seconds a leg without holding on.
 
Is picking things off the floor a problem? How is your squat? I admit mine is not great at the moment. I must improve it. Let’s both of us do squats against a wall.
 
The one exercise I will recommend for you without knowing your health is The Bridge. Most people have back trouble ad they age. This is usually the first back exercise everyone does to correct problems. If my back hurts in bed I actually do this in bed while I am still asleep. You can probably do it too.
 
How are you doing getting up off the floor? If this is hard for you you need to ask Mr Google for some exercises to strengthen your legs for getting up off the floor.
 
Mostly I will say this. If your doctor recommends you do physical therapy, not only do the therapy it continue doing the exercise after the therapy ends. This is how you reduce pain and get to continue enjoying your life.
 
It is your job to maintain your body. And let me repeat. If you don’t use it you will lose it.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?

I am a sick old lady in the US. Everything of any value had to get sold to satisfy what was not covered by philanthropic organization. I am a sick old lady in the US. Everything of any value had to get sold to satisfy what was not covered by philanthropic organization. It was life and death for me; I was no longer young; I am humbly grateful. I live US American-style poverty. A different experience than the answers that I read and updated here.
 
If you are living in US and are wanting to know 
how 
to keep internet services when finances change, I can answer: Yes. I live on my Social Security Disability. I live in housing that is some combination of HUD housing (government-subsidized housing) and private organization which owns and manages fully-accessible apartments for people with disabilities. Because I live in a HUD subsidized apartment and because a national cable company has a program for people who live in HUD housing for a nominal fee. I could either buy my modem/router (cost me 120 USD) or pay 5 USD each month for their router/modem (whatever order those words come in). I have a tablet from housesitting money I earn every other weekend. I earn about 120 USD monthly from that job. That money goes to all things past the monthly bills, medical bills, pharmacy (scripts and OTCs both), and personal and household supplies (limited to the basics). Meaning if I want a pair of shoes or a snack or a speaker for my tablet, that comes out of housesitting money. How truly and humbly grateful I am to be a citizen of US. Completely an accident of birth.
 
Additional Comment. My friends who I housesit for found out that that same national company provides the same nominal costs for senior citizens. He is older than my friend (his wife) and I, so their household qualifies. Others do too, if interested.

S - I’m sorry sir, but I’m going to need to see some ID for this purchase.

Continue Reading
Working in the States for about 6 weeks on a project I was invited to a BBQ at a colleagues house on a weekend. I’d offered to bring some beers so stopped at a store on the way. The conversation with “Stacey” at the till went something like this…
 
S - I’m sorry sir, but I’m going to need to see some ID for this purchase.
 
Me - Not a problem… and pulled my UK driving licence out.
 
S perusing said ID - I don’t think I can accept this as it’s not American.
 
Me - No problem… and pulled out my passport
 
S looking at my passport - I can’t accept this either as it’s not American and it’s not an ID.
 
Me - That’s my passport, it’s literally an internationally recognised form of identification.
 
S - But it’s not an American ID.
 
Me - That’s because I’m not an American.
 
S - I can’t accept these ID’s because they’re not American, and I can’t sell you alcohol without ID
 
Me tapping my passport - You do understand that your government allowed me into this country with this identity document… look, can you call a manager as we’re getting nowhere
 
Now the manager appears
 
Mgr - Is there a problem Stacey.
 
S - Yes. This man has no ID to buy this beer
 
Me - I do have ID, just Stacey here doesn’t quite grasp the concept of non-American ones.
 
Mgr looks at them both - Stacey, it’s fine, you can take either of these.
 
S - BUT THEY’RE NOT AMEEEEEEERICAN!!!
 
Mgr - Stacey… Just ring it up. I’m really sorry Sir.
 
S - You speak reeeeeally good English by the way.
 
Me - I’m sorry what?
 
S - Your English is excellent… for someone from the UK.
 
I just looked at the manager and raised my eyebrows… he simply shook his head and wished me a good day.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My 
hairdresser
 didn’t know the difference between 
a millimeter
 and 
an inch
!!
 
I normally keep my hair very short. Commonly called a ‘No. 1’ hair clipper.
This is a No. 1 attachment on most US hair clippers.
 
So I go in for a routine hair cut and told her that I would like - A No. 1 all over.

I replied slightly surprised “Um
Continue Reading
My 
hairdresser
 didn’t know the difference between 
a millimeter
 and 
an inch
!!
 
I normally keep my hair very short. Commonly called a ‘No. 1’ hair clipper.
This is a No. 1 attachment on most US hair clippers.
 
So I go in for a routine hair cut and told her that I would like - A No. 1 all over.
 
For those who haven’t gotten this done, this is how short it looks on the head.
So, you see how short that is? Now, you would wonder who could possibly confuse that with the measurement of 1 inch right?
 
Not this lady. When I asked her for a No. 1, she replies “So a 1 inch all over?”
 
I replied slightly surprised “Umm, no, I would like a No.1 all over, that is not 1 inch, its about 3 millimeters around 1/8th of an inch.”
 
She looked at me as though I insulted her ancestors.
 
She proceeds to lecture me about how in the US hair measurements are all in inches and no one uses millimeters. Then she proceeds to tell me how she has never seen a millimeter measurement on any of the hair clippers and adds that maybe in my country that is how they do. And then tops it all off by asking me “Is this how they teach how to cut hair in your country?”
 
Now, at this point, I was offended. I had half a mind to tell her to look at the freaking attachment which says 1/8 inch (3mm) and complain to her manager that she was making remarks using terms like “In this country”. But, I decided against it, not to make a big fuss about it, and let her cut my hair with the correct attachment by pointing to it.
 
I understand that in the US, the metric system is not followed but come on, its right there on the clipper.
 
Sure enough, I’m not going there again.

One of the most rewarding moment in my life would be,that i get a great pump in my biceps also when I perform some back exercises.The exercises are
 
1)Chin-ups-(3 sets* 14,12,10 reps)
 
2)Barbell row under-hand grip -(3 sets* 14,12,10 reps)
 
3)One-arm Dumbbell rows-(3 sets* 14,12,10 reps)
 
4)Underhand or reverse grip Lat pull down-(3 sets* 14,12,10 reps)
 
5)Seated cable row-(3 sets* 14,12,10 reps)
 
These exercises works both my back and biceps alot. Lemme explain the form for theses exercises
 
1)chin-ups-*You grip the chin-up bar in a underhand close grip and bring your body up until your chin is above the bar and then come down again and repeat the form.
2)Barbell and dumbbell rows-*Both of these exercises should be done in a controlled manner,you should extend your arm to the full extent and then row again.
 
*Your back should in a proper position or you might face injuries and miss the benefits of these exercises.
 
*Barbell row should be done with Underhand grip.
 
3)Underhand or reverse grip Lat pull down-*These should be done with underhand close grip at the same width of your shoulder width or grip the bar at the end of the horizontal part.
 
*Pull the bar all the way to your upper chest and then fully extend your arms the way up in a controlled manner
4)Seated cable row-*You should pull the V-bar till you touch your torso while your arms are close to your body and extend your back and arms fully when you go back to the original position,
All these exercises should be done in a
 controlled manner and always breathing at the proper time will assists you to perform these exercises in a professional and beneficial manner.

Generally this is how my whole week go.
 
Monday to Saturday - Following Diets + Exercise
 
Sunday - Rest + Cheat Day (Cheat Day includes eating 2 slices of pizza or favorite burger or an ice cream kind of).
 
I strictly follow diets for this 6 days. Main thing to avoid - 
Sugar and much Carbs. 
I keep my carb intake as low as possible.
 
This is my plan.
 
Diet -
Morning
Starting with Apple Cider Vinegar Drinks or Green Tea
Followed by Protein Smoothie (Mixture of protein, milk and any high end fruits)
Lunch - Grilled chicken made with Butter plus Broccoli
Post Lunch - Oats or Raw Paneer with Butter Cube
Evening Around 4 to 5 - One Juice without sugar
Pre-workout - Just one apple
Workout time
Post workout - one glass whey protein with little milk and water
Dinner - Chicken with boiled eggs with Green vegetables
I generally keep changing Chicken with Fish and other similar intakes. I also keep changing paneer (cottage cheese) with Peanut Butter Brown Breads and similar. I also make sure I don’t take more than 200–250 gm of total calories while one time eating.
 
Workout -
Monday - Legs Day
Tuesday - Chest Day
Wednesday - Triceps and Biceps
Thursday - Any HIIT or Functional Exercises or Cardio / Spinning
Friday - Back Day (Upper + Lower)
Saturday - Any HIIT or Functional Exercises or Cardio / Spinning
I generally do Abs on alternate day or with the day when I do HIIT. If I miss someday in these 6 days, I also make sure i cover it on Sunday.
 
Remember, what you eat is what you see in your body.
 
Just be consistent and keep doing hard work and you would get that toned body in no time.
 
Sincerely,
 
Aakash (stylemattersbro.com)

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
There’s no straight answer to the question without considering your training experience, current goals, etc.
 
If by “maximum gains” you mean building the most amount of muscles possible (naturally), then you need to be the strongest version of yourself while taking care of the other parameters like nutrition, stress, recovery, etc. Full body training has been proven to aid in the process better than body part split routines in general because of factors like increased frequency of training each muscle, adequate rest & recovery, etc.
 
On the other hand, body part split/bro split routines have been 
Continue Reading
There’s no straight answer to the question without considering your training experience, current goals, etc.
 
If by “maximum gains” you mean building the most amount of muscles possible (naturally), then you need to be the strongest version of yourself while taking care of the other parameters like nutrition, stress, recovery, etc. Full body training has been proven to aid in the process better than body part split routines in general because of factors like increased frequency of training each muscle, adequate rest & recovery, etc.
 
On the other hand, body part split/bro split routines have been used by people over decades with great success with respect to building muscles; hence we cannot discard the process entirely. I feel the mind-muscle connection can be established in a bro-split routine better than a full body, strength focused routine.
 
In my opinion, there are just way too many variables in a bro-split routine to manage, track, and progress. It also requires way too training days to be effective. I would always recommend a well structured, well periodized full body routine to a beginner-intermediate lifter who seeks strength and muscle gains. It usually takes 3–4 training days a week to make excellent progress.
 
If you don’t mind spending some money, I would recommend 
Barbell Medicine
; they have excellent training templates for pretty much any goals that you have. If you’re looking for free resources, you can check out 
Brian Alsruhe’s
 YouTube channel; he has good guidelines to create your own program. If you’re an absolute beginner, you can go for 
Starting Strength Linear Progression
 or 
StrongLifts 5x5
.
@PallavPanda

The other people in the building were all friendly enough but they were all lacking in one department or other. Downstairs from us was an old dude cal
Continue Reading
I spent the summer of 1989 living with three other recent UK graduates in a cheap wooden apartment building behind the strip in Virginia Beach. I’ve looked on Google Street View and it isn’t there anymore, which is just as well because it was a dump.
 
The other people in the building were all friendly enough but they were all lacking in one department or other. Downstairs from us was an old dude called Claud whose apartment looked like the sort of place that would have a hostage imprisoned in the basement (fortunately it didn’t have one) and at the end of the hall was Joe from Florida who jumped out of his window one night when the cops came after him in relation to a coke bust. But the best was a family called the Canterburys who lived between us and Joe.
 
The Canterbury family consisted of a woman and her two teenage daughters. I think there was a father somewhere but we never saw him so he was either permanently drunk/stoned in their apartment or in jail. During our time there Mrs C and her daughters came up with a dazzling array of dumb questions, such as:
 
 * Aw, you from Inglund! Did you drive here?
 * Say, can you cycle to Paris from your house in England?
 
And my personal favourite:
 
 * Do you guys speak English in England?
 
But our experience was entirely benign compared to that of Keith, one of my other roommates. Keith was Zambian by birth and he had the darkest skin you’ve ever seen but he had received an expensive education in the UK and he had an upper-class British accent that was the aural equivalent of cut crystal. This apparent contradiction confused the hell out of the locals.
 
The other three of us were able to get relatively well-paying summer jobs but Keith, despite his first-class law degree from Cambridge (iirc), could only get a job as a golf caddy. This was clearly on account of his extreme blackness a...

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I’m English but I live in Germany. I used to live in a very pretty town with lots of tourists. One day I saw a group of old tourists in my street taking it in turns to take photos of each other. Hearing that they were Americans I asked them in English if I could help them by taking a group photo of all of them standing together. They happily agreed and we chatted a little after I’d finished taking the photos. I told them that I had recently moved over from England.
 
At one point, a local guy I knew walked past. We said the German equivalent of “Hi. How are you doing?” to each other and I continu
Continue Reading
I’m English but I live in Germany. I used to live in a very pretty town with lots of tourists. One day I saw a group of old tourists in my street taking it in turns to take photos of each other. Hearing that they were Americans I asked them in English if I could help them by taking a group photo of all of them standing together. They happily agreed and we chatted a little after I’d finished taking the photos. I told them that I had recently moved over from England.
 
At one point, a local guy I knew walked past. We said the German equivalent of “Hi. How are you doing?” to each other and I continued chatting to the Americans.
 
One of the guys suddenly became a lot less friendly and said
 
“Why are you bullshitting us?”,
 
“Sorry? What do you mean?”,
 
“You told us you were from England!”,
 
“I am!”,
 
“No you're not!”,
 
“Excuse me?”,
 
“We just heard you!”,
 
“Heard me what?”,
 
“Talking German to that guy!”,
 
“And?”,
 
“You're German, not a Brit!”,
 
“I am a Brit!”,
 
“You can't be. We all just heard you speaking German. Brits talk English!”,
 
“But I live here! I can speak German!”,
 
“Come on guys, let's get outta here”, the man said to his group as they shuffled off, looking back to give me evil looks and tut.
 
They simply couldn't get their heads around the idea that a native English speaker could or would speak another language. It's a pity my best friends from Virginia and Florida weren't there to show off their German skills!
 
• There's no need for people to point out that most Americans aren't this stoopid. I know. I was simply answering the question. And, incidentally, I couldn't speak any other languages before I moved abroad.

A good home workout routine can be tailored to your fitness level, goals, and available equipment. Here’s a balanced routine that includes strength training, cardio, and flexibility work. Aim to do this routine 3-5 times a week.
 
Sample Home Workout Routine
 
Warm-Up (5-10 minutes)
- Jumping jacks: 1 minute
- Arm circles: 30 seconds each direction
- High knees: 1 minute
- Bodyweight squats: 10-15 reps
Strength Training (20-30 minutes)
 
Perform 2-3 sets of 10-15 reps for each exercise.
Push-Ups
 (standard or modified on knees)
Bodyweight Squats
Lunges
 (alternating legs)
Plank
 (hold for 20-60 seconds)
Tricep Dips
 (using a chair or low table)
Glute Bridges
Cardio (10-15 minutes)
 
Choose one or mix them up:
Burpees: 30 seconds on, 30 seconds rest
Mountain climbers: 30 seconds on, 30 seconds rest
High knees: 30 seconds on, 30 seconds rest
Jump rope (if available): 1 minute on, 30 seconds rest
Cool Down and Flexibility (5-10 minutes)
Forward fold stretch: 30 seconds
Quad stretch: 30 seconds per leg
Shoulder stretch: 30 seconds per arm
Cat-Cow stretch: 1 minute
Child’s pose: 1 minute
Tips
Adjust Intensity
: Modify exercises to fit your fitness level (e.g., knee push-ups vs. standard push-ups).
Equipment
: If you have dumbbells, resistance bands, or a stability ball, incorporate them for added resistance.
Rest
: Allow at least one rest day between strength training sessions to recover.
Hydration
: Stay hydrated before, during, and after your workout.
Always listen to your body, and consult a healthcare professional before starting any new exercise program, especially if you have pre-existing health conditions or concerns.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Backpacking through Vietnam opened my eyes in more ways than one.
 
After a few days, I decided to join a group of travelers from around the world.
 
I made friends from New Zealand, Australia, The United Kingdom, Canada, Switzerland, Portugal and, of course, one cannot forget, The Netherlands.
 
I was the only American.
 
For the next ten days, the two Dutch friends proceeded to make jokes at my expense at the point where I soon became immune to their American stereotyping.
 
They constantly asked me with the deepest, sarcastic Dutch accent you can muster:
 
“So in America, if someone is bleeding out on the st
Continue Reading
Backpacking through Vietnam opened my eyes in more ways than one.
 
After a few days, I decided to join a group of travelers from around the world.
 
I made friends from New Zealand, Australia, The United Kingdom, Canada, Switzerland, Portugal and, of course, one cannot forget, The Netherlands.
 
I was the only American.
 
For the next ten days, the two Dutch friends proceeded to make jokes at my expense at the point where I soon became immune to their American stereotyping.
 
They constantly asked me with the deepest, sarcastic Dutch accent you can muster:
 
“So in America, if someone is bleeding out on the street, do you call 911 or check their pockets to see if they have health insurance first?”
 
“So in America, do you eat french fries every day? Why are they called “french” fries if they are America’s favorite dish?”
 
“So in America, if you slip on the street outside of someone’s home, you can sue them for millions of dollars, yeah? This is a good place, America.”
 
“So in America, everyone is equal right? Black, white, brown, etc.? This is written in your constitution, no? America, land of the free.”
 
“So in America, you have helped so many people in Iraq and Afghanistan. They must be so much better off now?”
 
Before travelling abroad, I had never realized the gripes people around the world had with America’s health care, food, pop culture, legal system, race relations, and foreign policy, among other things.
 
While much of these were said in good fun and were hyperbole, it’s still worth noting that every joke has a kernel of truth.
 
After this, I realized that I was the most ignorant American I had ever met.

If you train 3 days a week or less, whole-body is the only rational option.
 Each of the 4 basic movements requires at least 2 and preferably 3 training sessions per week and this cannot be fitted into 3 days with any kind of split.
 
(A whole body routine does not mean that every training session is identical. Just that you train the 4 basic movements (lower body push/pull, upper body push/pull) each time you train. You can vary the exercises, reps, weight etc.)
 
If you are at a level of advancement such that you are unable to progress with the stress you can accumulate in the training time you have, you need to add more sessions.
 
Let’s take an example of a very strong lifter, let’s call him Ali, with a 300kg squat, working on 400. Ali has decided to do 8 sets of 3 reps with 250kg (83%) on his main squat day, Monday. He also does front squats on Wednesday, up to 180kg 3x3 and paused squats on Friday, 200kg 5x5. His workout goes as follows.
 
20kg x 20
50kg x 10
80kg x 5
120kg x 5
160kg x 3
200kg x 3
220kg x 1
240kg x 1
250kg x 3,3,3,3,3,3,3,3
 
That’s a total of 16 sets. Ali takes 8 minutes of rest between the work sets, 3 minutes between the lighter warmup sets and 5 between the heavier ones. That’s about 90 minutes of rest total, so we’re looking at close to 2 hours, just for squats.
 
Now, at this point his focus and attention are beginning to flag, his legs tire and he’s getting hungry. Time to stop. Bench presses will have to wait until Tuesday.
 
If you’re not at Ali’s level, there is probably little benefit to splitting up your workout.

title: How to workout
article:
To get the results you want from a workout, holding your body in a proper position is just as important as the workout itself. Doing exercises correctly will help you:
 
No matter what moves you're doing, from a push-up to a lunge, try to follow these 10 form guidelines. (If possible, use a full-length mirror to check the position of your body.)
Look out at eye level or above to spare your neck and keep you from rolling your shoulders forward.
Keep your face relaxed and tension free.
Relax your shoulders and lift up your chest.

Continue Reading
To get the results you want from a workout, holding your body in a proper position is just as important as the workout itself. Doing exercises correctly will help you:
 
No matter what moves you're doing, from a push-up to a lunge, try to follow these 10 form guidelines. (If possible, use a full-length mirror to check the position of your body.)
Look out at eye level or above to spare your neck and keep you from rolling your shoulders forward.
Keep your face relaxed and tension free.
Relax your shoulders and lift up your chest.
Pretend the top of your head is being pulled up by a string to elongate your spine and keep you from rolling forward.
Count the reps for each exercise out loud; counting helps you remember to breathe continuously. (Many people hold their breath while doing strength training.)
Keep your abs tight to support your lower back. (Practice sucking in every time you enter a car, bus, train, plane, elevator, escalator, everywhere—that way, it becomes automatic.)
Keep your knees slightly bent, so you don't lock them.
Make sure you can (if you want to) always see your hands when doing shoulder exercises.
Keep moving in between exercises to keep your heart rate up, or move directly to the next exercise. If you can't hold a conversation, you're exercising too hard. If you can talk a blue streak, you may not be going hard enough.
As you get fitter, go longer rather than harder with cardio exercises and stronger with weight exercises—that is, do more repetitions. But it's more important to follow perfect form and do fewer reps than to do a lot of repetitions with form that's sloppier than spaghetti in a high chair.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Pros:
 
1: Most muscles are being targeted every single day due to the higher frequency.
 
2: Good for beginners and intermediates who don't require a high amount of volume. But the frequency has to lower between 3 to 6 times per week. Also, fatigue management isn't a big issue for beginners.
 
3: Almost none of the sets will be taken to failure and soreness will be minimized to allow training every day which is good for beginners who get demotivated by muscle soreness.
 
4: A good full-body pump post-workout.
Cons:
 
1: Not good for advanced athletes who need high volume to stimulate growth.
 
2: This type of t
Continue Reading
Pros:
 
1: Most muscles are being targeted every single day due to the higher frequency.
 
2: Good for beginners and intermediates who don't require a high amount of volume. But the frequency has to lower between 3 to 6 times per week. Also, fatigue management isn't a big issue for beginners.
 
3: Almost none of the sets will be taken to failure and soreness will be minimized to allow training every day which is good for beginners who get demotivated by muscle soreness.
 
4: A good full-body pump post-workout.
Cons:
 
1: Not good for advanced athletes who need high volume to stimulate growth.
 
2: This type of training contains a large number of exercises. At least 5. There has to be a warmup for each exercise which means a lot of time spent doing warm-up sets. Advanced athletes will also need to include many isolation exercises.
 
3: Even after warm-up, it takes at least 2 sets to get a grasp of the technique and make the most out of an exercise. A higher frequency training means a lower number of sets per session which won’t allow performing more than 2–3 sets for an exercise. This is why advanced athletes train with a lower frequency, less number of exercises, and a higher number of sets per session. Less warmup and more exercise.
 
4: Too much fatigue will accumulate due to training every single day. This might not be a concern for beginners but it will affect advanced athletes. It's better to train full body 3–6 times per week and adjust rest days accordingly.
 
Full-body workouts are undoubtedly effective but doing them every single day is not.
 
Subscribe to 
Brawny King Fitness
 for legit fitness videos.

This wasn't so much a failure of the person, but more importantly I think our education system.
 
Was traveling in the car with the ex-wife, her 10 year old daughter, and my 7 year old son. I have no idea how it first came up, but the conversation went something like this.
 
Me: yeah, it's crazy to think that all those stars we see at night are Suns that could have planets just like Earth orbiting them. It's silly to think we're the only life in the universe.
 
Ex: Stars aren't Suns, there's only one sun. Ours is the only sun there is!
 
Ex's daughter: yeah, there's only one sun….
 
Me: errrr… (me and my son look at each other kind of lost for a few moments) you know our sun is a star…. Right????
 
Ex: no it's not! It's a sun!!!
 
Me: ummmm… what do you think stars are?
 
Ex: They’re rocks!
 
Ex's daughter: yeah, they’re rocks!
 
Once again me and my son just look at each other blankly for a moment.
 
Me: Rocks? Why would you think they were rocks???
 
Ex:. Because when they fall, they're rocks!!! I've seen them!
 
Me: you mean shooting stars???
 
Ex: Yeah!!
 
Ex's daughter: exactly!
 
Anyway, I questioned them a bit after that. It came down to the sun is big, stars are small. They thought they were little lights cause the sun was reflecting off of them….
 
So I explained meteorites, and stars, and Suns. They finally got it, but they really had never known!
 
She was 32 at the time…..
 
She wasn't a dumb person, she was really pretty smart most of the time. But she and her daughter both had taken shooting stars literally, and never questioned it deeper. Science wasn't her thing, but still…. Education fail!!!!

Q: “ Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met? “
 
I’d like to open with Simon Morton’s ending paragraph, on his reply : -
 
“Really nice guys and not stupid but very insular and didn't really have a great understanding of the rest of the world.” ….. As this is frequently the case, and the laugh or eye-roll you do is tinged with pathos. Although there were exceptions. Anyway….
 
a; I’m 11, on my first foreign holiday out of Britain : Ostend in Brussels. My parents booked a coach trip to Paris, with a quick tour of the city, followed by a show at the Lido (poor man’s Follies - my first topless women experience😜 ). The bus is moving slowly in traffic, through the Arab quarter & gets parallel to a small park, where kids are playing. Hearing them through the open windows, elderly U.S. lady is amazed how well they speak French !! 🤷‍♂️🤦‍♂️
 
b: I’m 22, on my first surf trip to N. Spain; S.W. France. 1971. Vietnam is still going, we meet up with a SoCal surfer who has “draft dodged”, Given money by parents & uncle, after 2 cousins already injured out, he had flown to Paris & trained it down to Biarritz. After a few months travelling in France, Spain & Portugal, he was … “… hoping to go & get work in New Zealand - IS THAT ANYWHERE NEAR HERE !???” 🤣🙄 [Beautiful irony being N.Z. & France are almost EXACTLY opposite one another, on a globe]
 
c: Now 33, Burleigh Heads, QUEENSLAND, Visiting SoCal surfer spouting off how much cheaper his Macca’s burger would be “back home”, in the usual “We’re #1” mode… until we explain the US-Aus$ exchange rate: ours is a dollar cheaper. in reality 🍔🍟
 
There are plenty more…. 😎

When I spent several months in Australia, a friend from here (USA) asked me, “But, they have 
stores
 and everything there, right?”
 
I also lived in Guadalajara Spain. So many people used to “correct” me, advising me that Guadalajara is in México (yes, that is so, but it is also a province in Spain).
 
Outside geography, I endure such things as,
 
“Aren’t you scared to move to Sweden? I heard they’re about to implement Sharia law there.”
 
“Sweden is so dangerous with all those refugees!”
 
“Cool; in Sweden you’ll be able to smoke marijuana without problems (Sweden is absurdly strict with respect to marijuana, which in no uncertain terms is seen as a bad drug and is VERY illegal)!”
 
“You will have to pay horrible taxes in Sweden, and the government controls you.”
 
“Spain’s Spanish is better than México’s”
 
“Mexican Spanish is very limited and simple.”
 
“Have fun; Europe has gone communist!”
 
Perhaps the most illustrative of sheer, unmitigated stupidity:
 
“Donald Trump will make America great again!”
 
Oh, they just keep rolling in.

Another one that actually brings rage to me is her theory on Sandy Hook. She says it was a hoax and that it never happened. And last but not least, her friend asked her to name off the 7 Continents. Her response was as follows: “America, Europe, China, Australia, Africa, and Germany, by the way, you can't trick me because there are not 7 continents, there are only 6”

Back in college days at UC Davis, where I have met an most utterly amusing (ignorant base on my friend) person ever.
 
Me and my college roommate were both hungry and eager for a burger. The Burger King was the best choice around the neighborhood. We bought our food at the counter with a white guy cash register (we were both Asian, Chinese just to clarify the picture here)
 
So, after we bough our food, we stood near the pick up counter next to the cash register. Then we heard this out of the blue:
 
Cashier who we bought the food from said, “Oh you must be Asian (point at me) and you must be white (point at my friend who is definitely Asian)”
 
My friend, “excuse me?” said plainly.
 
It’s morning around 8 o’clock after finals. We were both a bit worn out.
 
Cashier, “Oh I can tell you guys apart from your eyes,” Point at me, “you are Asian cuz you got that mono eyelids and your eyes are slanted,” and point at my friend, “You are white because your eyes look different than hers.”
 
The reason I didn’t say this was racist because this guy…… This guy said this without any insult in his words, and sounded like he is stating a mere fact. He sounded so sincere.
 
I was standing there in amusement and slight bit of confusion, thinking, “Am I really at a college town? This is really UC Davis, California? It’s either this guy is a complete idiot, or he has mad conversation skill.”
 
My friend here, her face immediately turned red and grabbed food without another word and head out of the door.
 
Coming from behind us, this guy said, “You ladies have a nice day.”
 
I honestly could only feel amusement at that moment.

We were a diverse group of people of all hues, hailing from the US, South Africa, India(including the restaurant owners) and little old me, from England. As we were all waiting for our meals to arrive, we engaged in polite conversation. I can't remember who I was talking to or saying, but I was rudely interr

I am from London, England. It is significant to tell you that I am also of African Caribbean descent.
 
I went to South Korea for a year, to teach English at which this offensive event took place. A large group of us foreign ESL teachers all met up for dinner, our restaurant of choice, Indian.
 
We were a diverse group of people of all hues, hailing from the US, South Africa, India(including the restaurant owners) and little old me, from England. As we were all waiting for our meals to arrive, we engaged in polite conversation. I can't remember who I was talking to or saying, but I was rudely interrupted by a girl who I think it's interesting to highlight, she was American but also of African descent, of which I found out later, her parents were also Caribbean!
 
Anyway, she interrupted my conversation rudely, asking me if my “accent was real or fake”!! I would like to point out that I have one of those cool London accents, a bit like Russel Brand from ‘Forgetting Sarah Marshall’, or so I’ve been told by another American guy I met there! She then reiterated and asked me if I was putting my “accent on”!!!
 
I was completely taken aback, a little humiliated actually and replied simply, that “I’m from London”. The rest of the time we were at the restaurant she would chuckle with her friend, every time I spoke, who interestingly was actually teaching in China and was in town for a visit.
 
So there we have it, whilst in Korea, in an Indian restaurant, with a bunch of foreigners from everywhere, an American thought it strange, that I was from England! As if, there was no such thing as a plane, travel or migration!!

article:

There really wasn't a whole lot going on in our town; our already low crime rate was pretty much non-existent that morning. The police scanner was quiet, no brush fires were burning, and for once she found herself with little and less to do.

Continue Reading
My mother was a reporter for our local newspaper. She had the crime beat.
 
One Tuesday morning, something insane had happened back east which impacted not just the whole country but the entire world. There really wasn't a whole lot going on in our town; our already low crime rate was pretty much non-existent that morning. The police scanner was quiet, no brush fires were burning, and for once she found herself with little and less to do.
 
She decided to go to the grocery store, figuring she'd do a little shopping and ask folks about their thoughts and reactions and fears while she was at it.
 
Everyone seemed to have variations of the same feelings: shock, fear, anger. She went out to her car.
 
There was a man in the parking lot, loading his truck with two shopping carts worth of bottled water. Enough to last one person for the better part of a year, she told me.
 
Bullseye, right? Here's a guy getting ready to go all the way off the grid. Had he been expecting something like this to happen sooner or later? Was he perhaps retired from government or intelligence, potentially still unofficially privy to off-the-record information which had yet to be made public?
 
She asked him why all the water.
 
His response?
 
They've got a great deal on water right now; I couldn't pass it up! No limit; I might come back for more later!
 
It was the afternoon of September 11, 2001, and my mother had to explain to this man that our country was under attack. She had found what may have been the last person in the nation to learn that the Twin Towers had been reduced to the world's biggest funeral pyre that morning.

article:

One of the local grocery stores in the small town she lived in had been purchased by someone described by her as a brown person. She had no idea what race they were, but she told me she no longer shopped there because she didn’t want to support terrorism.
 
Number two may just be a personal pet peeve, we were talking about arguing and they said that facts were

I want to clarify that these people aren’t ignorant about everything, but I have a few that have left me in awe. The first one was a girl I knew in Louisiana. She was getting married to a military guy, and wanted to be a good military wife. One of the local grocery stores in the small town she lived in had been purchased by someone described by her as a brown person. She had no idea what race they were, but she told me she no longer shopped there because she didn’t want to support terrorism.
 
Number two may just be a personal pet peeve, we were talking about arguing and they said that facts weren’t required for arguing a position. I spent the rest of the conversation informing them that they were an aligator, and that they couldn’t argue with my position, because that would require facts to prove otherwise. This same person also has a tendency to decide facts aren’t true if they don’t like the source. If I quote a study, they usually say it was probably a study by a liberal so it doesn’t count.
 
The next one is just kind of cute. It was a little older lady giving out samples of vegan chicken (meat substitute) at a Costco. She wanted to know how they could be sure a chicken never ate meat when everyone knows they love to eat bugs.
 
Number four is I was serving in a restaurant, and someone sent back their hash browns (shredded fried potatoes) because they tasted like potatoes.
 
This last one I’m not sure if it was a typo or just having the wrong definition for a word. I saw an ad for a roommate on craigslist, and it was “Female only, must be emasculate.”
 
*edited to add a few more as I remember them.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
Sandwiches are a versatile and universally loved food, and their magic lies in the endless combinations of ingredients that can be used. While everyone has their preferences, here are some popular sandwich ingredients that stand out as favorites:
Cheese
Whether it’s cheddar, mozzarella, or Swiss, cheese is often a go-to ingredient. It adds a creamy texture and a delightful tanginess that complements almost any filling. Melted cheese in a grilled sandwich? Pure perfection!
Avocado
For a creamy, healthy twist, avocado is a favorite. Its mild flavor pairs well with other ingredients, and it’s a gre
Continue Reading
Sandwiches are a versatile and universally loved food, and their magic lies in the endless combinations of ingredients that can be used. While everyone has their preferences, here are some popular sandwich ingredients that stand out as favorites:
Cheese
Whether it’s cheddar, mozzarella, or Swiss, cheese is often a go-to ingredient. It adds a creamy texture and a delightful tanginess that complements almost any filling. Melted cheese in a grilled sandwich? Pure perfection!
Avocado
For a creamy, healthy twist, avocado is a favorite. Its mild flavor pairs well with other ingredients, and it’s a great option for those looking for a nutritious addition.
Chicken or Turkey
Grilled chicken, roasted turkey, or deli-style slices are perfect for a protein-packed sandwich. Their flavor pairs well with fresh veggies and sauces.
Tomatoes and Lettuce
These two staples bring freshness and crunch. A slice of juicy tomato and crisp lettuce balance out richer ingredients like meats and cheeses.
Eggs
A fried egg or a creamy egg salad makes a sandwich extra filling and flavorful. It’s perfect for breakfast sandwiches!
Pickles or Jalapeños
For those who love a tangy or spicy kick, pickles and jalapeños add an extra layer of flavor and crunch.
Sauces and Spreads
Mayonnaise, mustard, hummus, or even pesto can transform a simple sandwich into a gourmet treat. A well-chosen spread can elevate the entire experience.
While these are some of the most-loved ingredients, my personal favorite is 
[your choice—e.g., grilled chicken with avocado and chipotle mayo]
 because it combines rich, creamy, and spicy flavors in every bite.

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
The most effective workout routine for gaining muscle and strength while minimizing fat loss will vary depending on the individual's goals, preferences, and fitness level. However, a common recommendation is to perform a combination of strength training and cardiovascular exercise.
 
For gaining muscle and strength, it is important to prioritize resistance training exercises that target all major muscle groups. This can be achieved through either full-body or split routines.
 
Full-body routines typically involve performing exercises that target multiple muscle groups in each workout session. This c
Continue Reading
The most effective workout routine for gaining muscle and strength while minimizing fat loss will vary depending on the individual's goals, preferences, and fitness level. However, a common recommendation is to perform a combination of strength training and cardiovascular exercise.
 
For gaining muscle and strength, it is important to prioritize resistance training exercises that target all major muscle groups. This can be achieved through either full-body or split routines.
 
Full-body routines typically involve performing exercises that target multiple muscle groups in each workout session. This can be a good option for beginners or those with limited time to workout. Sample full-body workout routines may include exercises such as squats, deadlifts, bench press, rows, and overhead press.
 
Split routines involve dividing workouts into different muscle groups on different days, typically targeting one or two muscle groups per session. This can be a good option for more advanced lifters or those looking to focus on specific muscle groups. Sample split workout routines may include a push/pull/legs split, where push exercises (e.g. chest, shoulders, triceps) are performed on one day, pull exercises (e.g. back, biceps) on another day, and leg exercises on a separate day.
 
In terms of minimizing fat loss, it is important to combine strength training with cardiovascular exercise to create a calorie deficit. Adding in HIIT (high-intensity interval training) or steady-state cardio sessions a few times per week can help to burn additional calories and promote fat loss while maintaining muscle mass.

Once the girl heard medical, she told us

I once was eating lunch with a friend and one girl overheard us talking about Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton. She came up to us and asked us if we liked Donald Trump, because she was his big fan. Both of us said no, so she started explaining why she liked Republicans. One of her reasons was because she believed that women should be at home taking care of children. That made my friend laugh out loud, because she is a woman with big ambitions and goals. This led to a conversation about school and our majors. I was a pharmacy major and my friend medical. Once the girl heard medical, she told us that she wanted to be a doctor too, but she changed her major to business. She asked my friend if classes required for meds school were hard and explained that she was not very good at math, biology and chemistry. So we told her that those classes are pretty much core classes and if she wanted to pursue that career she should get used to it. After that she asked us which high school did we attend. I told her that I was not from here, so when I told her Czech Republic, she asked me if this was a city in Brazil. I am cool with people telling me Asia (because I’m of Asian descent), but I just replied with no it’s in Europe. So she said: “oh!! Yes! That’s a beautiful country in Africa, right?” At this point, I was just speechless. The girl must’ve noticed my facial expression because after that she told us that she was never good at geography. My friend was literally laughing her ass off and told her that Europe was a continent.
 
I’ve heard a lot of crap, but that day.. I will remember for the rest of my life.

Build muscle mass by simultaneously doing fewer repetitions. St

Follow these tips…..
Walking will help you to attain fitness and is a fantastic workout. Walk heel to toe by pushing off with your heel first and your toes last, which can give you the best workout and increase your level of effort. You should also work your arms when walking by only flexing at the elbow.
Maintain a log of everything you do each day. You should even find including the day’s weather was like. This can help you use the data to recognize patterns. If you were unable to exercise for a day or two, write down your reasons.
Build muscle mass by simultaneously doing fewer repetitions. Start by choosing a muscle group like the chest. Start with weights that are lighter weight to warm up your muscles.
It is a good idea to do approximately 15-20 reps with the warm-up weights. The second set should involve weights for which you can complete only able to do 6-8 reps. Add five more pounds of weight and repeat the third set.
Running outside setting is better for you to get on a treadmill. Running on paved surfaces is better in the winter than a treadmill.
When doing repetitious types of exercises that you need to count, you should count down instead of up. This keeps you an idea of just how many exercises you still have left and help keep your motivation level up.
You can boost your workouts by controlling your breathing properly. Try forcefully exhaling when your shoulders peak during situps. Deep breathing causes your ab muscles to work than normal.
Test out a bench before you use it for a workout. Press a finger into the padding and whether or not it can hold your weight.
BEST of LUCK

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was in an airport in Florida on my way to compete in a pageant in the Dominican. I was wearing my sash that said 'Miss Tourism Canada' and was travelling with a girl on my roster who also had her Canada sash on. We were just chatting about life when a woman came up to us and asked if we were really Canadian and not just Americans pretending to be Canadian so we could eligible to compete. We answered .. Of course we're Canandian! and laughed awkwardly. The woman says to us 'But you sound American..where are your accents?'
 
First of all, very rarely will you meet someone with a 'Canadian' accent
Continue Reading
I was in an airport in Florida on my way to compete in a pageant in the Dominican. I was wearing my sash that said 'Miss Tourism Canada' and was travelling with a girl on my roster who also had her Canada sash on. We were just chatting about life when a woman came up to us and asked if we were really Canadian and not just Americans pretending to be Canadian so we could eligible to compete. We answered .. Of course we're Canandian! and laughed awkwardly. The woman says to us 'But you sound American..where are your accents?'
 
First of all, very rarely will you meet someone with a 'Canadian' accent. The 'accent' most Americans refer to stem from the Maritimes (Atlantic provinces) and even then, many do not have an accent. We are a bilingual country so some residents of Quebec and northern Ontario will have a slight 'Quebecois' accent (similar to a French accent, but distinctly different). Not all Canadians end their sentences in 'eh' and we don't all sound like we were born and raised in some small town in the Atlantic.
 
Secondly, the American accent can be from the deep South, or unique like Minnesota and Boston. Even the Southern accent differs from state to state (I have a hard time understanding anyone from small town West Virginia). So I was really confused as to what American accent she thought we would have since your accents differs from region to region.
 
Thirdly, I'm a Toronto native. Toronto — a melting pot of cultures. Toronto — one of the most diverse cities in this country. Toronto — where we don't have a specific accent because our city speaks about 100 different languages.

What I also have noticed due to several answers here and personal experience later on, americans are not stupid but they often seem to know only what they need to know for their specific line of work. In Germany we would call someone like that “Fachidiot” literally translates to “subject idiot” but means someone who is extremly knowlegdeable in his field of work but mostly clueless about everything else.
 
It seems to me that the level of common knowledge of the world in Germany is higher then in the USA.
 
For example.
 
I wouldn’t expect from someone in the USA to know the name of the 16 states of Germany and their capitals, as I wouldn’t expect a German to know the 50 states of the USA and their capitals. But I would expect them to know where Germany or the USA are and what the main capital is.
 
That being said, we have a lot of ignorant people in Germany too.

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
Does it matter if you workout in the morning or at night? Are you setting yourself up for failure if you do the opposite?
 
In a world so fixated on optimization, inquiring minds want to know.
 
So, here's the research...
 
Working out in the evening has been shown to produce greater increases in muscle mass in the long term than morning training sessions.
 
A 
study
 done on young men over a 24 week period compared the effects of morning versus evening training using a combination of strength and endurance training.
 
While they found similar strength gains in both groups after 24 weeks, the group that traine
Continue Reading
Does it matter if you workout in the morning or at night? Are you setting yourself up for failure if you do the opposite?
 
In a world so fixated on optimization, inquiring minds want to know.
 
So, here's the research...
 
Working out in the evening has been shown to produce greater increases in muscle mass in the long term than morning training sessions.
 
A 
study
 done on young men over a 24 week period compared the effects of morning versus evening training using a combination of strength and endurance training.
 
While they found similar strength gains in both groups after 24 weeks, the group that trained in the evenings gained more muscle than the morning group.
 
This has been backed up by 
this study
, this 
one
 and this 
one.
 
It’s because of the circadian rhythm of your body temperature and hormones.
 
So based on the lab setting, working out in the evening is the way to go.
 
So does this mean you have to workout in the evening?
 
No.
 
While the study showed better results came in the evening, it doesn’t mean shit if you aren’t consistent. Think about all the distractions that comes along with working out in the evening...
 
Kids
 
Dinner
 
Tired from work
 
Every G-Damn bench taken on Mondays
 
In the morning all you have to fight is the urge to go back to bed. In the evening, you have to fight yourself and everyone else to get a bench.
 
Don’t get caught up in the nonsense of optimization if you can’t be consistent. Find a time that works for you and get ruthlessly consistent. Everything will take care of itself after that.
 
Aesthetic Physiques

Yes I am Poor materially
 
I come from a family of 6 being the first child, I studied Economics for my bachelors and worked hard to pay for my post graduate diploma in computer science.
 
During this program, my dad was retrenched without benefit from a bank where he worked for 16 years. My mum is a trader and my immediate younger brother is a very intelligent boy who is currently on a 4.5 GPA in his second year studying accounting.
 
His education is threatened as my father has no job. The other two younger once had to stall their tertiary education because of finances
 
I worked as a teacher and is still been owed a month wage, got another job although doesn't pay well, it keeps me busy
 
I love to learn, at this stage I don't really care for the money, I want the experience so I bought a power bank and a beat up laptop to learn how to program, I am still striving.
 
I want to intern, get relevant experience and learn but situation at home wouldn't allow. My wages goes straight to the family, no social life, I know that my sacrifices today will be rewarded in future.
 
But it is hard. My biggest fear is not having the opportunity to showcase my talent, to learn. I need to do things for myself but family over everything.
 
I am optimistic. I know I am poor materially that is and this has made me insecure, scared. What happens if I leave my family to pursue my dream. My younger ones such bright kids yearning for that opportunity to go to school but…………..
 
I can't deny them that, I have to work hard to make sure they realize their dream. If only things were better.

You workout properly by deciding if you want to build muscle or build strength( and yes building strength will give you muscle, but not as much as a bodybuilder)
 
If you choose strength: 
(which is a good choice btw) then you need a exercise that target all muscles at the same time.
 
These exercise are the best for building muscle strength:
 
Sumo-deadlift
Pull ups/chin ups(When you are able to do 20 pull ups, then you would be ready to do them with weights)
(Don’t think of other exercises than these two)
 
Now, you may ask how to do you do it. You do it by using progressive overload.
 
Progressive overload
 
It means you add 2,5 kg per week in your workouts. Let’s say you sumo-deadlift 20 kg. Next week 22,5 kg. next week 25 kg ,27,5kg, 30 kg and so on.
 
If it’s pull-up/chin up then you add 1 reps every week. Fx 2 pull up in week 1. 3 pull up in week 2. 4 pull up in week 5. 6 pull up in week 6. Simple, right?
 
2–3 times a week
 
See which one works best for you.
 
Diet:
 
Potatoes/brown rice(high carb= insulin better muscle growth)
 
All kinds of meat(just eat till you are full) It’s a myth that you need a lot of it.
 
Don’t run marathons
 
Running is great but more than 3 miles is unnescarry. HIIT or sprinting is better for fat loss and athlisme.
 
If you choose muscle building
 
Then you have to do a so called chest day, tricep day. Fx.
 
Monday: Chest & tricep
 
Thursaday: Back and biceps
 
Wednesday: Legs and shoulders
 
Thursday: abs
 
Friday: Idk, you choose
 
You choose isolation exercises like bicep curls and tricep extension.
 
Hope it helps

The thing happened actually in Poland, but with American’s couple so I hope it still counts. They were recently travelling to Poland and part of their visit was Auschwitz museum.
 
Honestly, that’s the saddest place I’ve ever been to. You spend two or three hours walking through German Nazi concentration camps and examination camps. There are pictures of people, who were tortured, sick, underfeed.. usually all of these. Guide is telling stories about how people got there, how many of them got killed, the way they were treated by Nazis.. Also, you walk through the places they lived in (hundreds of people leaving in one room, extremely painful “boxes” too small to sit or lie down in - as a way of punishment or.. just for Nazi’s fun. I cried almost through whole my visit there (and I’m not a crying type).
 
So I met this couple, they were just after visit in Auschwitz. They said it was one of the worst trips ever. I wasn’t surprised by that, as I said the place is very sad, so I thought they are just depressed after the visit. But then they started their story:
 
“You won’t believe how bad this trip was. We bought an organized trip - their took too many people, so the bus was very crowded.. and it was incredibly hot, so felt like ages before we got to Auschwitz. But when we arrived there, it got even worse. Place was full of visitors and there were queues everywhere. We felt squashed like the sardines all the time. 
You can’t imagine what we went through there. Now I know exactly how people imprisoned there felt.”
 
That was the most ignorant sentence I’ve heard in my life.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

So these two people are seriously overweight to the point that he needs to sleep with this oxygen aid o

I am about to describe a situation that we can call ‘benign ignorance’ — not the worst type of ignorance there is, but a bit alarming given that it is everywhere and seems acceptable.
 
European I am. I was in some country outside the US, and went for lunch to my friends’ parents —and that day also came for lunch her friend from high school and her American husband. Both live in the US, cannot remember where but it was not on the right coast, nor the left coast, somewhere in the middle I think. So these two people are seriously overweight to the point that he needs to sleep with this oxygen aid or otherwise he could not breathe. They call themselves ‘foodies’. My God the way he was eating, licking his fingers, everything, had not finished a portion and already another one was flying to his mouth. Then he dominated the conversation with things like “who are the top 10 jazz musicians of all time?” and things like that, which nobody can answer unless you are a music teacher like he is. I must confess I stayed very quiet because in this type of situations I prefer not to do much, would take too much energy. I would reply politely if someone tried to engage me in the conversation and would play along a little bit.
 
So at the end of this 2 hour show I overheard him say “his English is remarkable”.
 
WTF, thanks, not only I’ve had to stand you for 2 hours. I had international schooling all the way through, have a PhD, and went to Cambridge and all that.
 
I think that some times ignorance is not knowing your place in the whole world and stop questioning your own environment.

In school after the Sandy Hook Shooting. There was a discussion about our constitutional rights. And of course the gun bearing rights subject came up. This one girl came up and talked about the danger of guns. And here is the thing, she was actually passionate and was talking about the government’s lack of restriction of background checks…and then she mentions this:
 
“
Nowhere in our amendments does it say we have the right to bear arms!! Never is the history of the US has there been a right to have arms. Arms should only be in the hands of the government, having guns at the hands of civilians is something only Hitler would do!!! In fact the founding fathers said that civilians cannot have arms”
 
She confidently said this
 
It was sad to see that this girl who was making some good points back her points with this utterly wrong statement. I mean are you serious??? How have you lived in America all your life, being smart enough to know a lot of things yet forget the most basic and fundamental aspect of American history. Second amendments does give the right to bear arms, it is the most important amendment. And no, Hitler did not give his civilians guns, his most famous speech says that disarming citizens is the best way to control them! we countered her by using hard evident facts that of the Hitler quote and showed her the Second Amendment using a book of the US Constitution, and yet she refuses the fact and uses her gut as historic evidence.
 
We usually relate ignorance with the christian right in the US but even those even in the other side can have their times.

A hardcore Trump supporter. 
An American who claimed to be a scientist but believed in creationism.
 
I met this American old gentleman at a Safari lodge in India. After some chit-chat around the magnificent Royal Bengal Tiger, the conversation veers towards how Indians co-exist peacefully with wild animals.
 
Him : I am also impressed by the way you Indians respect the elderly. And that is because your religion teaches you that.
 
Me: it's a cultural thing. Not a religious thing.
 
Him: In America, we have thrown religion out of our schools and colleges. And we are degrading.
 
Me: Really ?? US continues to lead the world in producing amazing intellectual talent.
 
Him: Not anymore. But it will change under Trump. He will make things right.
 
Me: Really? From whatever little I have seen and heard him talk, he doesn't seem credible.
 
Him: Don't trust what you see on CNBC and CNN. They have hidden agendas.
 
The next day, after some conversation around wildlife ….
 
Him: My colleagues who are in research, are convinced that only God could have created us. The DNA is such a wonderful piece of engineering, that it couldn't be created by itself.
 
Me: Interesting. Are you in scientific research?
 
Him: Mainly academics. Teaching.And I teach my students to keep their minds open about speculative theories such as evolution.
 
Me: So you are a professor. Which university?
 
Him: Not a university.
 
Me: Some institute then. Which one ?
 
Him: XYZ School.
 
I look up the school on Google and it turns out to be a primary / middle school.
 
Best of luck, America !

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

She mentioned that she was planning on doing her curtains or so in orange /red colour . She told me- I looked up ‘orange and red combination’ and Google surprisingly throwed me these pictures of Indian brides wearing such colors.
 
I was quick to confirm , ‘Yeah, that's correct , most Indian brides wear red/orange/pink colour dress on their wedding ’ .
 
Wide eyed and shockingly she asks ‘Why not White??’
 
This was funny and surprising. As if white for wedding was as
Continue Reading
Few weeks into my new job, one day, I was talking with an older American woman in my office , and something about wedding attire came up.
 
She mentioned that she was planning on doing her curtains or so in orange /red colour . She told me- I looked up ‘orange and red combination’ and Google surprisingly throwed me these pictures of Indian brides wearing such colors.
 
I was quick to confirm , ‘Yeah, that's correct , most Indian brides wear red/orange/pink colour dress on their wedding ’ .
 
Wide eyed and shockingly she asks ‘Why not White??’
 
This was funny and surprising. As if white for wedding was as obvious as the nose on my face.
 
I didn't know where to start. The truth is, aside from red being the colour of marriage , plain white is a colour of mourning in Indian culture (more so , Hindu culture) , so it is specifically prohibited during the weddings. Traditionally, the colour white had been associated with clothes that a widow wears.
 
But I obviously did not want to offend her by saying that.
 
Edit (after story ) : On why I did not educate her about Hindu tradition-
 
Wedding is sacred in all cultures and so are the colors and traditions associated with them. I did not want to stain her lifelong belief by telling her that what's sacred for her is cursed for me. She does not need to know that, not from me atleast .
 
But yes, I did not leave her ignorant forever. I told her the importance of red colour in Indian weddings , without discrediting her faith. Few days later I brought my wedding pictures and shared it with her and my other colleagues.

title: How to workout
article:
Here are some practical suggestions I’ve learned along the way to help make exercise:
 
1.Aerobic Exercises:
 Understand aerobic exercise. Aerobic exercise is often called a “cardio” workout, since it is designed to increase and improve blood flow. These types of exercises are of a lower intensity but last for longer periods of time.
 
Climb stairs. Climbing stairs is a great way to get your heart rate up. You can climb actual stairs or you can use a stair machine at a gym. Climbing stairs improves your leg muscles as well as your butt. Be careful if using actual stairs, however, as you do not want 
Continue Reading
Here are some practical suggestions I’ve learned along the way to help make exercise:
 
1.Aerobic Exercises:
 Understand aerobic exercise. Aerobic exercise is often called a “cardio” workout, since it is designed to increase and improve blood flow. These types of exercises are of a lower intensity but last for longer periods of time.
 
Climb stairs. Climbing stairs is a great way to get your heart rate up. You can climb actual stairs or you can use a stair machine at a gym. Climbing stairs improves your leg muscles as well as your butt. Be careful if using actual stairs, however, as you do not want to fall and get seriously injured.
 
Jump rope. This is not just a fun game for children but also an excellent workout. Working the arms, legs and core muscles, this is an exercise that you can easily do at home. It is also well known for improving balance and is excellent for people who intend to play sports.
 
Do jumping jacks. Jumping jacks are an exercise performed by standing with the legs together, arms at your side, and then jumping to move the legs outward and raising the arm together above your head. Jump again to return to the starting position. These are great for getting your heart rate up and burning calories.
 
Swim. Swimming is great exercise and is fun to boot. This will work different muscles depending on the style of swimming you do. Swimming is frequently recommended for people with joint problems or those that are significantly overweight, as it can take a great deal of strain off of the skeleton while still raising the heart rate.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
A computer science college student asked to meet with me for coffee for career advice (I’m the CEO of a tech startup). This is something I do infrequently, so I agreed.
 
He more or less hinted at wanting a position with my company, so I gave him a bit of an overview of what we do, which involves sharia-compliant financial products. I asked him if he knew that Muslims are not allowed to charge/pay interest, and he said that he did not know that. After a few minutes of explaining he asked:
 
“So when you say ‘Muslim’ - that means someone who is Jewish, right?”
 
“No, a Muslim is someone who follows the 
Continue Reading
A computer science college student asked to meet with me for coffee for career advice (I’m the CEO of a tech startup). This is something I do infrequently, so I agreed.
 
He more or less hinted at wanting a position with my company, so I gave him a bit of an overview of what we do, which involves sharia-compliant financial products. I asked him if he knew that Muslims are not allowed to charge/pay interest, and he said that he did not know that. After a few minutes of explaining he asked:
 
“So when you say ‘Muslim’ - that means someone who is Jewish, right?”
 
“No, a Muslim is someone who follows the religion of Islam. A Jew or a Jewish person is someone who follows Judaism.”
 
“Right, but Muslim means Jewish right?”
 
“No, Muslim means a follower of Islam. Jew means a follower of Judaism.”
 
“Right I get that, but if you say someone is a Muslim it means they are a Jew.”
 
“No. No. There are two religions: Islam and Judaism. They are separate religions. Muslim is both the adjective and noun for person who follows Islam. Jewish is the adjective and jew is the noun for a person who follows Judaism.”
 
“Wait, wait…. so you’re saying Islam and Judaism are separate religions?!?” Total shock on his part at this point.
 
I then proceeded to draw venn diagrams explaining why Judaism, Islam, and Christianity are distinct religions.
 
I guess the most shocking part for me was how much of world history and global politics would be lost on such a “college educated” person who didn’t have the slightest understanding that Judaism and Islam are not the same thing.

Continue Reading
How do you get the best results possible with the least time invested?
 
Full-body workouts.
If you are a beginner do them twice per week, and if you are intermediate or advance then you can do them three times per week.
 
I would also add in that another great option for advanced trainers is a 4-day upper lower split. But that is for people with especially good recovery abilities.
 
It amazes me how much the bodybuilding industry has confused the shit out of people. Telling them to workout 6 times per week, eat 2 grams of protein per pound of bodyweight, and other useless nonsense. Sure that works for the guys taking steroids, but all it does for a natural trainer is lead them nowhere. Yeah, you might experience results in a few months, but after that you’ll stagnate.
 
Full-body workouts on the other hand, are the perfect routines for natural trainers. They offer enough volume, but not too much to where you can’t recover from. In addition, you’re joints and central nervous system get more of a break and time to recover because you’re not training as often.
 
All you need in a full-body workout is a major push, a major pull, and a major legs exercise. The intermediate and advance could also benefit from some assistance exercises for the arms and calves. But other than that, this is all you will ever need to grow. I currently am 6′1 and weigh 203 lbs, at 11 percent body fat. And I have been on a maintenance routine only lifting weights twice per week and sprinting on a third day. I haven’t gained any mass (hence the maintenance routine) but I still have continued to gain strength. One of my example workouts was this:
 
Weighted Dips: Work up to max set of 5 reps
 
Weighted Chin-ups: Work up to max set of 5 reps
 
Squats: Work up to max set...

article:

I attend a public high school and my school district is rated as one of the best in the state. As a student, I took ever advanced class offered to me so I usually never interacted with the general education students. There was one class that was the exception to this rule. And it led to many hilarious experiences. However, there was one that I will never forget.
 
It was my freshman year and the class was online PE (if that so
Continue Reading
I have lived my entire life in Texas, more specifically a suburb of Dallas. They people in metropolitan areas usually defy the stereotype of the dumb country hick… usually. I attend a public high school and my school district is rated as one of the best in the state. As a student, I took ever advanced class offered to me so I usually never interacted with the general education students. There was one class that was the exception to this rule. And it led to many hilarious experiences. However, there was one that I will never forget.
 
It was my freshman year and the class was online PE (if that sounds like a joke of a class, it's because it is.) Online PE was, of course, taught in the computer lab. However, simultaneously there was many upperclassmen taking credit recovery. Most of the time they screwed around, aperently not concerned with the fact that because they had failed a class, they risked not graduating. Periodically, the teacher would yell at them and tell them to get to work. It was during one of these (rare) periods in which the seniors where actually working that I was asked that faithful question.
 
“Hey man, how do you spell quick?” The senior sitting next to me was writing an essay of some kind. I stared at him, wondering if I had heard him correctly. “Quick as in, the quick brown fox?” I asked. “Yeah man, quick.” “Q-U-I-C-K” I said suppressing a laugh. “Awww thanks bro.”
 
WHAT?! You're telling me that a senior in high school couldn't spell a first grade level word?! Increbile levels of ignorance were on display during that interaction.
