Ignorant is not an American only problem, when I lived in Greece, I met ignorant people from all over the world that came there on vacation. The Greeks though, are pretty well informed about most things.
 
Ignorant is not the same as stupid, stupid is also not an American only problem.
 
I did know a young US Navy Sailor, female, who sat down next to me at the base club. She asked me if I had heard the news, I said” that you were pregnant”, she said “yes”. My response was “yes I had heard that”, she responded “I don’t know how it happened” I responded “well, were you having sex” she said “yes, of course” I asked if she was” using birth control” she said “no whats that” I said “well, that’s how it starts”. she looked at me with a blank stare, so I explained to her how having sex leads to pregnancy…clueless, she had no idea the two were linked.
 
I have met others, more than one Brit, who were unaware that Germany had bombed London and other British Cities, during WW2, which she had also never heard of.
 
I met an Australian who thought black folks in America had tails.
 
I also met another Brit that had no idea that the meat purchased in a store belonged to a living animal recently and that that animal had to be killed to obtain it. She thought it was just something that the store made.
 
I could go on, 22 years in the military, and you see it all.

Thanks for the ATA.
 
Short answer is YES.
 
Long answer is still YES but I would go further and say you wouldn’t need to do the full body in each session.
 
Especially if you are lifting heavy and with intensity each session you might find it tough, instead I would recommend a 3 day split using 2 alternating workouts.
 
You can make great strength and muscle gains with this type of split, espeically if you nutrition is dialled in.
 
For example:
 
Workout A - Chest, shoulders, triceps & abs
 
Workout B - Legs, back, biceps & calves
 
You would rotate the workouts each week performing one once and one twice i.e…
 
Week 1
 
Mon - Workout A
 
Tues - Rest
 
Wed - Workout B
 
Thur - Rest
 
Fri - Workout A
 
Sat - Rest
 
Sun - Rest
 
Week 2
 
Mon - Workout B
 
Tues - Rest
 
Wed - Workout A
 
Thur - Rest
 
Fri - Workout B
 
Sat - Rest
 
Sun - Rest
 
Notes:
Focus primarily on compound movements with a few isolation thrown in to round out your physique.
Aim to work using 75 - 85% of your 1RM and lifting the 4 - 8 rep range for compound and 8 - 12 for isolation.
Apply progressive overload and stay consistent
Cardio is optional and is best done as high intensity sessions of 20mins
I hope this helps.
 
Good luck on your fitness journey.

title: How workout exercises?
article:
I’m 41, spend on average 15 minutes a day exercising, yet have a resting heart rate of 38–44 beats per minute.
 
That’s in line with many athletes!
 
But I’m a middle-aged entrepreneur?
 
Your resting heart rate broadly tells you how fit you are - the lower the better. Anything below 60 is very good.
 
You can measure yours now.
 
So how have I got mine so low?
 
By simply following the advice from studies.
 
Plenty show that the most effective way to get fit is to do 
a minute or two of exercise a day at maximum capacity 
a few days a week.
 
That’s it!
 
No need to run for hours.

I’m 41, spend on average 15 minutes a day exercising, yet have a resting heart rate of 38–44 beats per minute.
 
That’s in line with many athletes!
 
But I’m a middle-aged entrepreneur?
 
Your resting heart rate broadly tells you how fit you are - the lower the better. Anything below 60 is very good.
 
You can measure yours now.
 
So how have I got mine so low?
 
By simply following the advice from studies.
 
Plenty show that the most effective way to get fit is to do 
a minute or two of exercise a day at maximum capacity 
a few days a week.
 
That’s it!
 
No need to run for hours.
 
So here’s what I’ve incorporated in my life…
I live on the 40th floor, so I often run up the stairs. It takes me around 7 minutes.
At home I skip with a skipping/jump rope for 3–5 mins, and do quick sets of press-ups or bar pulls. Total workout time less than 10 minutes.
Play squash - intense 30 minutes.
Runs - 7 - 10 minutes.
I try to do something everyday. And yes, I don’t do only a minute or two - it doesn’t feel satisfying enough.
 
I’ve got my son using these techniques. I’m not making this shit up, but his coach did some Cooper Test which says he’s almost fit enough to be a Premiership footballer, and he’s just turned 11.
That’s him on the left.
 
For more information Google “HIIT” or watch this video.
Anyway, so there you have it…

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
There are more than three foundational movements that you would need to include in your workout in order for it to be complete, therefore it’s impossible for you to have a truly complete workout if you limit yourself to only performing three exercises.
 
So my first suggestion is to ditch this arbitrary three exercise limitation, and design your workouts around including as many foundational movements as possible within the amount of time that you have available for your workout. Even if you only have fifteen minutes to exercise, you can still do a hell of a lot more than three exercises.
 
With tha
Continue Reading
There are more than three foundational movements that you would need to include in your workout in order for it to be complete, therefore it’s impossible for you to have a truly complete workout if you limit yourself to only performing three exercises.
 
So my first suggestion is to ditch this arbitrary three exercise limitation, and design your workouts around including as many foundational movements as possible within the amount of time that you have available for your workout. Even if you only have fifteen minutes to exercise, you can still do a hell of a lot more than three exercises.
 
With that being said, if you’re still determined to restrict yourself to three exercises, I suggest you chose a squat, a push, and a pull movement. There are a variety of squat, push, and pull movements that you can perform, depending on the equipment you have access to. Assuming you’re using free weights, I’ll suggest the following:
Front Squat
Bench Press
Bent-Over Row
If you don’t have access to weights, and you’re strictly doing bodyweight exercises, then you could do the following:
Bulgarian Split Squat
Push-Up
Pull-Up
But again, any workout that limits you to just three exercises will still leave out several important foundational movements, so I don’t understand why you would impose such a strange and arbitrary limitation like this on your workouts.

At 10 AM several reporters from local radio stations and the local newspaper would gather at the Sherriff's office to be filled in on what had happened in our town in the past 24 hours. One of the women reporters who lorded it over the rest of us because she had graduated from a 4 year college with a degree in Broadcast Journalism asked the following question. "I have a follow up on the story from 
Continue Reading
I was General Manager of a small town radio station in Northern Minnesota. Our reporter was ill one morning so I filled in for her and among my other duties I went to what was called Sheriff's call. At 10 AM several reporters from local radio stations and the local newspaper would gather at the Sherriff's office to be filled in on what had happened in our town in the past 24 hours. One of the women reporters who lorded it over the rest of us because she had graduated from a 4 year college with a degree in Broadcast Journalism asked the following question. "I have a follow up on the story from the other night, the drug bust. Were they arrested for possession of amphibians? Followed up by and since the charges were lowered was it because of a flea bargain? My fellow reporters and the Sheriff looked at each other holding our grins back and the Sheriff said "I don't believe there were any fleas or amphibians involved." Her little I am better than you bubble had just burst and she had no clue. That 4 year degree was I thought worth nothing. A couple of months later she disappeared from out little town and appeared on the CBS TV affiliate in Duluth as a TV reporter. I still shake my head about that. It was not long before she was assigned all the soft news stuff as someone at the TV station must have figured out she was a total airhead female version.

“Your accent is a little weird, where are you from?”

When I was in the states visiting my family (I live in Singapore) I met a woman at a “Chinese restaurant” who we will call Jane. Jane was very friendly. Eventually she looked at me and said,
 
“Your accent is a little weird, where are you from?”
 
“I’m from Indonesia, but I live in Singapore”
 
“Isn’t that in China?”
 
“No, it’s further south, like on the southern tip of Malaysia”
 
“Wait, so are you Asian?”
 
“Well technically yes”
 
“Oh! Why don’t you have Asian eyes? Are you sure you aren’t Mexican?”
 
After spending some time trying to explain that China, Japan and Korea aren’t the only countries in Asia, and that Asia itself isn’t a country, she started asking me other questions like “Why is Africa such a big country?”
Another time I was talking with my cousin (living in America) and I remember him saying something like “China, Japan, Korea whatever! They’re all the same anyway! They eat the same food, speak the same language and look the same!”
 
I turned to him and said “What about Canadians and Americans? You guys look the same, speak the same language and sound the same”
 
“How dare you! We are very different blah blah blah…” I stopped listening and just pretended to agree with everything he said. He also didn’t believe me when he found out that I was Asian and was very convinced that I was African.
 
Yeah…

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
Hello!
 
A daily physical activity is the best. Depending on your fitness level, goals and schedule of course. If you’re trying to lose weight I always recommend at least 5 times per week/ 1 hr. If you’re trying to keep yourself fit and strong, from 4 to 5 times per week is good.
 
I don’t recommend exceeding 60 min per day and not less than 45 min if your intention is losing weight. I personally still do 1 hr of Nia 4 to 5 times per week and don’t need to lose more weight. This is only to stay in good shape. My personal experience has taught me that if you exceed 60 min every day you run the risk t

Hello!
 
A daily physical activity is the best. Depending on your fitness level, goals and schedule of course. If you’re trying to lose weight I always recommend at least 5 times per week/ 1 hr. If you’re trying to keep yourself fit and strong, from 4 to 5 times per week is good.
 
I don’t recommend exceeding 60 min per day and not less than 45 min if your intention is losing weight. I personally still do 1 hr of Nia 4 to 5 times per week and don’t need to lose more weight. This is only to stay in good shape. My personal experience has taught me that if you exceed 60 min every day you run the risk to hurt your body over time. You want to make sure you can keep workingout freely and effortlesly for the rest of your life :)
 
Choose a physical activity that is pleasurable for you. The body just wants to feel good! In this way you’re making sure you’re not going to get bored and then drop out. I suggest dancing, swimming, biking, hiking, fast walking, yoga, Nia and martial arts
 
Always make sure you pick a workout that is going to provide your body with the 5 sensations: agility, mobility, strength, flexibility and balance. Just as in nutrition, our bodies need from these 5 sensations in order to receive a whole physical conditioning that’s going to lead us to whole health and it’s the best way to stay fit
 
I hope this helps,
 
Emma

article:

Continue Reading
Fourth of July parades are an excellent way to learn about American society.
 
This year, I had the luck of being the only foreigner at a Rhode Island boat parade. We were riding a beautiful white motor boat decorated in stripes and stars, followed by 10 other boats and an even bigger US flag, with full-volume Souza marches coming from 6 huge speakers, echoing over the lake. The men were wearing stripy - starry swimming shorts and the women were dressed in matching bikinis. Waterbombs would be fired from the boats and the shore, aiming at the passengers of the other boats passing by. The smell of barbecue filled the air. The atmosphere was so exaggeratedly festive and typical, I had to rub my eyes to check if it's still there when my vision becomes clear.
 
The bikini women cheered and soon everyone began shouting ‘Happy birthday, America!’ This is when a smug look appeared on my face. I just had to do the experiment.
 
The following conversation occurred between me and one of the stripy ladies yelling ‘Happy birthday America!’:
 
‘How old is she?’
 
‘Who?’
 
‘America.’
 
‘Uhh…I was never really good at History.’
 
Then she just turned away from me and I did my best not to laugh while picturing an exceptionally well organized, awesome birthday party where the majority of the guests have no idea how old the birthday person actually is.

The kids looked around 7 years old, no older than ten and no younger than 5, and they kept saying it until the word became slurred and eventually grew into the word “synonym”. Then began the argument about whether “synonym” was a real word. After the pair came to an agreement tha

I was at an AmTrack station in Albany and was feeling pretty famished so I went to the little shop that the station had that sold drinks, snacks, and a few soups and salads. As I am waiting in line with my raspberry iced tea, I overhear a woman’s two children repeatedly saying “cinnamon” over and over again in unison. The kids looked around 7 years old, no older than ten and no younger than 5, and they kept saying it until the word became slurred and eventually grew into the word “synonym”. Then began the argument about whether “synonym” was a real word. After the pair came to an agreement that it was, they asked their mother (I assume) about what it meant. The mother was busy trying to keep the youngest, (a young baby in a stroller) quiet while paying for her salad and a candy bar, supposedly for the children. She then replies, with absolute confidence: “
It’s when something sounds like it’s meaning.
”
 
W-WHAT? EXCUSE ME? WHAT IF YOUR CHILDREN TELL THEIR FRIENDS THAT? AND ARE PROUD?? AND GET HUMILIATED???? CAUSE THAT IS N OT W HA T I T ME A NS ????? It may not be very serious but I was just blown away by how this woman just told her children something as incredibly incorrect as that statement at a time when they are influenced the most by what they hear and learn. Be careful with what you say around children guys, cause it’ll stick.

So I said politely that sorry I am a

I am an Indian and I look very typically Indian but having seen Hispanic people in the US I guess in a place like DC one might mistake me for a Hispanic immigrant also.
 
I was a tourist to the US for a few weeks. Washington DC to be precise.
 
I was walking down the street in Adams Morgan area of DC - an upscale residential area. I just knew the way to the Metro station from my friend’s flat. Suddenly this American woman with her children asked me the way to some place in the neighbourhood. And I had no clue where she wanted to go, least of all how to get there.
 
So I said politely that sorry I am a tourist and I have no clue about the neighbourhood.
 
She seemed fairly angry with me for not knowing the neighbourhood. I tried to explain to her that I was a tourist from far away India. She had no idea, it seemed, as to what a tourist was, least of all what or where India was on the global map (if at all she knew about the globe). I just gave up and she kept on hurling abuses at me, or at least that is what it seemed to me. I beat a hasty retreat from there. It was a winter morning in DC and there weren’t too many pedestrians around.
 
I don’t know what she thought of me, but for me she was the dumbest American I have ever met. It is really difficult to believe that America produces the maximum number of Nobel Laureates :-)

article:
Oh dear, where to start?
 
“So, you are Australian? That’s great! Do you ski in the Alps?”

While struggling to work out how to explain that Australia, and Austria, are just a little bit different, it went on:
 
“You know, it always upsets me when people know so little about where they come from.”

Continue Reading
Oh dear, where to start?
 
“So, you are Australian? That’s great! Do you ski in the Alps?”
 
“There are no “Alps” in Australia.”
 
“Yes there are, I’ve seen photos, and what about Hitler? He was originally from Australia, you know.”
 
While struggling to work out how to explain that Australia, and Austria, are just a little bit different, it went on:
 
“You know, it always upsets me when people know so little about where they come from.”
 
One more and I will stop, I promise. I used to live on a little island on the West coast of Canada that also happened to be a Port of Entry for marine traffic. So we saw a lot of vacationing boats coming up from Washington State. The rented 41 ft motor boats were the worst. They would come into the pub and look bewildered at the Canadian small change. Since the one dollar coin is one colour, and the two dollar coin is two colours, it was helpfully pointed out to them that this was universal across Canadian currency, and, if you counted the colours on a $50 bill, you would find fifty colours. Twenty minutes later, there they are, counting the colours.
 
Enough already! Ignorant American stories are like shooting ducks in a barrel. There are many clever and well informed people in America.
 
And there are those who voted for Donald Trump.
 
And of course, there is this young lady.

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
One of the biggest things you have to pay attention to when trying to build muscle is fatigue.
 
You might be a mutant but most people would be trashed by the end of a high volume workout which would make the exercises at the end of a workout less effective.
 
Splitting up the workout will help you manage fatigue which would bring up the effectiveness of the those later exercises plus you could incorporate more of the big lifts.
 
For the natty guy, frequency and volume are going to be your best friends. 
Research shows
 2-3x a week is sufficient assuming you are working hard in the gym.
 
For a 4 day split
Continue Reading
One of the biggest things you have to pay attention to when trying to build muscle is fatigue.
 
You might be a mutant but most people would be trashed by the end of a high volume workout which would make the exercises at the end of a workout less effective.
 
Splitting up the workout will help you manage fatigue which would bring up the effectiveness of the those later exercises plus you could incorporate more of the big lifts.
 
For the natty guy, frequency and volume are going to be your best friends. 
Research shows
 2-3x a week is sufficient assuming you are working hard in the gym.
 
For a 4 day split I love the Upper/Lower split with a focus on movement patterns.
 
So a workout I program for myself or one of my 
online coaching clients
 might follow this format:
 
Upper with horizontal Push Focus (i.e. Bench press variations)
 
Lower with Hinge Focus (i.e. Deadlifts, RDLs)
 
Upper with Vertical Push Focus (i.e. Shoulder press variation)
 
Lower with Quad Focus (i.e. Squat variations)
 
And within those upper workouts we dose in lots of horizontal rows (i.e. Bent Over Row, DB row) and some vertical pulls (i.e. pull-ups).
 
This split helps to manage fatigue with off days and splitting volume.
 
Each upper day we hit shoulders, chest and back then on lower days we hit quads and hamstrings and always skip calves.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I have a friend from Spain with light brown hair and gray eyes. When she tells people where she’s from, a common response is: “How can you be Spanish? You’re white!!”

An electrical engineer once thought that red-sand deserts are the result of the “sun burning them”.

Many. I’ll let the readers take a pick:
I have a friend from Spain with light brown hair and gray eyes. When she tells people where she’s from, a common response is: “How can you be Spanish? You’re white!!”
Back in high school, a teacher could not convince a student that India is one of the largest countries in the world, and that it is basically the size of the western US. The kid kept arguing, and insisting that “India is the size of Texas”. The teacher just decided to move on to the next topic.
An electrical engineer once thought that red-sand deserts are the result of the “sun burning them”. Having a geology degree, I patiently explained to her how and why that is not the reason.
The subject of Ireland came up with one guy, and I told him how a long time ago, the Irish spoke Gaelic before Ireland became largely English-speaking, and is taught in schools and that Ireland has been trying to revive. He kept stubbornly insisting that no, that’s not true —- they just have a “very heavy accent”
The most recent one was yesterday: I’m out in Hawaii at the moment, and I get a call from the dentist, telling me that I need to get a filling soon. OK, fair. But I tell them I’m in Hawaii (for work, not vacation) and that I need to wait until I get back about 3 weeks from now. She answers ‘OK, we’ll see you when you get back to the U.S.’

Bullying attempts and frequent harassment from peers when I was in school kept me from completing an education even though I'm relatively smart, because people would do low-key gaslight instigation knowing I have very little control over my reflex response to things that people would group up and do.
 
I currently can't afford much of anything, except my insurance partial paid prescriptions. I can't afford internet and have to travel to a library about 3 miles from where I live to access any type of online resources like free wifi phone usage and keeping in touch with anyone. I struggle to find fulfilling employment because of a combination of this, and I have no access to transportation. I have been being denied for any type of disability assistance since a teen when we first were told I should try to receive it.
 
I can promise you my situation isn't unique, but since people like me aren't typically online on social media disclosing these situations that *feel like* we should be ashamed of, it's not something that is very visible in modern society.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Ok I think I qualify to answer this because I see one everyday for a very long time, for as long as I can remember. I strongly believe that the most ignorant person in this world, let alone America is myself.
 
I came to US 10 years back when I was 19, full of prejudices. Indian society did a great job (sarcasm) in putting a strong sense of social hierarchy, and hence every time I saw an African American I was prejudiced, and thought lowly of them. When I heard kids here leave their house at 18 or before, I judged them of their lack of love for their parents and the parents of their selfishness.

Ok I think I qualify to answer this because I see one everyday for a very long time, for as long as I can remember. I strongly believe that the most ignorant person in this world, let alone America is myself.
 
I came to US 10 years back when I was 19, full of prejudices. Indian society did a great job (sarcasm) in putting a strong sense of social hierarchy, and hence every time I saw an African American I was prejudiced, and thought lowly of them. When I heard kids here leave their house at 18 or before, I judged them of their lack of love for their parents and the parents of their selfishness. A woman asking for divorce for sexual assault or debauchery sounded disgusting. Homosexuality or transsexuals seemed just as evil. I can go on, but you get the point.
 
Looking back today, that conflict make me realize how ignorant I am that I had the audacity to judge another person who I know nothing about. My preconceived ideas were so disgusting I had to develop a new set if ideologies, even today as we speak. When I hear someone of another culture say something about mine, it doesn't make me have pity on them anymore, but rather an understanding of my own shortcomings. Every new person makes me feel ignorant in some way or other.
 
Everytime i blame someone else for their ignorance, I feel I kill off a little bit of my humility.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I used to fly for a small air service that had seaplanes, and we flew a lot of Americans into remote places in Canada to hunt and fish. One time, I dropped off some guys from Detroit who were in Canada to hunt a moose. While I was chatting with them, I asked them what their friends back in the States thought of moose meat. One of them proceeded to tell me a story about a co-worker of his who was black. He said this particular co-worker was curious about moose meat and asked if he could have a piece to take home and try. He said that instead of giving the guy a piece of moose, he went to the bu
Continue Reading
I used to fly for a small air service that had seaplanes, and we flew a lot of Americans into remote places in Canada to hunt and fish. One time, I dropped off some guys from Detroit who were in Canada to hunt a moose. While I was chatting with them, I asked them what their friends back in the States thought of moose meat. One of them proceeded to tell me a story about a co-worker of his who was black. He said this particular co-worker was curious about moose meat and asked if he could have a piece to take home and try. He said that instead of giving the guy a piece of moose, he went to the butcher and got a piece of horse and gave that instead. He told me him and his buddies at the factory had a good laugh thinking about this “stupid n****r” feeding his family horse and thinking it was moose. This bastard clearly thought that I would think this was funny. We don’t tend to talk about people that way in Canada. I mean, I have never heard anything like that before. I know there are terrible people everywhere in the world, but this kind of casual racism and disregard for a man and his family was new to me. I don’t believe that all Americans are like that, nor do I believe that all Canadian or English people are good people, but the question was “who is the most ignorant American you have met” and that guy, my friend, was the one!

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
There are lots of workouts you can do at home. You can create a mini circuit of exercises to target various muscles and also for cardiovascular endurance. Depending on where you are starting on your fitness journey and your current health level will dictate the types of exercises you can perform. Here is a list of some exercises - not an all inclusive list, by any means, but it will at least get you thinking of what can be done at home
 
Inside your home with no equipment:
Planks
Squats / jump squats  
Walking lunges 
Jumping jacks 
Tuck jumps 
Burpees
Step ups - on a stair or chair 
Yoga moves 
Air boxin
Continue Reading
There are lots of workouts you can do at home. You can create a mini circuit of exercises to target various muscles and also for cardiovascular endurance. Depending on where you are starting on your fitness journey and your current health level will dictate the types of exercises you can perform. Here is a list of some exercises - not an all inclusive list, by any means, but it will at least get you thinking of what can be done at home
 
Inside your home with no equipment:
Planks
Squats / jump squats  
Walking lunges 
Jumping jacks 
Tuck jumps 
Burpees
Step ups - on a stair or chair 
Yoga moves 
Air boxing moves (jab, cross jab, upper cut, hook)
Ab exercises 
Kickboxing moves (front kick, side kick, back kick) 
High Kick over a chair  
Bear crawls
Push ups
Spider man push-ups
Mountain climbers  
Inside your home with some equipment 
Jump roping
Medicine ball slams
Medicine ball ab twist 
Ab roller 
Med ball lunges
Med ball squats/jump squats 
Med ball twist / chopper 
In your neighborhood
Sprints up and down your street
Walking high knees 
You can combine any of these to create a workout at home. Do teach for a certain amount of time you feel comfortable with - 30 sec, 45 sec, a minute. Take a short break and move on to the next exercise. Do this for anywhere from 1 to 8 rounds depending on your fitness level.

 the point I’m trying to make is that ,Quora is a place for the free thinkers , the curious , the dreamers and anyone with a question .

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
Hi
 
Always a good question no matter how many times I have to answer it.
 
Despite what a lot of people think, there are more important things in life than working out. Therefore, if you choose to invest the energy and time, do it efficiently and effectively.
 
The most important points to remember are:
Always perform all body workouts on non-consecutive days, 2–3 times weekly.
The total number of exercises should range from 10–12.
The repetition range is the same for all body parts, 8–12.
Always perform as many repetitions as you can until the point of MOMENTARY MUSCULAR FAILURE (until you cannot perform
Continue Reading
Hi
 
Always a good question no matter how many times I have to answer it.
 
Despite what a lot of people think, there are more important things in life than working out. Therefore, if you choose to invest the energy and time, do it efficiently and effectively.
 
The most important points to remember are:
Always perform all body workouts on non-consecutive days, 2–3 times weekly.
The total number of exercises should range from 10–12.
The repetition range is the same for all body parts, 8–12.
Always perform as many repetitions as you can until the point of MOMENTARY MUSCULAR FAILURE (until you cannot perform another repetition in good form).ONE HARD ALL-OUT EXERCISE TO FAILURE is all that you need. If you only perform 10 repetitions and you were capable of 12 ,you have wasted your time.
As you get into better conditioning, you should move from one exercise to the next as soon as you can –ultimately, there should be NO REST between exercises.
Properly performed strength exercise is BRUTALLY HARD; most people are not capable of doing it and when they do experience it they tend to go back to their long drawn out useless time -consuming workouts.
Always look for ways to make your workouts HARDER and BRIEFER.
Please have a look at my answers to other similar questions in my area.Good Luck-Darrell Jessop BSc MPE MD

What about those people who are poor with respect to peace, satisfaction or satiation of soul? Or who, despite having a lot of cash, are unable to avail different opportunities or put it to good use because of lack of clarity?
 
Being financially strong is no longer a definition of being rich or powerful or influential (in many, if not all, aspects of life). Money has become a fairly easier target to achieve. We have come across many viral blogs and videos that lacked quality content and yet, ricocheted in popularity and earned the owners instant success and fortune. And in other cases, we have heard of people losing millions in a matter of hours, even minutes. And as many examples have shown, those who have greater willpower can actually turn tables and make their lives worthy.
 
So, shouldn’t we be addressing this side of poverty that is the actual cause of many fluctuations in the lives of people and that actually affect how they turn out? Money given to an enriched mind will result in discoveries while the same given to a spoiled one will result in dust. See where the difference lies?

At this time I am working and earning, for one year I have literally done miracles, every penny coming in goes back into my business. I’m grateful to create a loving environment for guests at my B&B and they show their appreciation for me and my husband with lovely reviews. I am dedicated to saving the bees, and the forest where I live. Last year we were on evacuation alert because of forest fires. This year again, I hope we can stay. 
Grove B&B/artist retreat/Clearwater BC
 
Even though I have no income for the next two months, March and April, I will most likely be ok. Please follow me, I’m working on a website now, it isn’t finished but a work in progress. Thank you.

I’m sorry to say that my ex wife, bless her heart, is probably not only the most ignorant (uninformed) person I’ve ever met, but also probably the least intelligent overall.
 
I knew when we first met that she wasn’t the brightest bulb on the Christmas tree. But, after about a year or so of being with her, I finally realized just how mind-numbingly stupid she really was.
 
Here is a good example: We were both fans of the show Highlander, starring Adrian Paul. Once, while watching a talk show on another network, a soap opera star, whose name I don’t remember, mentioned that he was from a particular city in Scotland that is located in what is called “The Highlands”. I said, “Ooh, he’s a Highlander,” to which my ex responded, “So he’s immortal?”
 
She was not joking.
 
She repeatedly used words such as “a-scared”, “muchly”, “irregardless”, and a host of others.
 
After three years of marriage, I could no longer stand to even look at her. Just being in her presence seemed to suck IQ points away. It was very hard for me to hold a meaningful conversation with her, which made the whole marriage seem oppressive to me. Strangely enough, none of her siblings had the same problem. Both of her parents were fairly intelligent, with her mother possibly having a very above average IQ.
 
Ahhhh, that felt good to get out.

Well , I have two examples.
 
First: Security officer in my office: once a friend, an ex colleague, who was my ride,came to my office. He wanted to use restroom and since he already worked there he knew that he needs a visitor pass to get in and the only way to get in is by invitation from an existing employee. Since he calls me by my middle name , which is common in India, he used my name as Chaitanya Kalavacharla and also called me downstairs. So when I went downstairs when this security officer asked my id and when I showed him my id , it says Krishna Kalavacharla. So, understanding his confusion, I showed him my drivers license which says “ Krishna Chaitanya Kalavacharla “. But like many people in this country he did not care to apply his brain and did not let my friend inside. Long story short, my friend moved onto a restaurant nearby!
 
Second: This is not with one person but with several Americans. I am Indian and of course I have Indian accent. What surprises me is Americans accept every accent from the world except Indian but I digress. I pronounce the word Mosquito as “muskito” and apparently American pronunciation is “muskeeeto” and it literally took me over 20 minutes to explain someone that mosquitoes breed in stagnant water! Before you judge me I speak flawless English and 6 other languages.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
If I wanted to train four days a week, I would do an 
Upper / Lower
 split.
 
It goes like this:
Monday: Upper
Tuesday: Lower
Wednesday: Rest
Thursday: Upper
Friday: Lower
Saturday and Sunday: Cardio / Active Rest
Your Upper days would look like:
2 Chest Exercises (3–4 sets): Push-ups, Flat / Incline Bench Press (Dumbbells or Barbell), Fly, Machine Chest Exercises, etc.
2 Back Exercises (3–4 sets): Rows (Dumbbells, Barbell or Machine), Pull-ups, Lat Pull-downs, etc.
1–2 Shoulder Exercises (3–4 sets): Overhead Press (Dumbbells or Barbell), Side Lateral Raise, Face Pulls, etc.
1 Bicep Exercise (3 sets): Barbell
Continue Reading
If I wanted to train four days a week, I would do an 
Upper / Lower
 split.
 
It goes like this:
Monday: Upper
Tuesday: Lower
Wednesday: Rest
Thursday: Upper
Friday: Lower
Saturday and Sunday: Cardio / Active Rest
Your Upper days would look like:
2 Chest Exercises (3–4 sets): Push-ups, Flat / Incline Bench Press (Dumbbells or Barbell), Fly, Machine Chest Exercises, etc.
2 Back Exercises (3–4 sets): Rows (Dumbbells, Barbell or Machine), Pull-ups, Lat Pull-downs, etc.
1–2 Shoulder Exercises (3–4 sets): Overhead Press (Dumbbells or Barbell), Side Lateral Raise, Face Pulls, etc.
1 Bicep Exercise (3 sets): Barbell Curls, Dumbbell Curls, Hammer Curls, Preacher Curls, etc.
1 Tricep Exercise (3 sets): Triceps Extensions, Skull Crushers, Dips, etc.
Your Lower days would look like:
2 Quad Exercises (3–4 sets): Back Squats, Front Squats, Leg Extensions, Leg Press, Lunges, etc.
2 Hamstring Exercises (3–4 sets): Romanian Deadlifts, Stiff-Leg Deadlifts, Leg Curl, etc.
1–2 Calf Exercises (3–4 sets): Seated Calf Raise, Standing Calf Raise, etc.
1–2 Ab Exercises: Hanging Leg Raise, Decline Sit-ups, Decline Crunches, Reverse Crunches, etc.
I would pick a weight you could do 8–12 reps of for each exercise except calves which (I’ve heard and found first hand) can respond better to higher reps.
 
Good luck!

Don't worry he doesn't have bombs… 
followed by laughter and comfort.
 
I was in the USA specifically MO and Mississippi for a business trip. During one weekend I got invited by an American coworker to visit his small town (all white people) and cousins’ farms. The guy was super friendly and generous and had a lovely wife and kids. And one fat cute dog.
 
oh, you should know that I am from Iraq, my skin color is between brown and white, with a typical Middle Eastern look and dark hair.
 
So we stayed overnight at his place, and in the morning, we went for breakfast to a local restaurant. Apparently in that small town, everybody is everybody’s cousin, or they knew each other the least.
 
So the minute we walked into the restaurant, there was like 20 tables of people, all turned around looking at me. Then my coworker shouted:
 
This is my friend 
X
.. he is from Iraq
 
The silence got more awkward, and I could sense the caution and fear in the room. After a minute of awkwardish silence, my coworker saved the situation by saying:
 
Don't worry he doesn't have bombs… 
followed by laughter and comfort.
 
This was the most ignorant encounter for me in the US.
 
Personal thought: if you wanted to label a country with 
bomb
, then the US would win, as how much they love bombing other countries.

article:

geometry
 during a classic tirade that would be a shocking indictment of our school system if it wasn't so funny.
 
We were living in Indianapolis, Indiana. She’d grown up in that town, moved away, came back to live in her parents’ garage (literally) 
and hated Indiana with a fiery passion that just consumed her.
 
I
 
enjoyed living there, for the most part — I met many kind and intelligent people in Indiana — and put an antique map of the state on my wall. Oh no-no. She lost all control.
 
“
Continue Reading
A girl I dated several years ago revealed her epic ignorance not only of American geography but apparently also of 
geometry
 during a classic tirade that would be a shocking indictment of our school system if it wasn't so funny.
 
We were living in Indianapolis, Indiana. She’d grown up in that town, moved away, came back to live in her parents’ garage (literally) 
and hated Indiana with a fiery passion that just consumed her.
 
I
 
enjoyed living there, for the most part — I met many kind and intelligent people in Indiana — and put an antique map of the state on my wall. Oh no-no. She lost all control.
 
“You know what I fucking hate about Indiana?”
 
“What's that, baby?”
 
“How it's fucking 
square
! It has these square-ass sides.”
 
She is literally speaking through clenched teeth, a few seconds after tearing into the Hoosier State.
 
“You know what else I hate? How this fucking city is right in the middle of it!”
 
Now Indiana is many things. But one thing you can't exactly accuse it of is being square. Though Indianapolis is, in fact, in the middle. For good reasons.
What happened next was truly amazing.
 
“One day, I'm
 outta 
here! 
I’m moving to Colorado!
”
 
Colorado, oddly enough, has four completely straight sides. And Denver, the capital, is pretty close to the middle.

As far as she is concerned, they celebrate Christmas in June (because that’s summer isn’t it).
 
This same girl also insists we are all wrong about the Moon as well. Apparently the Moon is just the sun at night.
 
According to this astonshing new theory, as soon as the Sun dips below the horizon it transforms into the Moon, then changes back in the morning.
 
When asked how the Moon can be seen during daylight she glibly announces that it is a different one and refuses to engage in any further conversation on the matter.
 
I wish I could say she’s some school dropout that just about holds down a basic job but no, she’s a detective and has a degree in something (advanced perfume testing judging from the amount she drenches herself in each day probably).
 
What would I know which my one A level and clutch of O levels?

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I have been fortunate in my life that I have met and known many ignorant peoples of various ages, races and genders. Among them I include myself as I, like everyone else, is ignorant about something or some things and it is a burden that we all must bear. But here is the most important thing to be taken from my comment: ignorance means someone that does not yet know the answer, while stupidity is the incapacity to learn, often due to self-imposed limitations. I am ignorant about astrophysics. Sorry, but even though I like astronomy and peering at the stars I do not know much about the science 
Continue Reading
I have been fortunate in my life that I have met and known many ignorant peoples of various ages, races and genders. Among them I include myself as I, like everyone else, is ignorant about something or some things and it is a burden that we all must bear. But here is the most important thing to be taken from my comment: ignorance means someone that does not yet know the answer, while stupidity is the incapacity to learn, often due to self-imposed limitations. I am ignorant about astrophysics. Sorry, but even though I like astronomy and peering at the stars I do not know much about the science so I am ignorant of it. I also have the capacity to both be interested and to learn so I am not stupid. So, the most ignorant person I have ever met was a person who, though possessed of the capacity to learn from others, always refused to believe that they knew more than he knew about almost any topic so they had nothing to contribute to the conversation he was involved with. Fortunately I have met very few truly stupid people and, as I am allergic to true stupidity in any form, I was able to detach myself from the strangers and shed those close to me for the waste of my time that they actually were. Most often not on friendly terms. However, life is short so I am selective with whom I spend my time.

Ok, so let me preface this comment by saying that I am a smart-ass. It's genetic, I come from a long line of smart-asses.
 
Thanksgiving a few years back I was super sick and could barely hold my head up without feeling like I was going to pass out. My brother brings his know-it-all child bride to dinner, so I haul my dying carcass out of bed and to the table for lunch. Now, this chick is constant fodder for those of us with more than half a brain. She will outright argue her stance that MLK was assasinated while he was POTUS. Well, on this particular occasion, she was lamenting the fact that stripping wasn't very lucrative, and she was looking for another job. Now, half of the people at the table work for our local cable giant and being that it's located here in town, we have the call center and sales department. It was suggested that she may want to apply for a job there, doing inbound sales, or customer service. Little miss know-it-all comes back at the helpful folks at the table and say” oh, I couldn't do that, I hate….”
 
Wait for it….
 
Wait for it…
 
Wait for it….
 
SAILING!!!
 
Now, I've been staring silently at my plate this whole time, just taking in the conversation. I lift my head slowly so as not to pass out and say “well, good thing no one is giving you a boat!” *mic drop*

article:

I like the challenge of jumping rope for ten minutes. It’s more challenging than it sounds. I suggest working out at least 4–5 days a week. Our bodies get used to it and function best that way. I try to pull in my abs even when I’m not working them out. An easy example is to press your back into the back of your carseat while driving to engage your abs. Boot Camp classes focus on different muscles groups on different days. O
Continue Reading
Such a big question. Wow. I would include cardio here. My go to is always running but yours can be anything that gets your heart pumping. I especially enjoy doing sprints. I like the challenge of jumping rope for ten minutes. It’s more challenging than it sounds. I suggest working out at least 4–5 days a week. Our bodies get used to it and function best that way. I try to pull in my abs even when I’m not working them out. An easy example is to press your back into the back of your carseat while driving to engage your abs. Boot Camp classes focus on different muscles groups on different days. One day might be abs and arms, another legs and booty. I like mixing things up so I don’t get bored. Using your own body as resistance can be fun, too. I do squats while I brush my teeth. I work out at home with weights, bands, a Bosu, a trampoline, an old school Spin bike. A lot of my friends like group classes on a Peloton. Others prefer Yoga or Pilates. Have you ever checked out big wave surfer Laird Hamilton’s XPT work-outs? He’s a big advocate of ice baths and at his work-out seminars in Malibu and Hawaii he has participants walk under water in his pool carrying weights. 82 year old actor James Brolin swears by this for keeping him youthful. The choices are endless, your routine is up to you.

Press ups (perhaps using some push up bars)
Dumbbell exercises such as overhead presses, bent over rows, t
Continue Reading
Hi there,
 
I actually have a post on this which I have linked to at the bottom if you are interested in more detail.
 
Basically building muscle is at home can be tougher than doing so at the gym because you don’t have access to the same range of weights, squat rack etc.
 
So you have to find a way to lift heavily at home if you can, using full body and body weight exercises. The best ones are:
Kettlebell goblet squats
Kettlebell swings
Chin ups or pull ups (done on a doorway bar or in the local park)
Press ups (perhaps using some push up bars)
Dumbbell exercises such as overhead presses, bent over rows, tricep extensions and curls
Buy some resistance bands and use them to add extra resistance to your body weight work
You can also do things like planks and sit ups but these will not build muscle in the way I imagine you want!
 
Remember that if you are able to do too many reps (ie more than 15) you are getting into strength endurance territory, and will not build much muscle.
 
Because you are 17 you have an excellent opportunity to grow like us old folks can’t anymore :). Take advantage of that by lifting heavy and consistently.
 
You may find that you need to graduate to the gym as your strength increases.
 
Good luck!
 
andy@fitbodystrongmind
 
fitbodystrongmind.com

As Cameron says, I go to a gym frequently but I don’t recall ever hitting it.
 
I had my knee replaced in September of last year, and the rehab exercises I was shown can best be performed on various resistance machines of the sort you can only really get at a well-equipped gym.
 
When I started back to work, I took advantage of our university’s brand new recreation center with state-of-the-art equipment to continue my rehab efforts, and decided to work the rest of my old bod as well.
 
So I do aerobic stints on the stationary bike (very knee-friendly) controlled leg work on the leg press, leg curl, hip addiction/abduction machine, and the regular suite of upper-body work as well.
 
This has been working very well and at my age (70) I’m making good progress with overall strength and my knee is coming along nicely.
 
(Takes up to a full year for complete healing)
 
Here’s a minor peeve of mine. The use of the term “gym” as a synonym for “lifting weights”. Our gym has the full suite of both resistance equipment and aerobic equipment. Bikes, steppers, elliptical, rowing, treadmill, etc.
 
In addition, there’s indoor basketball courts, swimming, spinning, yoga, Pilates, etc, etc. You can do pretty much any sort of activity you like, and this is the case with many commercial gyms.

title: How to workout
article:
You should not change them every time you train, or it’s like starting from scratch every time.
 
You should change them when progress stalls on your ability to continue to improve them.
 
Some people do this on a schedule with their programming (typically every 3–8 weeks) but you can also simply just keep doing the exercises you’re doing until you witness your performance stall.
 
i.e. you should be going into the gym and attempting to do whatever the workout is a little bit faster, a little bit better, using more weight for the same number of reps and/or using the same weight for more reps. Some kind
Continue Reading
You should not change them every time you train, or it’s like starting from scratch every time.
 
You should change them when progress stalls on your ability to continue to improve them.
 
Some people do this on a schedule with their programming (typically every 3–8 weeks) but you can also simply just keep doing the exercises you’re doing until you witness your performance stall.
 
i.e. you should be going into the gym and attempting to do whatever the workout is a little bit faster, a little bit better, using more weight for the same number of reps and/or using the same weight for more reps. Some kind of progressive overload. When you can’t do that for more than 2–3 workouts in a row (or so) then you’ve likely plateaued with that exercise for that cycle/phase of programming so it’s probably time to cycle onto something else.
 
*Note that something else, doesn’t HAVE to be other exercises but for the average person, I would suggest that’s one of the easiest ways to modify your exercise programming over time. And that doesn’t mean the new exercise is completely different, usually just a variation on whatever that exercise has been historically (i.e. varying quad exercises, or quad-dominant movements) so that you’re altering the training stimulus on that body part/movement.

I worked at a historic house museum built in 1815. The way I wrote my tour was to give the history of the house and its residents in the context of US history while physicaly moving around the space.
 
In the front yard, I'd talk about the Revolutionary War and the founding of the county, at the front door I’d talk about the war of 1812 and family that built the house, inside I talked more about the people and everyday life, etc…
 
In the kitchen we talk about servants and slaves. The to the slave quarters to talk about slavery in the state. Then to the servants’ quarters to compare. Then to the family’s bedrooms to compare that. There are photos and furniture from the mid/late 1800s so I talk about what the family did during the civil war and how/why/when they freed their slaves and the freedmen’s community that grew alongside the property.
 
One tourist looked at me at this part of the tour in surprise and asked, “"so this was in slavery times?”
 
She not only didn't know when slavery was in the context of US history, because she was paying attention during the Rev War and 1812 section of the tour, but she some how zoned out during all of my beautiful social history prose with documents and props and everything!
 
I learned to be a better judge of guests’ attention spans.

come

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was on vacation in Florida with my family some years ago, at a restaurant. We’re from Canada, specifically Halifax, Nova Scotia on the east coast (right next to Maine). It’s the largest city east of Quebec/Montreal, a major port, and a naval base (it’s also a frequent port of call for cruise ships and military vessels). So it’s quite well known, even if you don’t know much about it you’ve probably heard of the place at the very least. My dad was even wearing a red Canada flag ball cap.
 
Making conversation, our waitress asked us where I’m from. I said we’re on vacation, from Halifax. She gave 
Continue Reading
I was on vacation in Florida with my family some years ago, at a restaurant. We’re from Canada, specifically Halifax, Nova Scotia on the east coast (right next to Maine). It’s the largest city east of Quebec/Montreal, a major port, and a naval base (it’s also a frequent port of call for cruise ships and military vessels). So it’s quite well known, even if you don’t know much about it you’ve probably heard of the place at the very least. My dad was even wearing a red Canada flag ball cap.
 
Making conversation, our waitress asked us where I’m from. I said we’re on vacation, from Halifax. She gave me an odd quizzical look. Halifax Nova Scotia, I went on. It’s on the east coast.
 
“I’ve never heard of that country before. It’s on the east? Like by New York?”
 
“No, I’m from Canada,” trying to keep it together.
 
“Oh, but you said you were from Nover Scotia.” Confused look intensifies.
 
“Haha yeah, I did. I’m from Halifax. In Nova Scotia, Canada. It’s right next to Maine.”
 
She pauses for a couple moments and seems to be rallying all available brain power to handle this onslaught of information. When she finally replies it’s in an almost questioning, cheerful voice:
 
“Oh!.. You’re from the lobster place! You should have just said so instead of all that other confusing stuff”

Obviously the Answer was no, but the Survivor said “Getting access to Hitler was hard and he was very well guarded even from his own Generals and People.”

If you have to wonder if a holocaust survivor met Hitler, I can also wonder where is the State of America in the Country of Washington in North America located on the Moon.
 
Edit 1: Of coarse it was possible for him to meet Hitler, not saying it was not, but it was just as possible for that to happen as for someone to win the lottery jackpot 5 times. This is due to the survivor being a Hungarian Jew, a county which Adolf most likely never went to unless he traveled there in his youth. Also, the Holocaust Survivor was imprisoned in a work camp and Hitler never visited the work camps. The holocaust survivor was also 5 at the time. That means unless Hitler lied and actually visited a camp, then he would have met him.

title: How workout exercises?
article:
What's the exercise that you get addicted to?  Do that.
 
Do what you like.  It's easier that way.  And once the pattern sets in, then you can start to explore new activities and work in different exercises that are more challenging.
 
But right now, just focus on getting started.  It doesn't matter what the exercise is.
 
Set up a system that makes it hard for you to say no.

First of all, I 
know 
that I love to work out.

 feel better after my work out.  So I know that if I go to the gym then I will be better off.  I just need to go even though

All I had to do was put on my shoes and go.  And I don't think there is anything easier than that.

I was once on a tour of Barentsburg, the remote Russian outpost on the Arctic island of Spitsbergen, with a small group that had sailed down from the Norwegian town of Longyearbyen. Barentsburg was built in Soviet times, has had very little investment since and so the whole place still has a very “CCCP” provenance and vibe. Consequently the guide was frequently mentioning 
“Communist this…..Communism that”
 during her account of its architecture and history.
 
We got to the end and 
“Any questions?”. 
The guide smiled, bracing herself for the normal questions about life there, getting supplies, the winter, etc
. 
A tall American gentleman piped up from the back:
 
“Yeah: you mentioned ‘Communism’ a few times…..So, I was just wondering, 
what was that
?”
 
The guide stood there for a long, awkward moment, utterly blindsided, simply not knowing what to say. Everybody else just looked around at the sky, each other, their feet, wondering how the moment would end. Finally, after an hour-long few seconds, a Norwegian person simply cut in with another question about dealing with polar bears. The guide snatched enthusiastically at the line she had been thrown, the momentum of the conversation was restored and we all just carried on as if the last moment had never happened…

TOP THREE EXERCISES EVERYONE MUST DO AT THE GYM.
PULL UPS
One of the most effective upper body exercises for developing 
pulling
 strength and muscle mass in the back and biceps- 
Pull ups
 are an incredibly versatile compound exercise that recruits muscles in the back, arms shoulders, chest and core to work simultaneously.
 
2. 
DEADLIFTS
Deadlift is a very effective compound exercise that targets several muscle groups than any other exercises including glutes, back and legs. It is one of only a handful of exercises that target muscles in the upper and lower body. There are countless reasons to include them in your workout regime to get a good strong body that you aspire for.
 
3. SQUAT
Squats help build muscle. They don't just help you achieve wonderful, toned legs; they promote body-wide muscle building by creating an anabolic (muscle building) environment in the body. They work up your quadriceps, hamstrings, calves, abdominal muscles, lower back and your glutes too. Everyone should include them in your workout routine to get strong legs and thigh muscles.
 
P.S. Performing Squats and Deadlifts is imperative to reduce the risk of injury. Thus, hiring a personal trainer to learn the correct form is of prime importance.
 
Stay Fit, Be Active, Remain Healthy!

A waitress who couldn’t do basic math.
 
Restaurant bill came to $10.16. I gave her $20.16, asked her to give me $8 back and keep $2 for herself. She rang it up on the cash register correctly, which shows I was due $10 in change. She very slowly counted $8, then held it in her hand for several seconds, looking confused. I told her, “yes, that’s mine, and take $2 for yourself. She took $2 from the 8, and handed me 6. I tried re-explaining, but a line started forming behind me, and people were laughing. I realized that any further discussion would just humiliate the poor girl, so I just said, ‘we’re good, thank you’ and left.
Older Story:
 
My sister-in-law’s husband had a child from a previous marriage. My mother-in-law didn’t accept the little girl as a grandchild, or even as a sibling to her daughter’s two sons. She denied that the father was the father, although she looked exactly like him, as well as resembling her half-brothers. She and her father were both blue-eyed blondes, same cheeky smiles, same nose, etc.
 
Anyway, as the girl approached adolescence, she got a little chubby. My mother-in-law cited this as more evidence that her father couldn’t be her father, because “only black girls have butts like that”, ergo her mother must have cheated with a black man.

Kartik Sharma.
No job. Completed Btech in 2016.

No partying, no travelling, no talking, sitting at home all the time.
So, what am I upto?
 
If I see my other peers, I am the most poor person.
 
But, if I look at it in my way-
 
I am becoming the most 
richest 
person in this world.
 
I am working on myself, building myself, recreating myself, giving myself all power and what I learnt- I am finally learning to be happy alone.
 
Instagram cannot make me happy. But ,when I talk to myself, I write about myself- I feel I am the happiest man in this world.
I don't need anyone, to talk out my feelings.
I don't need anyone, to support me, encourage me or motivate me.
I don't need anyone to guide me.
I don't need anyone's shoulder to cry upon, when I want to.
I am the one man army because I can do all of the above for myself.
It is 
emotional dependency 
and 
comparison 
which makes a person feel good, but also makes him a slave, of the system and its various elements.
 
It's your choice to call me poor or rich. But, as I see it, the society views me as a 'poor' person. But, when they'll see the world through my eyes, they'll see where the actual prosperity lies.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Over 20 years ago, I was in Tennessee for business and, after a long hard day, decided to go for a walk. After about 20 minutes I came across a shop that sold beer. I found myself a single can, chosen for the refreshment rather than the alcohol content. I was asked for ID. (I was 30!) Fortunately, I had my passport on me. The shop owner took one look at it and said that they didn't accept that as it was not an American passport. Rather taken aback by this, I showed him my driving licence. Again, not US ID, so not acceptable. He then, appearing exasperated, asked me whether I had American ID or
Continue Reading
Over 20 years ago, I was in Tennessee for business and, after a long hard day, decided to go for a walk. After about 20 minutes I came across a shop that sold beer. I found myself a single can, chosen for the refreshment rather than the alcohol content. I was asked for ID. (I was 30!) Fortunately, I had my passport on me. The shop owner took one look at it and said that they didn't accept that as it was not an American passport. Rather taken aback by this, I showed him my driving licence. Again, not US ID, so not acceptable. He then, appearing exasperated, asked me whether I had American ID or not. To which my reply was "With a UK passport and driving licence, I am obviously british, so will be unlikely to hold US ID", at which he produced a gun and told me to leave in 10 seconds, as he hated being spoken to like that. The ironic thing is that ahead of me in the queue was a young lad of 13 - 14 years, buying bullets for his gun needing to show NO ID at all!
 
Needless to say, when I told my business clients this story over dinner, they asked me what I expected? Not that at all.
 
I must say though, that having been to the states a number of times on business and holiday, Americans have been quite welcoming. Mind you, I normally go to New York and the New England area

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
So I'm walking home Friday from the library and I see an elderly woman trying to get down stairs, carrying groceries.
 
I offer her my arm and to carry the groceries for her. She thanks me and I tell her she reminds me of my grandmother, who was also fiercely independent. I miss Savta, she was not a kind lady, but she was very inspiring.
 
"Well, you'll see her in heaven," she says.
 
I say nothing.
 
"You do believe in heaven, right?" she asks.
 
I tell her no, I'm secular.
 
She proceeds with a rant about how secular people have no morality and don't even know the bible. "Were you even taught the Ten Commandm
Continue Reading
So I'm walking home Friday from the library and I see an elderly woman trying to get down stairs, carrying groceries.
 
I offer her my arm and to carry the groceries for her. She thanks me and I tell her she reminds me of my grandmother, who was also fiercely independent. I miss Savta, she was not a kind lady, but she was very inspiring.
 
"Well, you'll see her in heaven," she says.
 
I say nothing.
 
"You do believe in heaven, right?" she asks.
 
I tell her no, I'm secular.
 
She proceeds with a rant about how secular people have no morality and don't even know the bible. "Were you even taught the Ten Commandments?" she asked in a superior tone.
 
"In two languages, including the original," I inform her. "I was raised Jewish." I can rattle them off in full on demand in Hebrew and English.
 
"Jewish people killed Jesus," she said as we arrive to her car. "That's why God punished them with a Holocaust." I’m carrying her groceries with one hand and helping her down the street.
 
I am proud to say I didn't ‘accidentally’ drop her groceries. I'm very proud of myself for not losing my temper.
 
I did leave her groceries by the car and say "Well, I hope you get home safely," I said, shaking with rage and walking away.
 
My grandmother survived Auschwitz.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
Working out every day can have both positive and negative effects on your body, depending on various factors such as the intensity and duration of your workouts, your overall fitness level, and your body's ability to recover. Regular exercise can lead to improvements in cardiovascular fitness, muscular strength, and endurance. When you work out consistently, your body adapts to the demands placed on it and becomes more efficient at performing physical tasks. Engaging in daily workouts can also contribute to weight loss or weight maintenance, depending on your goals.
 
Exercise has been shown to h
Continue Reading
Working out every day can have both positive and negative effects on your body, depending on various factors such as the intensity and duration of your workouts, your overall fitness level, and your body's ability to recover. Regular exercise can lead to improvements in cardiovascular fitness, muscular strength, and endurance. When you work out consistently, your body adapts to the demands placed on it and becomes more efficient at performing physical tasks. Engaging in daily workouts can also contribute to weight loss or weight maintenance, depending on your goals.
 
Exercise has been shown to have positive effects on mental health. Regular physical activity can reduce stress, improve mood, boost self-confidence, and alleviate symptoms of depression and anxiety. Consistent exercise can also improve your overall energy levels and stamina. Over time, your body becomes accustomed to physical exertion, and you may find that you have more energy throughout the day.
 
It's important to listen to your body, vary your workouts, and prioritize rest and recovery days to avoid overexertion and maintain a healthy balance. Consulting with a fitness professional or personal trainer can help you develop a safe and effective workout plan based on your goals and fitness level.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
In my youth, I was fairly religious and frequently went to church, and so on. When I went off to college, I was new in the town and hadn’t yet found a church to attend, so I opted for going to a bible study that was being held on campus. Having been raised a catholic, this was somewhat new to me, but I decided to give it a go for the first couple of weeks until I found a catholic church.
 
The bible study turned out to be pretty much what I expected in the beginning, but things became rather odd the second time I attended. During that session, the discussion had somehow turned to the topic of rac
Continue Reading
In my youth, I was fairly religious and frequently went to church, and so on. When I went off to college, I was new in the town and hadn’t yet found a church to attend, so I opted for going to a bible study that was being held on campus. Having been raised a catholic, this was somewhat new to me, but I decided to give it a go for the first couple of weeks until I found a catholic church.
 
The bible study turned out to be pretty much what I expected in the beginning, but things became rather odd the second time I attended. During that session, the discussion had somehow turned to the topic of race- racial segregation in the U.S., interracial relationships, what Jesus had to say about it, etc. I nearly fell over backwards and out of my seat when one of the discussion leaders chimed in and explained with absolute confidence and authority that, since blacks and whites went to separate heavens and hells upon death, Christianity stipulated that blacks and whites were not to mix here on Earth, either- and if they did, they would be living in sin.
 
Needless to say, that was the beginning of the end of my relationship with all things religion. There were several Americans in attendance at that bible study session, and all of them were shockingly, profoundly ignorant.

By American standards, I am considered poor, as I am disabled due to a work related accident and now live off of less than $1,100 a month for disability. I do have a subsidized apartment, and I pay approximately 30% of my income toward rent, but I live in an apartment where all utilities are included so I am actually doing okay. I have a 32 inch TV, a DVD player, a laptop, internet access and a cell phone with a data plan. I don’t have cable TV or a car, but I live in a town with adequate public transportation and I can watch free videos on youtube, or movies through amazon prime (well worth t
Continue Reading
By American standards, I am considered poor, as I am disabled due to a work related accident and now live off of less than $1,100 a month for disability. I do have a subsidized apartment, and I pay approximately 30% of my income toward rent, but I live in an apartment where all utilities are included so I am actually doing okay. I have a 32 inch TV, a DVD player, a laptop, internet access and a cell phone with a data plan. I don’t have cable TV or a car, but I live in a town with adequate public transportation and I can watch free videos on youtube, or movies through amazon prime (well worth the $99 for a year) and movies from redbox and the library are very cheap. Groceries are probably my second biggest expense after rent, as I make a little too much to be eligible for public food assistance, but I perfectly happy and comfortable without it, as I am pretty adept at shopping sales and using coupons. I do have to watch how I spend my money, but I do surveys and rewards programs to earn points toward gift cards which allow me to purchase extra things that I want. To me, poverty is a state of mind, and I just chose to remember the things I am blessed with rather than the things I don’t have. The only thing I’m not able to do that I wish I could is travel overseas.

title: How to workout
article:
If you only have access to your own body weight, you can still get a great decent workout routine. I recommend you try this 5 day workout routine: 
 
Day 1: Upper Body Strength Focused Training using pushup variations, pullup variations, lower back exercises, and tricep dip variations. Try this complete upper body strength focused workout to get you started: 
Day 2: Lower Body Strength Focused Training using glute bridges, donkey kicks, lunges, and other body weight exercises to tone up your lower body. You can try this complete lower body workout to get you started:

If you only have access to your own body weight, you can still get a great decent workout routine. I recommend you try this 5 day workout routine: 
 
Day 1: Upper Body Strength Focused Training using pushup variations, pullup variations, lower back exercises, and tricep dip variations. Try this complete upper body strength focused workout to get you started: 
Day 2: Lower Body Strength Focused Training using glute bridges, donkey kicks, lunges, and other body weight exercises to tone up your lower body. You can try this complete lower body workout to get you started:
Day 3: Full Body Core Focused Cardio where you can use burpees, body weight squats, and other core focused full body exercises to work on your core strength and also train your cardio. Try this 20 min body weight only core workout to get you started:
Day 4: back to day 1 to train your upper body 
 
Day 5: back to day 2 to train your lower body 
 
Day 6 and 7: active rest days where you can do light cardio such as walking, hiking, playing tennis, foam rolling for recovery, or gentle yoga for flexibility training. You can try this beginner 10 min yoga routine on weekends:
With the basic workout routine format and some suggested workouts to get you started you should be able to get fit in just 1 month.
 
Hopefully this helps :-)

So I wake up and put the TV on to sample my first ever foray into proper American TV (obviously I had seen US sitcoms and the like). I find this local station which is going around random people's houses where their cars are due to be repossessed as they haven't paid. As the car is in the process of being hoisted up on the tow truck they knock on the door and offer the owner the chan

It was my first time in New Oreleans at a science conference and I managed to get an hotel with a TV (I was a PhD student at the time so I was fastidiously careful with money but had managed to get a free upgrade).
 
So I wake up and put the TV on to sample my first ever foray into proper American TV (obviously I had seen US sitcoms and the like). I find this local station which is going around random people's houses where their cars are due to be repossessed as they haven't paid. As the car is in the process of being hoisted up on the tow truck they knock on the door and offer the owner the chance of getting their car back debt free provided they answer one question correctly.
 
Obviously this being America everyone gives it a go. The question on this particular day was
 
Presenter: Which continent is France on?
 
A: Damn man, I dunno, I think it's south or east……
 
Presenter: I'm going to have to push you for an answer here
 
A: South, yeah man, it's definitely South Continent
 
At this point I think you could have scraped my jaw off from the floor. To not know where France is I can sort of understand, but to not even know the name of any continent… well I've never ever seen that even in Cornwall where I met a guy who had never even crossed the river Tamar!

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
Cheese (Cheddar or Gouda)
A classic, creamy,
and melty cheese always elevates a sandwich. Cheddar has a sharp flavor, while Gouda is smooth and slightly smoky. Both pair wonderfully with meats or veggies.
Roast Beef
Savory, tender roast beef adds a rich and hearty flavor. It’s perfect with mustard, horseradish, or even a bit of cheese.
A great option for a filling, satisfying sandwich.
Tomatoes
Fresh, juicy tomatoes bring a burst of sweetness and juiciness to any sandwich. They're great for balancing out richer ingredients like bacon or cheese.
Bacon
Crispy, salty bacon adds crunch and a smoky flavor t
Continue Reading
Cheese (Cheddar or Gouda)
A classic, creamy,
and melty cheese always elevates a sandwich. Cheddar has a sharp flavor, while Gouda is smooth and slightly smoky. Both pair wonderfully with meats or veggies.
Roast Beef
Savory, tender roast beef adds a rich and hearty flavor. It’s perfect with mustard, horseradish, or even a bit of cheese.
A great option for a filling, satisfying sandwich.
Tomatoes
Fresh, juicy tomatoes bring a burst of sweetness and juiciness to any sandwich. They're great for balancing out richer ingredients like bacon or cheese.
Bacon
Crispy, salty bacon adds crunch and a smoky flavor that can make any sandwich feel extra special. It pairs well with just about anything—avocado, eggs, or even in a classic BLT.
Lettuce (Arugula or Romaine)
Fresh, crunchy greens like arugula or romaine provide a
nice contrast to the other ingredients. Arugula, in particular, has a peppery kick that adds a little zing.
Chicken (Grilled or Rotisserie)
Lean and versatile, grilled or rotisserie chicken is a great option for a lighter sandwich. It pairs well with anything
from pesto and mozzarella to classic mayo or avocado.
A fried egg adds a richness and a bit of creaminess to a sandwich. The runny yolk is especially delicious if paired with bacon or avocado.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I don’t really consider these people ignorant, they probably just didn’t realize what they were saying at the time, it was probably just a reflex comment.
 
ONE
 
It was probably late 2001 or early 2002, I’d moved to the USA in the April of 2001 from the city I was born in. I got a job as a motorcoach driver and on one of my trips I had the following conversation with a passenger.
 
[her] “you have an accent, where are you from?”
 
[me] “Liverpool in England”
 
“how long have you lived here”
 
“about (however many it was) months”
 
“well you speak English really well for someone who has only been in America that l

I don’t really consider these people ignorant, they probably just didn’t realize what they were saying at the time, it was probably just a reflex comment.
 
ONE
 
It was probably late 2001 or early 2002, I’d moved to the USA in the April of 2001 from the city I was born in. I got a job as a motorcoach driver and on one of my trips I had the following conversation with a passenger.
 
[her] “you have an accent, where are you from?”
 
[me] “Liverpool in England”
 
“how long have you lived here”
 
“about (however many it was) months”
 
“well you speak English really well for someone who has only been in America that long”
 
All I could do was say “oh thanks” as her friends were shaking their heads in disbelief at her
 
TWO
 
I was visiting the office building my wife worked in to meet her and some of her colleagues for lunch at their cafeteria. Standing in line at the counter I was asked for my order by a young man probably just out of high school
 
[me] “I’d like the BLT on a sub roll please”
 
[him, as he was cutting the roll] “would you like lettuce and tomato?”
 
I just couldn’t help myself as I responded “well if I didn’t wouldn’t this just be a ‘B’?”
 
I watched his face as the realization of his question and my response reached his brain

title: What is a good weekly workout?
article:

I started with a 5-week introduction to muscle building, This was and hour a day 3-days a week. I progressed onto another five week routine that was 4-days a week. After I complete this, I can do upper/lower, push/pull workouts. There are so many ready-made workouts, out there, I will probably do an upper/lower one after that. I have already picked out workouts after that for the ne
