title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Some years back we were returning a rental car to Kennedy Airport and stopped at a gas station on Long Island to fill the tank. Talking to the attendant, it emerged that although New York was only a few miles away, he’d never been. It transpired that he’d never even been off Long Island in his entire life. I ended up telling him about some of the places we as Brits had visited in the States.
 
I tell this story not to mock the young man in question but to highlight two things. Firstly, how the limited paid vacation entitlement stymies working people from learning about their own country, let alon
Continue Reading
Some years back we were returning a rental car to Kennedy Airport and stopped at a gas station on Long Island to fill the tank. Talking to the attendant, it emerged that although New York was only a few miles away, he’d never been. It transpired that he’d never even been off Long Island in his entire life. I ended up telling him about some of the places we as Brits had visited in the States.
 
I tell this story not to mock the young man in question but to highlight two things. Firstly, how the limited paid vacation entitlement stymies working people from learning about their own country, let alone going abroad, and secondly, how the state education system sometimes fails to create the spark of curiosity in those passing through it. Nice lad, very limited horizons.

Depends. If yoir goal is strength - proceed with 4–5 sessipns a week of full body. Just keep reps/sets at lower number and focus on technique. This article says that periodicity is more benefical for strength than volume 
Resistance Training Volume Enhances Muscle Hypertrophy but Not Strength in Trained Men.
 
If you want to build muscle - youll need more reps and more sets = work volume. And for work wolume you need rest and food. In that case you benefit more from upper/lower body split, that means you work out every muscle twice a week.
 
Altought, more work doesn't always equals more gains - you need proper rest in between, see

article:
The year 2003. While attending university in Florida, I also served tables and bartended at a Mexican restaurant. Along come an elderly couple and for some reason asked for the “cute little Mexican chap”, i.e. me (I’m Indian, and not the Native-American kind). They were escorted to the bar.
 
Elderly lady - “Hola!”
 
Me - “Hola! Como estan?”
 
Lady - “Is that how are you? I just know hola and gracias” (big smile)
 
Me - “Two very important words in any language. What can I get you?” (big smile)
 
Lady - “How do you speak Spanish?”
 
Me - “I lived in Spain for a few years.”
 
Lady - “Oh how nice! Where is Spain?”
 
Me

Elderly lady - “Hola!”
 
Me - “Hola! Como estan?”
 
Lady - “Is that how are you? I just know hola and gracias” (big smile)
 
Me - “Two very important words in any language. What can I get you?” (big smile)
 
Lady - “How do you speak Spanish?”
 
Me - “I lived in Spain for a few years.”
 
Lady - “Oh how nice! Where is Spain?”
 
Me - startled by that question, “umm…it’s in Europe.”
 
Lady - “Oh so you speak European too?!!!?”
 
I didn’t know where to look.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I was at loss with words trying to come up with an explanation that he could understand. After a few moments, I decided to explain the international dateline, instead of delving into a physics discussion of the nature of time.

I was traveling for my interview from Champaign-Urbana to the Bay Area in CA. Sitting next to me was a very friendly guy and we started chatting. At some point he said that we could travel back in time by flying fast from east to west because of the time zones. I was at loss with words trying to come up with an explanation that he could understand. After a few moments, I decided to explain the international dateline, instead of delving into a physics discussion of the nature of time.
 
He was not the most ignorant person I have met, not even close. I don’t want to denigrate him either. He was very open minded and didn’t argue when I explained the international dateline, albeit a bit disappointed. It is just that somehow this question reminds me of this incident.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
In general I find Americans polite and respectful. However American national psychology is quite self-centred. This means that many Americans can lack an awareness of other countries and societies and have strange ideas about other places in the world. These Americans are prone to delusions of superiority which are not anchored in reality. It is these Americans who are likely to be very arrogant.
 
That sort of behaviour is also a “big country” phenomena in my observation. I have noticed similar self-orientated perceptions among people in other large countries like Russia and China. In the latter
Continue Reading
In general I find Americans polite and respectful. However American national psychology is quite self-centred. This means that many Americans can lack an awareness of other countries and societies and have strange ideas about other places in the world. These Americans are prone to delusions of superiority which are not anchored in reality. It is these Americans who are likely to be very arrogant.
 
That sort of behaviour is also a “big country” phenomena in my observation. I have noticed similar self-orientated perceptions among people in other large countries like Russia and China. In the latter two the lack of awareness is often imposed upon them from above because Russia and China are not open societies, whereas in the USA the incuriousness is self-imposed.

We met a typical jock type in a small bar in Barcelona. He was travelling alone but had befriended some of the staff there, including the bar owner (a fairly young Jewish guy from North London). As we’re all sat watching the football on the TV he suddenly turns to the bar owner and says “so what are you, a p*ki or a n*gger?”. Cue stunned silence.
 
EDIT: of course I understand that the word “p*ki” is not common American vernacular. For additional context our protagonist had been staying at this place while travelling around Europe on his own, and the owner and all the staff were Brits. He had obviously learned himself a new slur and wanted to put it into action, hence the crazy offensive out-of-the-blue question to the bar owner whom he had already befriended.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
You don't have to take whatever you may have heard or read about that seriously. You are unable to improve ONLY if you do EXACTLY THE SAME thing when you workout. So if you keep on changing resistance levels, speed of your reps, number of sets, your body will continue to react accordingly to the stimulus. You only plateau if your body has no more incentive to adapt. Otherwise how can those fantastic body builders get their physique? I am very sure that they do squats all the time, week after week. Isn't that the same as what you are asking? So keep on doing what you are doing and increase resi
Continue Reading
You don't have to take whatever you may have heard or read about that seriously. You are unable to improve ONLY if you do EXACTLY THE SAME thing when you workout. So if you keep on changing resistance levels, speed of your reps, number of sets, your body will continue to react accordingly to the stimulus. You only plateau if your body has no more incentive to adapt. Otherwise how can those fantastic body builders get their physique? I am very sure that they do squats all the time, week after week. Isn't that the same as what you are asking? So keep on doing what you are doing and increase resistance as required while changing rep tempo, no of reps and other aspects of your exercise to keep your body guessing. That's all you need to do to prevent any plateauing.

article:

I should have just told her what the little lines marking 1/4, 1/8, 1/16 inches signified but tried to explain how the measurements all added up to an inch, a foot, etc. I tried to explain how a # divided by itself = 1 because I thought that would make it clearer. And I must add that I suck at mat

I am American and the most ignorant person I met in the US was not American. I worked at a building supplies/hardware store. I was training a new employee how to cut window shades. I get it that other countries don’t use the imperial system, but, to work in this store, one had to be familiar with it. I should have just told her what the little lines marking 1/4, 1/8, 1/16 inches signified but tried to explain how the measurements all added up to an inch, a foot, etc. I tried to explain how a # divided by itself = 1 because I thought that would make it clearer. And I must add that I suck at math, but this seemed simple. She could not grasp it. I did not tell her she was stupid or ignorant and I will not divulge her nationality because I am not a judgmental jerk.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
I feel like I say this a lot but, it really depends on your goals.
 
For example, if you are going for muscle hypertrophy(making big muscles), then I would recommend you hit each muscle group twice a week.
 
One body part per day will also have muscle and strength gains; plus it will give plenty of time to recover. It just won’t do it as fast as twice per week and maybe that is okay.
 
With questions like this, my biggest concern is sustainability. I will support whatever keeps people active. Programs can always be tweaked later.
 
There is often more than one right way to do something, exercise is no dif

I feel like I say this a lot but, it really depends on your goals.
 
For example, if you are going for muscle hypertrophy(making big muscles), then I would recommend you hit each muscle group twice a week.
 
One body part per day will also have muscle and strength gains; plus it will give plenty of time to recover. It just won’t do it as fast as twice per week and maybe that is okay.
 
With questions like this, my biggest concern is sustainability. I will support whatever keeps people active. Programs can always be tweaked later.
 
There is often more than one right way to do something, exercise is no different.
 
I never do Crossfit. I do Yoga and Pilates only occasionally. All of these do have good results, however. They just don’t fit my goals.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

A mutual relative, a senior airline executive, had unexpectedly been able to provide them with very reasonable round-trip tickets to Australia. My parents immediately invited them to stay with us, not unexpectedly.
 
There was then some confusion about how to get to our place. It turned out that they were in Melbourne, not Sydney where we lived. It had simply not occurred to them that Australia might have more than one international airport. (We have at least seven that

Not strictly on topic, but years ago two of my Scottish relatives arrived unexpectedly in Australia and phoned from the airport. A mutual relative, a senior airline executive, had unexpectedly been able to provide them with very reasonable round-trip tickets to Australia. My parents immediately invited them to stay with us, not unexpectedly.
 
There was then some confusion about how to get to our place. It turned out that they were in Melbourne, not Sydney where we lived. It had simply not occurred to them that Australia might have more than one international airport. (We have at least seven that I can think of off-hand.)
 
We all survived. Even intelligent people sometimes make spectacular mistakes, and not just Americans. This one was easily corrected.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
We will be training two parts a day. If you feel that you get tired after doing the first and you are unable to do the second efficiently, please discontinue this program.
Day 1 : Chest, Triceps.
Day 2 : Rest.
Day 3 : Back, Biceps.
Day 4 : Rest
Day 5 : Shoulders, Legs.
Day 6 : Rest.
Day 7 : Rest ( Although I go for a 10 km run on this day )
Do them in the given order. Do not change the pairs.
 
They are not just randomly paired. Chest workout automatically hits your triceps, and Back Workout is effective for your Biceps. This is how these are paired.
 
Eat healthier. Carry some water with you in the gym. Dr
Continue Reading
We will be training two parts a day. If you feel that you get tired after doing the first and you are unable to do the second efficiently, please discontinue this program.
Day 1 : Chest, Triceps.
Day 2 : Rest.
Day 3 : Back, Biceps.
Day 4 : Rest
Day 5 : Shoulders, Legs.
Day 6 : Rest.
Day 7 : Rest ( Although I go for a 10 km run on this day )
Do them in the given order. Do not change the pairs.
 
They are not just randomly paired. Chest workout automatically hits your triceps, and Back Workout is effective for your Biceps. This is how these are paired.
 
Eat healthier. Carry some water with you in the gym. Drink some coffee before the workout. Take little rest between the sets ( about 30–60 seconds ). All this things might help counter fatigue.

article:

I was an Australian travelling in Peru. Australia has very few Spanish speakers, so we get little exposure to the language. My Spanish is not at all good, but I was doing my best to communicate with the person at the reception counter of a hotel. It wasn’t going well.

She glared, declared she had no accent, and rushed her kids off

This one might seem trivial, but it stood out at the time.
 
I was an Australian travelling in Peru. Australia has very few Spanish speakers, so we get little exposure to the language. My Spanish is not at all good, but I was doing my best to communicate with the person at the reception counter of a hotel. It wasn’t going well.
 
I heard an American lady speaking English with her kids nearby. In the hope that she might be able to help, I said in her direction “Ah, there’s another English speaker, just with a different accent from mine.”
 
She glared, declared she had no accent, and rushed her kids off to wherever they were going.
 
I just stood there stunned, then went back to my bumbling version of Spanish. Got the booking organised eventually.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Many people will only work the same muscle group at most 2x a week if lifting heavily. Additionally, if these are your first three days, your muscles are not accustomed or expecting this rapid jump in activity. As you continue with your workouts you will eventually get less sore. Some muscle groups may become so used to this stress they don’t really get sore anymore and will require different exercises and increased weight/intensity to get sore.
 
Don’t work a muscle that is already sore if you have only given it a day or two of rest. Be sure to stretch their full range of motion and do some very
Continue Reading
Many people will only work the same muscle group at most 2x a week if lifting heavily. Additionally, if these are your first three days, your muscles are not accustomed or expecting this rapid jump in activity. As you continue with your workouts you will eventually get less sore. Some muscle groups may become so used to this stress they don’t really get sore anymore and will require different exercises and increased weight/intensity to get sore.
 
Don’t work a muscle that is already sore if you have only given it a day or two of rest. Be sure to stretch their full range of motion and do some very light exercise with them to flush them out. You’d be amazed how much better your legs will feel after leg day if you go for a light jog the following day.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
The general routine is to be able to hit each muscle group (excluding abs and calves ) twice per week. The abs and calves should be hit more often, but that’s up to you. You can split your routine over two, three or even four days ( but with four days, two workouts per part will take four days workouts, one day rest then four and one, totaling 10 days to complete two full body workouts ). So, you should try each and see which one you believe gives you the best results. When I was in my early years, the four day workout was very helpful, as it allowed more time to work each muscle group and the

The general routine is to be able to hit each muscle group (excluding abs and calves ) twice per week. The abs and calves should be hit more often, but that’s up to you. You can split your routine over two, three or even four days ( but with four days, two workouts per part will take four days workouts, one day rest then four and one, totaling 10 days to complete two full body workouts ). So, you should try each and see which one you believe gives you the best results. When I was in my early years, the four day workout was very helpful, as it allowed more time to work each muscle group and then more time to recover. I like that routine for overall mass and strength gains, but you really have to exhaust the muscles you’re working for it to work. jeff

In April of one year,  I told a woman I knew,  that it would be the last time I would claim my son as a dependent.  She told me I should adopt a cat. Why?  Because if you adopt a cat you can always claim it as a dependent. I looked at her to see if she was making a joke, and then I laughed.  She asked me why I was laughing, because she claimed her cat as a dependent.  Suddenly, I realized she was serious.  I told her she couldn’t do that. You have to have a social security number for a dependent.
 
“Yes, you can, Barbara!  I’ve been claiming my cat for years!”  I don’t know if the IRS caught up with the cat,  but I do know the cat owner was very upset that I questioned her claim.  But then again, perhaps I’ve been missing out on tax deduction.

First, by examining your goals, then doing at least some basic research into exercise physiology and “what does what”.
 
Goals are important as they will determine how you train and what sorts of exercise you should do. The program for a middle-aged person who just wants weight control and reasonably good health is going to be very different from a young lad training to try out for the football team, or a young woman who wants to become a competitive gymnast.
 
For most folks who are just looking for “general fitness” and not training for a particular activity, you want an aerobic component… Running, cycling, stationary machines…. A strength component (weights, bodyweight exercise, etc,) and likely some sort of skill activity for interest.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
Sure, you can even put on muscle.
 
For years I overtrained, 2 sessions a day a one time. I then cut back on gym time and transferred my obsession to cycling. The best I ever got was after working in Slovakia for a few months, where I only trained at weekends. I returned to Thailand and subsequently won my 1st race back.
 
Well that turned out to be my only 1st place - although I still got the occasional podium after resuming overtraining.
 
I stopped racing and started back in the gym about 5 years ago. Every other day, I gradually improved but never got near to where I was before.
 
Almost 3 years ago I had a change of circumstances and now train at most 5 times a fortnight- and often only have time twice a week.
 
I can't squat shit anymore, or bench press nearly as much either but on curls I'm only about 10kg off my best- and my best was 25 years ago!
 
Dorian Yates famously said : “ If training 10 hours a day and eating dog shit was the way to be a winner, I'd have done it. As it is you need first to shock your muscles and then let them rebuild, this takes longer than 24 hours”. He won 6 back to back Mr Olympia titles.
 
So my 2 cents is : pretty fast, to get your heart rate up and moderately heavy is the way to go. I'm now 64 and maintaining as much muscle mass is no longer just for asthenics, it's Essential for a a mobile and healthy old age.

title: What is a good weekly workout?
article:
If you are only working out once per week and are just interested in improving your health, I’d go for a long (2–4 hr) hike.
 
Low impact, moderate to low intensity exercise in a natural setting with clean air and no distractions is so good for you. The value can’t be understated, even if you have to drive for an hour to get to the hiking spot.
 
If you really can’t access any hiking trails or don’t have enough time to dedicate to this, a decent runner-up would be a full-body dumbbell workout. You don’t need special equipment to do it, and you can also incorporate bodyweight exercises like planks an
Continue Reading
If you are only working out once per week and are just interested in improving your health, I’d go for a long (2–4 hr) hike.
 
Low impact, moderate to low intensity exercise in a natural setting with clean air and no distractions is so good for you. The value can’t be understated, even if you have to drive for an hour to get to the hiking spot.
 
If you really can’t access any hiking trails or don’t have enough time to dedicate to this, a decent runner-up would be a full-body dumbbell workout. You don’t need special equipment to do it, and you can also incorporate bodyweight exercises like planks and pushups to give your core more love. Lifting weights helps your body to preserve bone density and strength and is vital to aging healthily.

title: How to workout
article:
To get the most out of exercise, it is important to create an exercise routine that includes a variety of different exercises.
 
1. Set a realistic goal- Start with a small achievable goal and work your way up. For example, if you are new to exercise. Aim to walk for 20 min a day, three days a week then gradually increase the intensity and frequency.
 
2. Find an activity you enjoy - The more you enjoy 
Continue Reading
To get the most out of exercise, it is important to create an exercise routine that includes a variety of different exercises.
 
1. Set a realistic goal- Start with a small achievable goal and work your way up. For example, if you are new to exercise. Aim to walk for 20 min a day, three days a week then gradually increase the intensity and frequency.
 
2. Find an activity you enjoy - The more you enjoy the routine, the more chances are you will stick to the routine the for long term. For example, if you love dancing, try a dance fitness class or go for a hike or bike ride
 
3. Make it a habit - Try to exercise at the same time every day, so that it becomes a habit. This could be first thing in the morning, during your lunch break, or in the evening after work.
 
4. Listen to your body-Pay attention to how your body feels during and after exercise. If you experience pain or discomfort, slow down or take a break. And always consult...

I came across a website called 
If the Moon Were Only 1 Pixel
 in an answer on Quora a week or two ago. It elegantly illustrates the relative distance from the sun to each of the planets and gives the user a real feel for just how much empty space there is between them. I was playing around with it while covering the front desk for my supervisor’s lunch break. When she came back from lunch, I showed it to her. After scrolling from the sun past Mercury and Venus, she asked me, “Where are all the stars?” I said, “Between the planets?” “Yeah!” I had to explain to her that the sun is the closest star to us, that light takes about 8.3 minutes to get here from the sun, and that the next closest star is over four years away at the speed of light.

Here’s a fun story. One year in college, I was taking a course in Communications 101. For no specified reason, the professor announces that we’re all going to take a quiz on the names of the US states.
 
“Hell Yeah! This’ll be easy!” I thought. The kid next to me also reveals that this would also be easy for him. We completed our tests, but it turns out we messed up the location of a few states. 48 out of 50. We were both so disappointed, but then the professor addresses the rest of the class.
 
“Did anyone get at least twenty states correct?” he asks. Mine, my seatmate’s, and one other hand is raised.
 
“Ten states?” The professor asked.
 
“Five?”
 
“One?”
 
Most students in the class couldn’t even name the very state we were in.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
For new lifters, full-body workouts are the fastest way to progress. Your trainer’s advice looks solid to me, and is a pretty typical way to start with strength training.
 
Doing splits, where you cover different body parts on different days, is an option (but not the only option!) once you get to an intermediate level. The advantage of splits is that it gives you more time to recover. Typically you’ll do each muscle group 2x a week, instead of 3x as you would with full-body workouts. (Avoid splits where you only do a muscle 1x per week, this is inefficient for most people.) The disadvantage to s
Continue Reading
For new lifters, full-body workouts are the fastest way to progress. Your trainer’s advice looks solid to me, and is a pretty typical way to start with strength training.
 
Doing splits, where you cover different body parts on different days, is an option (but not the only option!) once you get to an intermediate level. The advantage of splits is that it gives you more time to recover. Typically you’ll do each muscle group 2x a week, instead of 3x as you would with full-body workouts. (Avoid splits where you only do a muscle 1x per week, this is inefficient for most people.) The disadvantage to splits is that you will progress more slowly. As a new lifter, you don’t need the extra recovery time, so there’s less reason to do splits.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
yes. Twenty minutes of good exercise a day will get you in shape. It won’t be fast, but it will certainly strengthen your muscles. You want to go for cardio-level exercise: get the heart rate up, get the lungs breathing deeply. If all you’ve got is twenty minutes a day, you can do twenty pull-ups and a hundred sit-ups/crunches, alternating say one pull-up/five crunches, non-stop for twenty minutes. Or you can run 4K and try to build up to 5k.
 
It’s best to do this exercise in sunlight, especially if you are female. The sunlight will encourage the production of Vitamin D by your skin. Vitamin D d

yes. Twenty minutes of good exercise a day will get you in shape. It won’t be fast, but it will certainly strengthen your muscles. You want to go for cardio-level exercise: get the heart rate up, get the lungs breathing deeply. If all you’ve got is twenty minutes a day, you can do twenty pull-ups and a hundred sit-ups/crunches, alternating say one pull-up/five crunches, non-stop for twenty minutes. Or you can run 4K and try to build up to 5k.
 
It’s best to do this exercise in sunlight, especially if you are female. The sunlight will encourage the production of Vitamin D by your skin. Vitamin D deficiency during pregnancy has been shown to be a cause of autism in children, and a cause of skin diseases in adults. Get outside.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Unless you are currently bone thin with minimal chest strength, you are not likely going to see any noticeable chest muscle growth from doing push-ups.
 
Hypertrophy (muscle growth) requires that you perform heavy resistance training in a low to medium repetition range (5 to 8 reps per set), and progressively overload (increase) the resistance over time. The only scenario where push-ups would allow for that type of training is if you currently can’t do more than a few push-ups in a row.
 
Assuming you can already do more than a few push-ups in a row, you are going to need to either use a weighted ve
Continue Reading
Unless you are currently bone thin with minimal chest strength, you are not likely going to see any noticeable chest muscle growth from doing push-ups.
 
Hypertrophy (muscle growth) requires that you perform heavy resistance training in a low to medium repetition range (5 to 8 reps per set), and progressively overload (increase) the resistance over time. The only scenario where push-ups would allow for that type of training is if you currently can’t do more than a few push-ups in a row.
 
Assuming you can already do more than a few push-ups in a row, you are going to need to either use a weighted vest, or use some other form of resistance (free weights, machines, etc) in order to effectively train for muscle hypertrophy.

title: How to workout
article:

For example, let's assume that your day begins at 6 am, when you get up and start getting ready for the day. Let's say you have an exercise time in the evening which you sometimes stick to, and other times you don't. Shift this evening slot to early morning. Wake up at 5 am instead. Now that you've gotten up already, and your activities are meant to begin at 6, you have to do SOMETHING in this one hour. Also, waking up early gives you a sense of purpose. title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
When i moved to Prague in the early 90s there were a lot of American’s that just could not relate to the local people and got very frustrated with the language. One fellow American at the local store just could not figure out where the flour was and started saying flour louder and louder and eventually pointing at bread and pantomiming hysterically. They showed him just other bread, pastries, rolls.. Eventually he drew a picture of a flower to show them “flour” and of course they sent him off to the florist. It seemed to never dawn on him that Czechs might use a totally different word (mouka) 
Continue Reading
When i moved to Prague in the early 90s there were a lot of American’s that just could not relate to the local people and got very frustrated with the language. One fellow American at the local store just could not figure out where the flour was and started saying flour louder and louder and eventually pointing at bread and pantomiming hysterically. They showed him just other bread, pastries, rolls.. Eventually he drew a picture of a flower to show them “flour” and of course they sent him off to the florist. It seemed to never dawn on him that Czechs might use a totally different word (mouka) for that item.
 
That could possibly all be forgiven, except he is relating this story to demonstrate to me how dumb the locals are.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
It is generally recommended that adults should aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate aerobic exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous aerobic exercise per week, in addition to strength training exercises that work all major muscle groups at least two days per week.
 
However, if you are new to exercise or have been inactive for a while, it's important to start slow and gradually increase the frequency and intensity of your workouts over time. Consult with a healthcare professional or a fitness trainer for personalized recommendations based on your individual needs and goals. Remember, consistency is
Continue Reading
It is generally recommended that adults should aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate aerobic exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous aerobic exercise per week, in addition to strength training exercises that work all major muscle groups at least two days per week.
 
However, if you are new to exercise or have been inactive for a while, it's important to start slow and gradually increase the frequency and intensity of your workouts over time. Consult with a healthcare professional or a fitness trainer for personalized recommendations based on your individual needs and goals. Remember, consistency is key when it comes to achieving fitness goals, so finding a routine that you enjoy and can stick with long-term is important.

This happened to me around 2007 when I was in USA in VA
 
So I was using a treadmill. As I was used to km/hr back in India I changed the setting from miles/hr to km/hr. I was at about 8 KM/hr.
 
Suddenly a girl start using the treadmill beside me, after sometime she interrupted me and asked “excuse me why is that the my treadmill so fast even tough we both are speed 8?”.
 
I explained her that my speed is in KM/hr and her’s in miles/hr. She nodded her head and I thought she understood everything.
 
After sometime she interrupted me again “but basically we are at the same speed so how should it matter if your treadmill is in KM/Hr and mine in Miles/Hr”
 
After so many years I laugh thinking about that incident.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
In about 1967 a friend of mine had spent her gap year before university in the United States and ended up in San Francisco. So when she needed to return to England, she caught a bus back to New York where her ticket was from. She got chatting to a girl on the bus who was extremely confused as to why my friend was heading east. Eventually it turned out that she was convinced that Britain lay across the Pacific, west of America. My friend could have dealt with that, but it turned out that her acquaintance was a student majoring in geography.
 
[I have told this anecdote before, and a couple of Amer

In about 1967 a friend of mine had spent her gap year before university in the United States and ended up in San Francisco. So when she needed to return to England, she caught a bus back to New York where her ticket was from. She got chatting to a girl on the bus who was extremely confused as to why my friend was heading east. Eventually it turned out that she was convinced that Britain lay across the Pacific, west of America. My friend could have dealt with that, but it turned out that her acquaintance was a student majoring in geography.
 
[I have told this anecdote before, and a couple of Americans have asked why she didn’t simply change her reservation and fly out of SF. D’oh. 1967? 707s didn’t have the range.]

article:
“Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?”
 
I spent a year of my student life at the University of Massachusetts in Amherst, and while there I worked in one of the food halls around the campus. I met some lovely people, most of whom were intelligent and worldly wise. One person I met, however, was neither bright, nor informed about the world. title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Not only can you MAINTAIN muscle with this approach, you can GAIN a shit ton of it.
During the silver era, all the bros trained their full body 3x a week, and look at them!
 
You can bet your bottom dollar they’re all natural, as steroids hadn’t even been invented yet.
 
Back To You:
 
The question you should ask yourself is how long you want to spend in the gym.
 
If you’re willing to spend 2+ hours you can be sure you’ll maximise your muscle growth potential with a full body workout.
 
If you’re pressed for time however you can probably get about 80% of the gains in an about an hour if you train hard enough

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I have not personally experienced any such incident, but I am going to give an example that most people might remember.
 
In 2014, when Indian-American Nina Davuluri won the Miss America title, Twitter exploded with tweets like “Arab wins America” or “More like Miss Terrorist” or “How the f*** a foreigner won Miss America? She’s an Arab, for God’s sake” and more. Let us understand the facts here that:
Miss. Davuluri is of Indian origin, so clearly she’s not an Arab.
She is an American national. The basic requirement of participating in Miss America is the contestant should be a citizen of America.

I have not personally experienced any such incident, but I am going to give an example that most people might remember.
 
In 2014, when Indian-American Nina Davuluri won the Miss America title, Twitter exploded with tweets like “Arab wins America” or “More like Miss Terrorist” or “How the f*** a foreigner won Miss America? She’s an Arab, for God’s sake” and more. Let us understand the facts here that:
Miss. Davuluri is of Indian origin, so clearly she’s not an Arab.
She is an American national. The basic requirement of participating in Miss America is the contestant should be a citizen of America. Anyone who watches Miss America knows this.
Now if this isn’t a classic example of ignorance, I don’t know what is.

article:

article:
Poor people are everywhere. Poverty is as much a state of mind as a state of financial well being. We have created a culture or professional poverty players. They know how to get free housing, free money, free phone service, free internet access, free clothes, free healthcare, free food, free haircuts, free childcare, free education. And when its not free, they know how to get grant money, charitable money. They know which churches offer what freebies, which charities are giving things away. They spend much of their time applying for freebies or waiting in line for freebies. They live as well 
Continue Reading
Poor people are everywhere. Poverty is as much a state of mind as a state of financial well being. We have created a culture or professional poverty players. They know how to get free housing, free money, free phone service, free internet access, free clothes, free healthcare, free food, free haircuts, free childcare, free education. And when its not free, they know how to get grant money, charitable money. They know which churches offer what freebies, which charities are giving things away. They spend much of their time applying for freebies or waiting in line for freebies. They live as well if not better than most middle class working folks. It's time to take an honest look at poverty- at least in this country.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
The best workout routine is simply the one that you will be most consistent with. I tell my clients and individuals who reach out about training programs this. If I tell you that I just created the world’s best training program for you and find out 12-weeks later that you only did the workouts prescribed 1x a week maybe, then it is not the world’s best program for you.
 
It all comes down to how much time you have available and your goals. For those on a time crunch or are new, I’m a fan of picking a movement for each of the following category categories and performing 3–4 sets of each for 6–12 r
Continue Reading
The best workout routine is simply the one that you will be most consistent with. I tell my clients and individuals who reach out about training programs this. If I tell you that I just created the world’s best training program for you and find out 12-weeks later that you only did the workouts prescribed 1x a week maybe, then it is not the world’s best program for you.
 
It all comes down to how much time you have available and your goals. For those on a time crunch or are new, I’m a fan of picking a movement for each of the following category categories and performing 3–4 sets of each for 6–12 repetitions.
 
1) squat or hinge
 
2) push, pull
 
3) single leg / single arm
 
4) core
 
5) metabolic/conditioning

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I once visited the maternity ward at the local American hospital. There were about two dozen babies there in bassinets. Not one of those babies was able to tell me the date, not one knew how to use Google. None had heard of the Declaration of Independence. The simple fact is, we’re all born with ignorance, that’s something we all share. Even when we learn a lot about one topic, we’re ignorant of another. Master one language, even five languages, and the vast majority of languages, you will always be illiterate in. So ease up a bit. Never be cocky and judgmental about what someone else doesn’t 
Continue Reading
I once visited the maternity ward at the local American hospital. There were about two dozen babies there in bassinets. Not one of those babies was able to tell me the date, not one knew how to use Google. None had heard of the Declaration of Independence. The simple fact is, we’re all born with ignorance, that’s something we all share. Even when we learn a lot about one topic, we’re ignorant of another. Master one language, even five languages, and the vast majority of languages, you will always be illiterate in. So ease up a bit. Never be cocky and judgmental about what someone else doesn’t know. Share your knowledge, teach a child, help a neighbor, and do what you can to enlighten yourself whenever possible.

Well he was psyched about Canada, his kids getting an education and his daughter getting the care she needed and not you know dying or costing millions to keep her alive. She for whatever idiotic reason thought that they should move back and deal with a worse life for their kids.

My first year at uni studying music, I was exiting a practice room when I saw two girls looking at a cork board on the wall. One of them turned to the other and “Hey, what’s ‘choy-er?’” The other took a long look at her and slowly said “I think that says ‘choir,’ Anna.”
 
Mind you, both of these girls were at least freshmen in music school, and had to be at least 17–18 years old.
 
This was not an isolated incident. I heard another person ask if Sigmund Freud was “the guy who had his head eaten by a lion,” in a psychology class, and the same person could not be dissuaded from the ridiculous idea that “germs always enter your body through your nose, so if you don’t pick your nose you’ll never get sick.”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Marcella Huff
 · 
Just now
 
I am getting tired of the questions on Quora specifically targeting Americans and their bad behavior, lack of education, unfriendliness, or you name it. Meeting one or even several people from a country does not qualify anyone to make blanket statements about their culture, behaviors or characteristics. America is a huge country, it has been populated by people from all parts of the world. Therein lies its strengths. As with any country there will always be people whose behaviors make us cringe. It is unfair to assume that they are the embodiment or represent all people

title: What is the best workout for me?
article:
AEROBIC FITNESS
I work out of the stepper at least 5 times a week with my heart rate over 130 beats per minute. I also take the dog for a walk for 30 minutes every day.
 
STRENGTH
I go to the gym three times a week and do a superset workout for 40 minutes_ three sets of push out, pull back; push up, pull down; situps, hip strengtheners, a set of cleans and three sets of shoulder exercises.
 
FLEXIBILITY
After the strength training session I do a 20 minute flexibility session aimed at keeping my pelvis and the bones above it and below it in reasonable alignment.
 
You can read all about my workout at ht

🔥𝗦𝗮𝗱𝗵𝗴𝘂𝗿𝘂🔥: When it comes to activity, what we need to understand fundamentally is that our body has the capability to bend forwards and backwards, as well as twist sideways in either direction. This kind of activity must happen in some form.
If you practice classical Hatha Yoga, that is the best way to do it, as it is a scientific approach. If classical Hatha Yoga is not yet part of your life, you must ensure that every day, you bend forward, backward, twist both ways, and squat to stretch the spinal column. This level of activity is essential for everyone on a daily basis if we want to keep the entire system in a healthy state, particularly the neurological system, which can otherwise become an issue as we age.

Some years back before peace broke out in Northern Ireland I met an Irish-American couple in Cambridge, Mass. They seemed quite educated and were visiting their son who was studying at Harvard.

“I don’t believe you - why would Catholics support the Union?”
 
“Well, the majority of the population are Protestant.”
 
“There are Protestants in Northern Ireland??”

Ignorance is relative. Something that you and everyone else in your locale grew up knowing might be completely unknown to an outsider. The newcomer might be considered ignorant by those who thought the local knowledge was “obvious” Ignorance should not be confused with a lack of education or intellect. Lack of a formal education, being possessed of a narrow minded point of view, cultural difference, generational difference and growing up around ignoramuses would limit a persons ability to identify and/or accept other points of view. Ignorance isn’t necessarily a negative state of mind. It’s the failure to lift one’s self out of ignorance when given the opportunity that speaks more about the individual.

I just want to say two things before I start. First, I’m a Catholic. Second, I’m a Canadian and this will be about me.
 
So, I was raised in a Roman Catholic household. Now, when I was very young, I think no more than seven, I went over to my neighbour’s house one Sunday after Mass. I went to a Catholic school and I wasn’t taught about other religions let alone other denominations, it was essentially Catholics and people who went to public schools were not religious. So I was finally free to have fun and I knocked on my friend’s door to ask if she could come and play. She told me she was going to church. My response: but you’re not Catholic…
 
Please, don’t judge me too harshly. I was in Grade One.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
Ham, cheese and egg sandwich
 
The toast is fried on the outside and soft on the inside, with ham and cheese
 
It's delicious, try it if you like it~
Ingredients:
 
2 slices of toast
 
4 eggs
 
3 slices of cheese
 
Some tomato sauce
 
Some black pepper and salt
Method:
 
1. Beat the eggs and mix well with salt and black pepper
 
2. Put butter in the pan, turn on low heat, pour half of the egg liquid and put the toast
 
3. Wait for the egg liquid to solidify, turn it over and fold it four times
 
4. Put a slice of cheese and ham on it, and then put half of the cheese slice on it
 
Squeeze tomato sauce on it, fold the toast in half 
Continue Reading

4 eggs
 
3 slices of cheese
 
Some tomato sauce
 
Some black pepper and salt
Method:
 
1. Beat the eggs and mix well with salt and black pepper
 
2. Put butter in the pan, turn on low heat, pour half of the egg liquid and put the toast
 
3. Wait for the egg liquid to solidify, turn it over and fold it four times
 
4. Put a slice of cheese and ham on it, and then put half of the cheese slice on it
 
Squeeze tomato sauce on it, fold the toast in half and sprinkle some chopped parsley

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
Depends on the objective.
 
If it is for overall health, this is better than the gym. Reasons:
Free! No need for gym membership
Available 24X7. If it rains, find a sheltered walk way or even a covered multi storey carpark etc
Brisk walking first thing in the morning, helps burn fat
Less risk of injuries
Enjoy the great outdoors and fresh air. This is better for health
Improve eyesight. Focusing on distant objects out doors is better for eyes

We went into Burnie in the north of Tasmania the next day, where she was removed from the ship. Horrible woman.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
I switch thing up every 3 to 4 months but I like to hit the gym 6 days a week.  My current program is my favorite structure.  It falls on different days each week because it follows an 8 day cycle:
 
Legs for Strength: the big compound lifts for 5 sets of 3-5 reps each.
 
Push for strength: low reps, big compound push movements.
 
Pull Strength:  low reps, compound pull movements
 
Rest / HIIT / Abs
 
Legs Hypertrophy: 8 to 12 reps with compound and isolation exercises
 
Push Hypertrophy: 8 to 12 reps compound push and isolation movements on triceps.
 
Pull Hypertrophy: 8 to 12 reps pull movements and isolation on

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
It depends.
 
If you want to train full body every day - then definitely no. Your muscles won`t have enough rest. Each muscle needs at least 48 hours to rest (sometimes it`s even 72 hours). So you won`t be able to train effective and won`t get enough rest.
 
But it`s possible to train every day if you train only 1 muscle per day. In this case, your body will have enough rest, but only if your training is not hardcore and very hard. Because not only your body but also your central nervous system needs a rest. And if you load it too much it will cause nothing good…
 
So better not to train every day, but
Continue Reading
It depends.
 
If you want to train full body every day - then definitely no. Your muscles won`t have enough rest. Each muscle needs at least 48 hours to rest (sometimes it`s even 72 hours). So you won`t be able to train effective and won`t get enough rest.
 
But it`s possible to train every day if you train only 1 muscle per day. In this case, your body will have enough rest, but only if your training is not hardcore and very hard. Because not only your body but also your central nervous system needs a rest. And if you load it too much it will cause nothing good…
 
So better not to train every day, but if you really want to then I recommend to train no more than 1 muscle a day.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
There are general answers to this question and then there are responses that relate to you individually. Generally, if you are talking about weightlifting, three well planned and sufficiently intense session a week combined with not excessive but good nutrition will work well. Then there is the question of your goals. What are they? What are you training for? Good health and strength? Competition in a field? What is your age and current level of fitness? You will have to do more than ask a general question. Do some research, search your own motivations, perhaps get a book like Bill Pearl’s “Ge
Continue Reading
There are general answers to this question and then there are responses that relate to you individually. Generally, if you are talking about weightlifting, three well planned and sufficiently intense session a week combined with not excessive but good nutrition will work well. Then there is the question of your goals. What are they? What are you training for? Good health and strength? Competition in a field? What is your age and current level of fitness? You will have to do more than ask a general question. Do some research, search your own motivations, perhaps get a book like Bill Pearl’s “Getting Stronger” would be an excellent place to start in order to answer your own question(s).

My boss at a former job hired clerical staff based on their looks rather than their abilities.
 
One pretty young thing was typing a letter one day and discovered she only had one more stationery second sheet — the blank sheets made of the same paper as the letterhead stationery. If a letter was more than one page long, you would use the second sheet to type any pages after the first. This letter was going to be three pages long and she only had one second sheet.
 
“What should I do?” she asked? “Just use some plain white copier paper” I told her. I then sat flabbergasted as she took the one remaining second sheet to the copier and made a dozen copies of a blank sheet of paper.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I learned maps at single-digit age in East Tennessee and fell in love. Local, national, world, topo, road, political, all kinds of maps. I can’t remember when I learned where Indiana, Iran and Indonesia are, but it was long before I met people from there as a New York suburban teenager.
 
A hundred years ago geography and penmanship were important subjects in American schools. My schooling came after mid-century, and neglected them. So, I never had good handwriting, but geography didn’t have to be a school subject for me to love studying it.
 
Nowadays I spend my time with bikers and Wikipedians. Al

I learned maps at single-digit age in East Tennessee and fell in love. Local, national, world, topo, road, political, all kinds of maps. I can’t remember when I learned where Indiana, Iran and Indonesia are, but it was long before I met people from there as a New York suburban teenager.
 
A hundred years ago geography and penmanship were important subjects in American schools. My schooling came after mid-century, and neglected them. So, I never had good handwriting, but geography didn’t have to be a school subject for me to love studying it.
 
Nowadays I spend my time with bikers and Wikipedians. All those people know geography and many of them know a few places that I don’t.

article:
The basic twist lies in the question itself.
 
The way you ask question is the way you get the answer.
 
You presumed that internet and quora is a matter of riches! And from that point of view you asked the question.
 
You could have asked the Quora founder(s) :
 
Is Quora for riches only?
 
Well, the answer is NO!
 
Obviously!!!
 
My question is :
 
If the NO is so obvious then why exactly did you ask this question?
 
After all, what we see in result (number of views/upvotes etc…) is : “So many people around are suffering from the same wrong perspective”…
 
and is that why they wanted to check the answer? or upvoted this?

article:
Stronglift5x5. I found this gem and started practicing it relgiously since the beginning of this year. I now use different variations of this according to my mood and plan at times. Stronglift5x5. I found this gem and started practicing it relgiously since the beginning of this year. I now use different variations of this according to my mood and plan at times. But I have become a huge fan of the 5x5 mindset and the technique of using only compounded lifts unless a rare bicep curl here and there.
 
The routine has enabled me to lift more weights even with dumbbells, compared to what I had been lifting in the past. I am also able to do even isolation movements with much more intensity now. Not to mention my legs and calves. Everything improved and even my biceps look better now without an ‘arm day’.
 
Without a doubt, this is my favourite workout routine.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
Depends entirely on your goals and what “full-body workout” means to you. If your goal is to develop endurance and be able to have functional strength that you can call on any time, then training every day might not just be desirable, it may be necessary. If your goal is to build maximal strength or to build muscle via hypertrophy, then training every day may well work against you, as those gains happen when you give yourself time to recover from training.
 
For some people, volume and frequency need to be managed. Some people can get away with a lot of it, frequently, others need to have a good 
Continue Reading
Depends entirely on your goals and what “full-body workout” means to you. If your goal is to develop endurance and be able to have functional strength that you can call on any time, then training every day might not just be desirable, it may be necessary. If your goal is to build maximal strength or to build muscle via hypertrophy, then training every day may well work against you, as those gains happen when you give yourself time to recover from training.
 
For some people, volume and frequency need to be managed. Some people can get away with a lot of it, frequently, others need to have a good gap in their workouts with maximum recovery time. Genetics plays a part in this.

She told me she saw it on TV this morning. Then it hit me, she was talking about Russian invasion of Georgia, the country. When she heard it on the news that Russians had invaded Georgia and saw the soldiers with guns on the street she thought they had invaded Georgia, a state in the U.S. Atlanta is the capital of Georgia.

OK, this is NOT the dirtiest song I’ve ever heard. But it was the first. Sort of.
 
Let’s go back to 1972. I’m in junior high school. And there’s this catchy song on the radio, and I can’t believe I’m hearing this on the radio.
 
I loved the song and bought the record but only played it when my parents weren’t around, because, you know.
 
So what is this scandalous song?
“Go All the Way” by Eric Carmen and the Raspberries.
 
Yeah.
 
So now I’ve got grandkids,, and they’ve seen “Guardians of the Galaxy,” and to my discomfort, one of them asks their mother, my daughter, “What does ‘go all the way’ mean?”
 
Without even blinking, she says, “It means to have sex.”
 
“Oh, OK.”
 
End of conversation.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
The question is very abstract as it does not provide an idea of what you are aiming to achieve.
 
At a very general level,workout 5-6 days a week. Keep one day as Rest day.
 
If your workout program is a full bodyworkout( which is generally recommended for beginners) then I suggest workout on ALTERNATE days.
 
Later your program wil change to 2 muscle groups a day, and then you can think of going every day.
 
As far as the pain part is considered. Its just the first few days.
 
Later either the pain will make you discontinue going to the gym. Or you will accept that PAIN is a part of your life every single t

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
The frequency of gym going completely depends on the commitment and how disciplined are you with the diet as well. With that said, with high dedication and resulting progress over time, continuous 5 days a week for e period of 6 month with strict diet is good enough.
 
Tracking apps and online fitness tool can assist to record the body changes and BMI variations for each month to get idea about personalized weight loss pattern on basis of metabolism and other factors as each body is different and reacts differently to exercise, workout and diet.
 
One can use Gym management member apps like Gymclock

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
I wouldn’t describe myself as being poor, but I am on a very low income. I’m a British citizen living in Greece and making a living as a freelance writer which means that my income is not guaranteed and fluctuates. I live in a small (one up, one down) house in the old part of my village and don’t own a vehicle. My rent is incredibly cheap (€180 per month) and I’m currently planning to move closer to the coast but will set a limit of €250 per month for rent as this is all I can afford. On what I earn, I wouldn’t be able to afford to rent a single room in the UK. However, I wouldn’t say I’m poor

I wouldn’t describe myself as being poor, but I am on a very low income. I’m a British citizen living in Greece and making a living as a freelance writer which means that my income is not guaranteed and fluctuates. I live in a small (one up, one down) house in the old part of my village and don’t own a vehicle. My rent is incredibly cheap (€180 per month) and I’m currently planning to move closer to the coast but will set a limit of €250 per month for rent as this is all I can afford. On what I earn, I wouldn’t be able to afford to rent a single room in the UK. However, I wouldn’t say I’m poor as I have a roof over my head and can afford to pay my bills and pay for food.

The lady at the table next to me in a steak restaurant in the Dominican Republic last week.
She ordered rib eye steak “very well done, “ very loudly, three times.
When said piece of shoe leather arrived she applied butter to both sides.
She referred to the waiter as “ Hey Nigger!”
After tearing up the steak with the knife and fork (I don't think she'd never used cutlery before) she used the fork in her right hand to shovel the food into her mouth.
With her left hand now free she lit and smoked a cigarette between mouthfuls.
It truly was a disgusting sight as she chewed with her mouth open, she looked like a front loading washing machine about to burst into flames.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

‘If you’re Chinese, are you also Asian?’
 
Dumbfounded, I said: ‘Yes, of course. China is part of Asia’
 
She told me that another Chinese girl told her not to call her Asian, but Chinese, so she was confused.
 
This was a 30-something year old woman with kids.
I had to train another lady (over 50) for work years ago.
 
We made outbound calls to doctors offices around the US, so we had to be mindful of time zones.
 
This lady had no idea about time zones in the US.
 
She didn’t know they existed, or how they worked.
 
It took me hours of explaining before she began to understa

I've met a lot of Americans in my short life, either online or in person while traveling, and while I think it is unfair to imply that all Americans are ignorant, there are quite a few of them who do match that description.
 
One case that I would like to point out is that I have met quite a few Americans, mostly from the southern states, that believed Canada to be a state. We're talking about high school graduates, some of them even in university, and they don't even know the states in their own country! It's shameful really.

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
There is no special reason for which you should not do it. But, in my honest opinion, if you are able to hit the gym more than four days in a week, then it is better that instead of doing mixed workout you focus on specific muscle groups per day.
 
If you are someone who is unable to hit the gym regularly, then it might be a good option to do mixed workout anytime you get to hit the gym, as you are able to train almost all of your muscle groups throughout the week.
 
However, you can do mixed workout regularly if you want as well. But, for proper growth you need to ensure that your muscles get suffi

There is no special reason for which you should not do it. But, in my honest opinion, if you are able to hit the gym more than four days in a week, then it is better that instead of doing mixed workout you focus on specific muscle groups per day.
 
If you are someone who is unable to hit the gym regularly, then it might be a good option to do mixed workout anytime you get to hit the gym, as you are able to train almost all of your muscle groups throughout the week.
 
However, you can do mixed workout regularly if you want as well. But, for proper growth you need to ensure that your muscles get sufficiently stressed, else it would not get proper developed.

As a Canadian, I am naturally drawn to the warm vacation resorts in Mexico and as a teenager my family did a few March-break trips to relax on the Mexican beaches. This was a major source of mingling with Americans that would have otherwise been holed up in their own country.
 
The most memorable example of ignorance was when my friend and struck up a conversation with a couple of similarly aged American girls from Chicago. We were joking around about our differing pronunciations of the “o” in the word Hockey when it came out that we are in fact Canadian and not American. One of the girls looked perplexed and replied:
 
“Oh! I thought Canada was a state.”

I’m in the same boat you are, except I’m 67 (still working) and have no children. A new Planet Fitness opened here in September, and I’ve been going there for $10 per month. It’s also covered by Silver Sneakers. I have no savings, a very small retirement (less than $200) from a job I worked for 17 years and left in 1989 and I now am on Social Security, receiving way less than most people I’ve spoken with. With those 3 things, I still don’t have enough money for all my bills. I eat very little, as I’m watching my weight seriously, so that helps, but I have 3 cats. I’ll buy food for them before I’ll buy for myself.
 
So yeah, there are “poor” people on Quora.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I asked for builders tea, and was glad when the guy brought over a kettle. I guess he thought that the tea bag was like a coffee filter, that it would transform water to tea every time.
 
I say this, because of how it was served. In the cup, was a tea bag inside hot water - all I had to do was put milk and sugar in.
 
But when I finished the cup, I realsed that he had filled the kettle with hot water, and simply didn’t underst

This was less ignorance, and more a funny mistake. I was at a diner in NJ, and it was in the morning - for a Brit, that means tea time (not “tea-time”, tea time [time for tea])
 
I asked for builders tea, and was glad when the guy brought over a kettle. I guess he thought that the tea bag was like a coffee filter, that it would transform water to tea every time.
 
I say this, because of how it was served. In the cup, was a tea bag inside hot water - all I had to do was put milk and sugar in.
 
But when I finished the cup, I realsed that he had filled the kettle with hot water, and simply didn’t understand the concept of how tea was made. Poor lad.

article:

Have many meals inside of three big ones to divide your consumption. You may want to have some protein and carbs at least an hour before and after your workouts for energy and muscle repair. You do the math first. That is to say, you compute for your calorie and macronutrient requirements first. Whether you want to lose weight or gain muscle mass, it would be best for you to get the values first. Once you’re done with that, do some meal planning and set your workout routine. Have many meals inside of three big ones to divide your consumption. You may want to have some protein and carbs at least an hour before and after your workouts for energy and muscle repair. Plan when it would be best for you to do cardio and resistance training weekly. That is so you would be able to reduce your body fats while maintaining or improving your muscle mass.

I am an international student living in the US and originally from Mexico. Once during a conversation I was talking about the many people who mistakenly believe that Mexicans speak Mexican, instead of Spanish. Someone replied with a question: Do Mexicans and Spaniards speak the same language because they were neighbors when Pangea was a single continent?
 
First I though it was a joke, until I realized it was a legitimate question. The surprising part is that this person speaks four languages, is well-versed in geography, and knows well the history of some conflicts around the world, but still was not aware of the colonization of America by Spaniards.

The other backpacker told his friend to pick up the glass, but the reply was “No, I didn’t mean to drop it so I’m not picking it up”. title: How workout exercises?
article:
So my best recommendation for muscle building would be to perform 18-24 sets in your given weightlifting workout. Now you can split this up however you'd like but I would do 3-4 sets per exercise so 6-8 exercises total. Its also best to stay in the hypertrophy range 8-12 reps as this is the prime muscle building rep range. Once you get higher than 12 reps you are working on improving your muscular endurance. 
 
Also going off the exercises you provided it would probably be best to focus on some more compound lifts like bench press, rows, squats as these will engage multiple muscles as once instea
Continue Reading
So my best recommendation for muscle building would be to perform 18-24 sets in your given weightlifting workout. Now you can split this up however you'd like but I would do 3-4 sets per exercise so 6-8 exercises total. Its also best to stay in the hypertrophy range 8-12 reps as this is the prime muscle building rep range. Once you get higher than 12 reps you are working on improving your muscular endurance. 
 
Also going off the exercises you provided it would probably be best to focus on some more compound lifts like bench press, rows, squats as these will engage multiple muscles as once instead of accesory movements like a tricep extension.

In 2008 I was the international counselor at Many Point Scout Camp in Minnesota. Each week we got a new batch of scouts in, and while their leaders registered them, the staff did the swimming assessments for the kids down at the lake. We also did the introductions of our staff to them. Every time we did this, I wore a New Zealand sports team shirt (cricket) all with the words NEW ZEALAND on them, and large silver fern designs or similar on them.
 
We got into the habit early on that we would let the scouts guess where in the world I came from. Out of about 1500 kids over the summer, I think only about 3 got it right first time, and one impressed me because he got it from recognising the New Zealand flag up by the lodge.
 
Naturally I got told Australia more times than I could count, with a few “England”, “Scotland” and “Canada” respo...

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I had a letter to mail to Bozeman, MT. A young undergrad student was at the counter. I gave her this letter to weigh out and to calculate the postage amount due. She looked at the address on the letter and returned it to me saying you can't mail letters abroad from here! I found it hard to keep a straight face and had to educate her about the letter being sent to a domestic destination.

As you said ‘arms’ I will assume you mean the entire arm, as opposed to just biceps or triceps.
 
I would say do Chins or rows as they’ll give your back and biceps a challenge, perform dips or bench to stimulate your triceps with your chest as a double bonus and finally.
 
This two movements alone cover all bases. But as you want three movements why not slip heavy deadlifts in there which is not only a superb total body lift but will have the added bonus of thickening your forearms up.
 
Of course, don’t just do these 3 movements. Do a program based around the big compound lifts to develop an all round functional and strong body.

When I was 16 I worked for a born-again Baptist skipper on a fishing boat. I think he must have come to religion later in life because at meals he usually took one or two bites, vigorously slapped himself on the forehead, and then said grace. He saw me as a captive audience for conversion as the boat was only 32 feet long and it was hard to get away from him. I told him I was an atheist. His strongest argument for Christianity was that if I didn’t accept Jesus as my personal savior I would burn in hell. When I pointed out that evolution contradicted the mythology of the book of Genesis, he said, “Aw, what do a bunch of old bones prove?”

article:

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I live in New Zealand.
 
One day years ago a tourist with an American accent stopped me in the street.
 
“Please tell me, where can I post this letter?”
 
I pointed to one of our bright red posting boxes a few metres away and said “Put it in that slot.”
 
Her response staggered me: “Oh, will it go?”
 
To this day I have no idea why she thought it might not, and the only explanation I can think of is she might have lived her entire life in an apartment building where the mail was delivered and collected, and she’d never seen a street posting box.
 
(Yep, I’ve visited the USA and I had no trouble using US Mail bo

I live in New Zealand.
 
One day years ago a tourist with an American accent stopped me in the street.
 
“Please tell me, where can I post this letter?”
 
I pointed to one of our bright red posting boxes a few metres away and said “Put it in that slot.”
 
Her response staggered me: “Oh, will it go?”
 
To this day I have no idea why she thought it might not, and the only explanation I can think of is she might have lived her entire life in an apartment building where the mail was delivered and collected, and she’d never seen a street posting box.
 
(Yep, I’ve visited the USA and I had no trouble using US Mail boxes.)

I was in Naples, and while talking about home, this American girl asked me about the weather in Chile, where I’m from originally. It was mid-August.
 
“Well, right now it’s -1 celsius back home” I replied after checking the weather app on my phone.
 
“What?? Hell of a summer!!” she said, and I immediately told her that it was winter down there. Then she just froze and stared at me with her eyes wide opened
 
“Whaat? It's not summer everywhere??”
 
After I had explained her the whole 2-different-hemispheres thing, she sighed and said: “well, I knew there was something wrong with Australia, but I thought it was just them”.

article:

 — ‘Pew-jawt’* why?

article:
I’m English and met an American girl whilst I was in Toronto. We got speaking small talk and then she remarked on what good English I spoke. It took a few seconds for the penny to drop with me what she was on about until I realised you she didn’t think English was my native tongue. So the conversation went like:
 
Her: You speak very good English.
 
Me: What language do you think people in England speak?
 
Her: I don’t know.
 
Me: Have a guess, the clue is in my country’s name, England.
 
Her: I don’t know, is it French?
 
I’ve repeated that story a few times over the years, it always tickles me and gets a laug

Her: I don’t know, is it French?
 
I’ve repeated that story a few times over the years, it always tickles me and gets a laugh.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
Absolutely.
 
It is best to lift (or run, bike, swim or whatever you like to do for exercise) whenever it fits best into your daily schedule.
 
Expedience should always trump any theoretical considerations of “best”. Best is whatever is best for you.
 
Research has shown that people are (slightly) stronger, faster and tougher in the afternoon and they try to schedule major athletics events like Olympic 100m finals around mid-afternoon because it has been shown that this is the most likely time to get records.
 
But this is unimportant for any individual trying to fit exercise into a busy day.
 
Do what you h

Research has shown that people are (slightly) stronger, faster and tougher in the afternoon and they try to schedule major athletics events like Olympic 100m finals around mid-afternoon because it has been shown that this is the most likely time to get records.
 
But this is unimportant for any individual trying to fit exercise into a busy day.
 
Do what you have to.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
I usually train 3 days a week, usually for about 2 hours. I occasionally take a 4th day, especially if I’ve been coaching a lot and so missed some of my own work.
 
Of course, I also walk a bit every day and take a longer walk or bike ride most weeks but I don’t really count that as training.
 
I don’t know anyone who habitually trains more than once a day or more than six days a week although I know some young powerlifters who have tried it for a while. None of them saw a reason to continue with it. I trained every day for a month once when my wife was in a health spa. It didn’t produce any particu

I usually train 3 days a week, usually for about 2 hours. I occasionally take a 4th day, especially if I’ve been coaching a lot and so missed some of my own work.
 
Of course, I also walk a bit every day and take a longer walk or bike ride most weeks but I don’t really count that as training.
 
I don’t know anyone who habitually trains more than once a day or more than six days a week although I know some young powerlifters who have tried it for a while. None of them saw a reason to continue with it. I trained every day for a month once when my wife was in a health spa. It didn’t produce any particularly noteworthy results.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
You mean doing a compound moves every other day.
 
Yes, deadlifts-squats-benchpress are good moves. Every time I am confused what to do in a gym I approach to a squat rack and start lifting heavy.
 
I know this exercise uses every muscle of a body and I could train really fast and equally hit every muscle of the body.
 
It is been recommended also that 60% of your workouts should contain compound lifts and 40% isolation moves. It is good while putting mass because in these you could lift heavy and increase the intensity too.
 
It breaks a plateau.
 
Do it - but do isolation exercises too for building hypertr

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
It depends on your goal, intensity, training experience, and age. You can work out daily if you are taking one or 2 days off for rest and also you are not overtraining or with high intensity. If you are working out with high intensity then you need good rest to recover muscles. As you age your capacity to recover muscles reduce so you have to keep in mind your age .accroding to your age, you should train. If you are beginner then there might be chances that you won't be able to recover quickly as like experience people so you have to start slowly and increase your intensity.
 
Hope my answer help

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I know many people who are less educated than I am, but they are not “ignorant.” All of them know many things that I do not: how to replace a toilet; how to rebuild a transmission; how to play the piano; how to crochet an afghan; how to manage a business, etc. They are good people who work, raise families, and enjoy a multitude of leisure activities.
 
I think it is unfortunate that many people do not know—or care to know—basic history, geography, science, math, literature, music, art, economics, politics, logic, and religion. I am very fortunate that I grew up in a family where knowledge and education were valued.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
I believe that full body fitness every day will lead you to very bad consequences. Everything because our organism is susceptible to such overloads, but it won't continue for so long. As soon as you get older, your organs will become quite weak because they got used to such overloads every day and I'm sure that you won't continue doing full body exercises for 10 years or even less. I guess that you would better separate days by parts of your body. For example one day you are doing legs, another only hands and shoulders and the third day is cardio. As soon as you get older, your organs will become quite weak because they got used to such overloads every day and I'm sure that you won't continue doing full body exercises for 10 years or even less. I guess that you would better separate days by parts of your body. For example one day you are doing legs, another only hands and shoulders and the third day is cardio. In addition, daily exercises also can be harmful if you abuse them.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
Vague question because that depends on so many factors, your age, weight, goals, health and if you have had any prior injuries. The best workout is to get into things you enjoy, then it won’t feel like a chore. Choose a variety of different things to work your entire body. You want to have a balance of cardio, weights for toning and yoga or Pilates for stretching. Always hydrate yourself, and watch your eating regime. 80% of your build comes from your diet. Keep carbs and sugar low, eat low fat protein, complex carbs, low alcohol, stay away from sugary drinks and treat yourself if you have a c
