Vague question because that depends on so many factors, your age, weight, goals, health and if you have had any prior injuries. The best workout is to get into things you enjoy, then it won’t feel like a chore. Choose a variety of different things to work your entire body. You want to have a balance of cardio, weights for toning and yoga or Pilates for stretching. Always hydrate yourself, and watch your eating regime. 80% of your build comes from your diet. Keep carbs and sugar low, eat low fat protein, complex carbs, low alcohol, stay away from sugary drinks and treat yourself if you have a craving. Good luck

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
The first time I visited the USA, from South Africa, I went to a party in Michigan. Everyone I met was pretty impressed that I had come all the way from Africa (I kept mentioning I was from South Africa, because no-one comes from Africa, but rather countries on the continent. )
It was the middle of June and a pretty warm afternoon, so we took a swim in a lake. A pretty girl I had made friends with that day looked at me, waist deep in that cool water, and I’ll never forget the question she asked:
 
“Do you have lakes in Africa?”
 
That was probably the most ignorant thing I’ve ever heard anyone say,

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
I’m poor by first world standards - no job, no real prospects, 20 bucks in my bank account that I have to live on for the next week. If my PC blows up or my car needs work, well… I guess I get to find out if I can live without a PC or a car.
 
But… I DO have a car, I DO have a PC, I have a safe, warm, room to live in, I’m in no danger of starvation or dying of illness due to lack of safe drinking water. So, by relative standards, I’m pretty dang rich.
 
So, I’m rich by global standards and poor by local standards… unfortunately life satisfaction is more closely related to local standards than global

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
The workouts are only as effective as you make them to be in terms of intensity and what your goals are. Also, consider time it takes for recovery. It’s difficult for muscles to become stronger and bigger if they do not have adequate recovery (nutrition/sleep included).
 
The days do not matter on which you train. I’d recommend a M/W/F split for full body if your schedule allows for it.
 
Just for some self-validation, I’ve trained for 8 years (currently 23), won a drug-tested physique competition, trained clients as a personal trainer, and have a bachelors degree in Kinesiology (“exercise science”)
Continue Reading

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
It depends on the person. I lift for an hour to hour and a half every day. No days off. I run 3–6 miles a day, no days off. Work, life, or children will force missed training. The reality is it’s tough to stay disciplined, but the mental state and physical conditioning are rewarding. Some will tell you that it is bad for you. Most of those have never tried to do it. If it’s your passion, go for it. If you start to get injuries, dial it back. I am close to 50 and my piers are suffering from far worse conditions stemmed from a sedimentary life style. Its also nice to out pace skinny guys as a bo

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
That person would have to be me. I once approached a Muslim woman in a store (Super Kmart) who was hidden under a burka from head to toe. I proclaimed, 
“You’re in America now. You have rights. You don’t have to wear that anymore.”
 To my surprise she replied in a South Central Los Angeles African American accent, 
“Don’t be telling me what I can and cannot do. I am a free woman. I know I got rights. This my religion, fool!”
 Of course that was paraphrased but it is close to how I remember it. I then walked away with my tail tucked between my legs.
 
This wasn’t her but she really looked like this.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
My favourite sandwich ingredient is bread, really. Sandwich bread can be thought of as just something to put other stuff between but even if that is all it is doing you still need a bread that can handle the other stuff without getting soggy or falling apart when you try eating it.
 
Bread can be much more though and a good bread can make the sandwich every bit as much as the other ingredients can. You can have chewy breads, crusty breads, flat breads like pitas, rye breads, buns…. all different breads that make all different sandwiches. Ham on rye, hamburger on a bun, toasted cheese on white, et

The first third I'd recommend is to start off with a simple push up routine, and then you can add to that.

You could do four different exercises, designing it so that you're not working the same bo

The first third I'd recommend is to start off with a simple push up routine, and then you can add to that.
 
For a cardiovascular and strength combo, something fun to do is you could create a circuit training routine, where you do :30 of an exercise, then rest for :30 seconds while moving onto the next exercise.
 
You could do four different exercises, designing it so that you're not working the same body part two exercises in a row (easiest way to do this is to alternate between upper and lower body exercises).
 
For an example you could do body squats, then push-ups, then jumping jack's, then a plank.
 
By doing it in this manner you're first doing an upper-body strength and cardio exercise, then an upper body exercise, then a cardiovascular movement, and finally an active rest exer...

Birmingham, Alabama
… I used to do some street magic when I got the time to mingle with the locals and just see their shocked expressions… After showing this coin trick to two 
African-American women
, they asked me:
 “Where are you from?”
 
I replied, (knowing very well they might not have heard of my country) : 
“Nepal!”
 
One of the woman then said: 
“Nepal? Is that down north?”
 
She thought Nepal was in the United States, (I do have an American accent).. but… 
DOWN NORTH
 ????
 
How?… JUST HOW?
 
I just said “
Pretty Close
” and walked away….
Continue Reading

Running for me personally is more challenging and refreshing than lifting weights. 
 
Running gives you a feeling about life. Yo have to keep moving inspite of all the shackles which come in your way, you have to muddle through your minds procrastinations and emotions. 
 
And the best part of Running is that you don't need a buddy , you are on your own wherever and whenever. Be it in the remotest of the country or in the city.
 
Running can get you going when you feel restless. You can run anytime any moment and feel the wind rushing though your body. 
 
Running keeps your thoughts in motion. Negative thoughts disappear with your momentum.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I knew a young lady from Michigan once and she absolutely wanted to visit Belgium because her ancestors had come from there. So I showed her the great cathedral of Antwerp, a magnificent piece of medieval architecture:
Her response:
 
“Our buildings are taller.”
 
She then also wanted to see Paris. So we took her there, the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe, the Louvre… Then suddenly she said:
 
“We've been walking in Paris all day and I still haven't seen a cool guy.”
 
Apparently she had the idea that all Frenchmen were stunning Latin-lover-gigolos and she was disappointed.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
There are some awesome answers here. Very wise words. I'd like to add something very simple though. My time as a personal trainer taught me this.
The best workout in the world. Is the one you wake up excited to do.
I could write you the most scientifically accurate, peer reviewed, emperical workout using years of research and experience. But if your not excited to do it. You wont.
I dont care what it is; gym, rock climbing, running, dine and dashing, 6 days a week chest.
 
Whatever you wake up in the morning excited to do. You will end up doing. And doing it everyday.

Greetings ~
 
One of the best ways to work out is interval training. You will gain more in 15 minutes that if you took a 60-minute jog.
 
The basic instruction is this - start out by warming up - walking - for 2 - 3 minutes to get your heart to begin to elevate a little. Then for 2 - 3 minutes increase the intensity of your activity - begin to jog, jump a rope, pedal, etc.. You should still be able to breathe through your nose and feel comfortable. If you can’t, then the intensity is too high. Then cool down for 2 - 3 minutes (slow your pace to recover your heart rate), then spike your heart rate again by increasing intensity for another 2 - 3 minutes. Continue this cycle for 12 - 15 minutes making sure your last ...

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
Peppered Pastrami.
I don’t mean the MEGA pastrami sandwiches I see on American youtube videos like this
Years and years ago near the 6th form college I went to, there was a small Italian bistro. They did £1.20 pastrami sandwiches, which was actually quite expensive in the 1990s. They’d stick it in hot water to heat it up a little and it would be put in a bread roll.
 
The 10 minute breaks between lectures meant there was enough time to go out cross the road and get a sandwich.
 
I never tasted anything that tasted quite like these sandwiches 25 years later :/

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
The number one is
Mortadella di Bologna! Possiblly cool in a slice of lukewarm genoese Focaccia. The only other ingredient, not necessary, but useful, could be just some salted pistachio cream.
Silver medal goes to Testa in Cassetta (head pudding)
A rich Rosetta or Biova as bread. Eventually a (very scarce, ) dose of Dijon mustard that’s the only other ingredient I could use into it.
 
Bronze medal to a great classic,
 
Roast beel and salsa tonnata (A tuna/caper/anchovy enrichened Mayo)
I would avoid Aregula (I hate it) and I should use just a lettuce leaf.
Continue Reading

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
If you are just starting out, then doing full body workouts is great to build your muscle foundation. But as you get more experienced I would recommend you try to do a bro split (Push, Pull, and legs). So your schedule would be something like this:
 
Monday- Chest, shoulders, and triceps
 
Tuesday -Back, and biceps
 
Wednesday- legs & core
 
Thursday- chest, shoulders, and triceps
 
Friday - back, and biceps
 
Saturday (optional) - legs & core
 
Sunday - Rest
 
*This is just a sample schedule, so you can set yours up how you want to*
 
Good Luck!

title: What are the dirtiest songs you've ever heard?
article:
This song has a long slow build-up, the dirty part comes out of left field so to speak. Very dirty, very obscure, I’m pretty sure no radio station ever played this.
 
It’s called
 “Stickball.” 
I had this single for many years and finally just gave it away to another record collector.
Then there is this, 
“Stevie Nicks Sit On My Face” by 
Fester Swollen And The Rotters.
This was a later release, I have an earlier copy with a plain sleeve. I’ve never been sure if it’s complimentary to 
Stevie Nicks 
or a backlash against her popularity.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
Egg mayo filling is my go-to sandwich ingredient. It's surprisingly easy to make - just mash boiled eggs with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. Some people add chopped herbs or spices for extra flavor.
The taste is amazing - it's creamy, rich, and savory all at once. For many people, egg mayo filling is a nostalgic reminder of childhood sandwiches and happy memories. It's a simple yet satisfying ingredient that pairs well with many other foods. Whether you're making a quick snack or a hearty meal, egg mayo filling is a great choice.

The answer to this question really depends on your fitness goals. Are you trying to lose weight or build more muscle?  Each of these is a good complement to a healthy eating program. Neither one by itself is the right way to lose weight. A balanced diet is the only way that you can shed excess pounds for good.
 
Running every day can increase your cardio and get your respiratory system in better shape, but it is not designed specifically to burn fat and gain muscle mass. Resistance training will burn fat and put more muscle mass on your body, but it won't necessarily cause you to lose pounds.
 
Consider what your fitness goals are and decide...

title: What is a good at home workout routine for intermediate beginners?
article:
Before starting, always keep these in mind -
Never skip meals, especially Breakfast.
Some workout is better than none.
Rest Day is equally important as Leg day.
As for the exercises, keep it a mix. Some popular ones you want to start with are Deadlift, Squats, Pull Ups, Bench press, and of course Dumbbells. About 30% of your workout is recommended Cardio. One final piece of advice :
Now get out of your comfort zone and start your workout. Don’t worry about the results. Eventually you will see them. Stay focussed.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Cheating somewhat, as I haven’t met this person, but they certainly qualify as an ignorant American.
 
An American tourist, on a visit to Windsor Castle inquired: “Why did they build the Castle so close to Heathrow Airport?”
 
Now I don’t expect every tourist to know that many of the grander English castles were built during the High Middle Ages.
 
But I would have expected every single one of them to surmise that a high stone-walled structure designed to keep out invaders predates the age of mass air travel.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
North Sea shrimp salad.
Mix North sea shrimps with mayo, diced hard boiled eggs, salt, pepper. Parsley is optional, forget the tomatoes.
 
Served in a Belgian Pistolet roll. Unbeatable.
 
Runner up:
 
Americain preparé: raw beef mixed with egg yolk, mayo, Worcester sauce, tabasco. Top with diced onions, capers or gurkins. A Belgian classic.

Piadina with mortadella, Stracciatella and pistacchio.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
Start slowly and build up gradually
Give yourself plenty of time to warm up and cool down with easy walking or gentle stretching
Now speed up for 5-10 minutes without getting overly tired.
As your atamina improves gradually increase the amount of time you exercise.
Stay hydrated during exercise.
Optimize your nutrition
Listen to your body, decide your limit of exercise
Stay motivated and making exercise a habit.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
Hi,
 
If you want to see great results and become strong. I would recommend do hard body workout 3–4 per week max.
 
If you want to exercise only to stay healthy or you don’t have any fitness goals right now. I recommend 30–60 mins full body training 5 times a week.
 
I wouldn’t do it everyday to not get overtrained. In full body you use every muscle, so our body has some work to regenerate all these muscles.

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
The ideal time to work out at the gym may depend on your schedule and personal preferences. While evening exercises might reduce tension and perhaps enable you to lift higher weights owing to improved muscular strength later in the day, morning workouts can help you raise your energy and metabolism for the day. Consistency is key, so pick a time that fits into your schedule and works best for you.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
I feel like I say this a lot but, it really depends on your goals.
 
For example, if you are going for muscle hypertrophy(making big muscles), then I would recommend you hit each muscle group twice a week.
 
One body part per day will also have muscle and strength gains; plus it will give plenty of time to recover. It just won’t do it as fast as twice per week and maybe that is okay.
 
With questions like this, my biggest concern is sustainability. I will support whatever keeps people active. Programs can always be tweaked later.
 
There is often more than one right way to do something, exercise is no different.
 
I never do Crossfit. I do Yoga and Pilates only occasionally. All of these do have good results, however. They just don’t fit my goals.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:
You can do it everyday or 3–4–5 times a week.
 
But you should do it differently.
Make more reps or make the exercises more difficult or add more weight.
 
Of course the best scenario could be if you changed your workouts from time to time.
 
Because all exercises, no matter if they are very similar, they are developing different type of muscles.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was in this place:
Oxford University Museum of Natural History · Parks Rd, Oxford OX1 3PW, United Kingdom
★★★★★ · Natural history museum
https://maps.app.goo.gl/3Kco1zmo54vfKepx7
Utterly superb, the whole history of life on earth layed out for ease of understanding, supported by all of the academic rigour of one of the finest research and educational institutions in the world. A day was not enough!

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
Depends what kind of workout you’re doing, and it’s intensity. You can easily do light-to-moderate aerobic work daily, and also a similar level of calisthenic exercises.
 
But if you were doing high-intensity work in either way….. You might run into the problem of overtraining.
 
Likewise doing resistance work. (Weight training). When working with weights, your muscles need rest. Anywhere from 24 to 48 hours for each muscle group involved.
 
Again,”overtraining” is the likely result of too much work. You’ll be continuously sore, feel tired yet have difficulty sleeping, and you’ll find that you’re not making any progress.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Margie BooBoo.
 
Margie just the other day said something written down for her by her handlers.
 
She was supposed to read the word “indictable”.
 
But she didn’t know the word, and read it as “in-dick-ta-ble”. With a short “i” and a hard “c”.
 
She was raging about some Democrat somewhere, whom she wanted to be imprisoned.
 
IN-DICK-TA-BLE!
 
She’s playing the rest of us for fools. She pretends that she’s reading aloud her own words and thoughts, and now we find that she’s just a bag of hot air.
 
And a really dumb bag at that.
 
So she’s in Congress, representing the good people of northwest Georgia. God help them.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I’m in high school, and I just overhead two girls having this debate:
 
Girl 1: What are you talking about? There are countries in Africa.
 
Girl 2: No way. There are only states, It has eight of them.
 
Girl 1: Have you heard of Egypt? Thats a country.
 
Girl 2: But thats in Asia. There are no countries in America, only states, so it’s the same way in Africa.
 
This argument went on and on for around five minutes until they both eventually gave up.
 
It is true that we have had very learned very little geography in school, but I assumed that
 
the fact that there are countries in Africa is common knowledge.

title: Is it good to do weightlifting every day?
article: It depends on the person. I lift for an hour to hour and a half every day. No days off. I run 3–6 miles a day, no days off. Work, life, or children will force missed training. The reality is it’s tough to stay disciplined, but the mental state and physical conditioning are rewarding. Some will tell you that it is bad for you. Most of those have never tried to do it. If it’s your passion, go for it. If you start to get injuries, dial it back. I am close to 50 and my piers are suffering from far worse conditions stemmed from a sedimentary life style. Its also nice to out pace skinny guys as a bodybuilder.

title: How to workout
article:
Stop being lazy
 
!
 
That is the first step towards fitness. Get out of your comfort zone.
Next time you are about to procrastinate, tell yourself that I’ll have to do this stuff later on anyways, why not finish it up here itself.
Go for a walk everyday after lunch - even if its a mere 5 minute walk.
Give the escalators/elevators a miss whenever you can.
Decide what time are you going to get up tomorrow and the next morning, try getting up at that exact time.
The main battle is to overcome this lazy attitude. What shows in the gym or on the running track is merely the reflection of mental activeness.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Over training comes to mind.
 
Although many martial artists might train every body part daily, or boot camp and circuit type trainers, it honestly is over whelming.
 
I tried keeping up with the simplest exercise video that was hitting everything and super sets. I was already very sore from training all week, and could not even complete the second half.
 
So definatly you need to listen to your body.
 
Unless you're on a ton of steroids, forget about it.
 
The only exception would be one set per muscle group, but most people only do a circuit of they've been slacking in the gym..
 
Hope this helps!

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Does someone my mum met count?
 
Anyway, my mum and her sister wanted to eat out- they were in Chicago at that time, around 1994, I think? At the restaurant, some dude was sitting on the table next to them.
 
So, my mum was chatting casually with her sister in our traditional language when the man walked up to them. “Excuse me. Are you from Africa?” He said, quite politely.
 
They both nodded, so he continued. “Is it true you live in trees?”
 
My mum had stared at him for a moment before replying with a kind smile, “We also cook on stones.”
 
Unfortunately, he didn't realize she was being sarcastic.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My counselor from camp was British. While she was working in America, she went to Disney. When she was waiting on line for a ride, some tourists heard her British accent and turned around to talk to her.
 
“Hey, are you British?!” They asked, amazed.
 
“Yeah, I am,” she replied.
 
“Do you know Paul?!”
 
“Paul?”
 
“Yeah, our friend Paul. He's from there too!”
 
These people thought that England was so small that everyone knew each other.
 
To this day, thinking of that story makes me laugh- these people couldn't comprehend that there was a nation outside of America that was bigger than a city-state!

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?

Sleept on airbags on the floor for the longest time and wore borrowed and donated clothes while sharing food with kind souls while interacting with marketing geniuses.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

Once we were talking about America (REAL NAME FOR THIS CONTINENT, NOT THE UNITED STATES) and one of them was pretty sure the Dominican Republic was part of the land of the US, not a Central American island with Haiti on the other side.
 
At the moment seemed like a big discovery for this person then we made fun of it.
 
That was a case of ignorance, but they were great people. Hope to see them soon again.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was in a business meeting with a couple of reps from the legal department. I thought we were getting along well except that at the end of the meeting they suddenly asked me how I got to the United States.
 
“Excuse me?” I asked, confused.
 
“Like how do you get from city to city then to here?”
 
“We have cars, boats, ferries, planes….”
 
“Oh you have planes?”
 
“Yes….”
 
They seemed genuinely shocked. To be fair they must have heard I come from an island (Cebu). However it is one that is big enough to have several cities, a functional public transportation system, and an international airport.

title: What is the best workout for me?
article:
Hey,
 
In order to better understand what exercises you can do and should do you need to understand and know a couple of things beforehand
:
What is your goal.
What is your current physical activity.
What is your physical strength level.
Do you have / had any underlaying health problems.
Do you have / had any injuries.
Do you have any preferences on how and where you want to train.
How much time you can spare for exercising.
And there’s a couple of more things you need to clarify. But this is a good starting point. Find the answers to those and you can start figuring it out step by step.
 
Miro

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
The best routine for exercising depends on your individual fitness goals and preferences. However, a well-rounded routine should typically include a combination of cardiovascular exercise, strength training, and flexibility/mobility work.
 
As for the routine when you go to the gym start with warmup and stretching of the muscles then perform strength training for 90 min and then if you have some stamina do 10–15 min sprinting as it will increase the rate of fat burned because after doing exercise your body will be depleted from energy and of course diet and sleep play a major role in all of it.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

Target employee, spotting my foreign credit card: “Where y’all from?”
 
Me, not realising ‘y’all’ can be used in the singular: “Oh, I’m from Scotland, just here for a couple of weeks”
 
Target employee: <scrunches face up to think>
 
Target employee: “Oh, yeah! That’s the place in Canada, right?”
 
I didn’t have the heart to correct him, I just had to exit without exploding into laughter…

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
You can do a full-body workout two days in a row once your body has grown accustomed to it. Train on alternating days at first to build up your stamina and improve your tolerance for heavy workouts. Stick to a routine, and you should be able to work up to full-body exercises on back-to-back days.
 
While a full-body workout training split has its advantages, it's best not to do it every day. It's important that your muscles have adequate rest and recovery time to prevent overtraining. So, if you prefer a full-body workout training split, keep it to 2-3 workouts per week for the best results.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: After a long night of work, covering the liquor bar, because my regular bartender called out sick, I counted up my tips (which I usually didn’t receive as the manager). I decided to hit taco bell on the way home and get rid of some of the small bills I had received. In particular the $10 in $2 bills. When I went to pay at the drive thru, the cashier explained to me that $2 bills didn’t exist, and that they were fake. I pointed out that she was wrong, and asked her to get her manager. The manager proceeded to argue with me that they were fake money, gave it back, and gave me my meal for free.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

My ex-girlfriend was from Hong-Kong. At one point, I introduced her to a good friend of mine.
 
“Hey James, this is Jennifer.” I said, introducing them.
 
“Hi, Jennifer.” Said James, and he shook her hand.
 
“Where are you from?” He asked, as they shook hands.
 
“I’m from Hong Kong, actually.” Jennifer replied with a lovely posh English accent.
 
“Oh, so you’re Korean.” James said.
 
I sighed, Jennifer immediately began to laugh because, James wasn’t joking. He literally had no idea what the difference was.

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
Beginners as well as more advanced fitness levels will see the biggest benefits if they work out three to four times a week. The main thing is that you schedule a rest day between the different sessions. You should take at least one day off after two consecutive days of strength training.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Oh many many…
 
But some years back I went on a first date. After dinner, we were parked, looking at the stars, my arm around her shoulder. The conversation gradually disclosed the astounding fact that she thought scientists and technicians in white lab coats with computers and clipboards devoted themselves solely to the arduous task of counting as high as they possibly could.
 
Just counting!
 
“Have they been able to count to a billion yet?” she asked me—her blonde hair shining in the moonlight. Flummoxed…I knew I would regret any possible relationship this led to, and took her home.
 
.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I’m an Air Force brat. I grew up on Air Force bases surrounded by people from all over the country. Consequently, my speaking voice tends to have a neutral accent.
 
One day, I was talking with a woman somewhere in Washington, DC. After several minutes of conversation, she asked me where I was from. Since I’ve lived in so many places, the answer becomes complicated, so I usually answer with where I was born. I told her I was from New Mexico.
 
“ReallY? How long have you lived here in the United States? You speak colloquial English so well, I never would have thought you were a foreigner!”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

She constantly needs to tell us how we need to feel bad for our colonial past, how some of our celebretions are racist and sees discrimition in anything. She told me that we as White men are alle guilty for all bad things that ever happen to colored People, women, gays etc. As if I was personally capturing slaves or something like that. Now Trump is her president she is a fulltime protester here in a country that has nothing to do with any of that. We were in line, waiting for our group to get in. A fathers conversation with his children caught my attention.
Father to Son - Son, we are New Yorkers and we hate tourists.
His son seemed hardly over the age of 6. I wasn't offended but I felt at that point that love would be something that I would need to make a conscious effort to teach my children.

She replied “Well since it only has 50 stars on it, I’ll sell it to you at a discount.” No she wasn’t joking. She truly thought our current flag had 53 stars. title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
If you are doing the right things, you should start seeing good shape in your muscles and the beginning of weight loss (if you are overweight) in about 3 months. Getting puffy muscles and gaining body mass will depend largely on your food intake - quality, quantity and timing. Again - if all goes in the right direction you should start seeing the ‘athletic’ body in about 6 months or so.
 
Having said that, even if you don’t start looking like what you have been dreaming of continue to exercise - a mix of weight-training and cardio. That will keep benefiting you in the long run anyways.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article: I’m sure that there are poor people on Quora. One of the intrinsic beauties of Quora is its accessibility and inclusiveness. Anyone with access to a computer and the internet can use Quora. Sites like Quora are at the forefront of an evolutionary change in human society. The easy access to information, opinions, and advice that we are enjoying now has never happened before in human history. (At least as far as we know. Who knows? The Mayans may have had a very sophisticated information technology.) It is inconceivable to me that this won’t have a profound impact on human civilization.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
The best home workout program is one you develop yourself. Get inspired and create something that works for you.
 
For me, resistance bands and two adjustable dumbbells are enough to shape my body.
 
Besides working out at home twice a week, I meditate; I use my bike regularly to commute to work and back and go out in the forest for fresh air at the weekend. I would never exchange this program for anything in the world.
 
I don’t want to impress anyone but myself. I want to have an aesthetic body but not at the expense of my health.
 
Use your creativity and you will be happy you did.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
In working out a day, it shouldn’t take you more than 1hour for low-intensity workouts. Also, For high-intensity workouts, you shouldn’t take more than 30minutes.
 
The reason is that when you take longer than necessary time to workout hoping to get more achievement from it, it backfires because instead of your body releasing HGH hormones, the workout forces your body to perceives stress.
 
Then your adrenal glands make and release the hormone cortisol into your bloodstream. It is often called the “stress hormone,” and cortisol causes an increase in your heart rate and blood pressure.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

“This guy is taking me to Disneyland but is only paying for one hotel room for us to stay in. I’m uncomfortable with it, but my mom said I had to, because of all the presents he’s given me.”

article:
It depends on what your going for and how long you have. If you want a full body workout for health and fitness and have between 1–2 hours every day, I would incorporate squats, bench, deadlift, dumbbell rows, curls, skull crushers, dips, pull ups, bent over rows, lunges, calf raises, shoulder press, shoulder raises, leg lifts, crunches, plank, and any cardio into your regimen. Don’t workout the same muscle group within a 48 hour time span and listen to your body. AthleanX is a great YouTube channel that has a bunch of awesome workout regimens with reps and weight.
 
Hope this helped

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

Another thought they speak Austrian in Austria. Vienna is in Virginia, by the way.
A vice president thought they speak Latin in Latin America.
I don’t mean to imply that we are only ignorant at Geography, although I would argue that it is where we most stand out.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I worked with this young woman and one day we were discussing the Pacific Northwest. I was stating that my parents lived in Washington state, and that that whole area was one of my favorite places in the world. She asked if I meant Washington DC and I said no, that’s in the eastern United States. Washington state is on the north West Coast. Up until that moment she did not know that the US included Washington state AND Washington DC. I don’t know how she graduated high school.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
This incident happened around Christmas while I was working in Mississippi for a short time.
 
I was returning home from work and I was walking back to my apartment. I had just parked my car (that still carried the license plate from NY). An old American lady, who was walking her dog, noticed my license plate and asked me -
 
“Are you from New York? “
 
“Yes, I am.” I replied.
 
“Do they celebrate Christmas in New York ?” she asked me.
 
I paused for a moment but then replied - “Oh yeah, they do!”
 
Now, I am not sure if that qualifies as being ignorant but to me it was - ‘Woah’!

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
was the tour Director of a Group of retired Alabaman school teacher s. We went to Bingen on the Rhine River. Our German local guide gave us a Tour and i translated. It was a history of Cistercians, Benedictines and Franciscans brothers and nuns and Priests. Since 8th century, it had been occupied.
 
At the end, the local fellow left. One guest asked „Now MAry? !!! Who were these people called Benedictines and so on? „
 
I tried to answer but they were disturbed to find out that they had all been Catholic.
 
„Well, were they saved?“ they asked.
 
„Oh yes!“.
 
So much for teachers!

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: Something written in an answer to an unrelated question triggered this memory. When I was about 7 years old, back in the olden days, we lived in the country. I was pushing my baby sister up and down the driveway in the buggy (yes, a buggy). At one point, I was bothered by bees buzzing past my ear. I took my sister into the house. A few days later, my parents called the county sheriff because they had found bullet holes in their bedroom wall (one went clean through). Not sure, but those “buzzing bees” that were zinging past my ear probably would have packed a more powerful sting.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
When I was living in Scotland I worked in a hotel in the highlands. On more occasions than I cared to count, I was asked by American tourists what part of England I was from.
 
I’m from Australia.
 
My instant reply was always “What part of Canada are you from?”
 
Some of them would roll their eyes at my ignorance and say, “I’m AMERICAN, not CANADIAN. There’s a very big difference you know!” Others would look at me, mouth agape, clearly affronted, “I am NOT Canadian. Hmph.”
 
At this point I always smiled and said “And I’m not English, I’m Australian. Can I take your order now?”

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
Hi Brad,
 
I can't say for definite which way is better. I have tried both and I found both to be effective.
 
Even today, most of my workout is focused on the morning where I put in an average of 45 min to an hour. Some days, I get a window to go for walks or do short sprints in the evening and I go for it.
 
What really matters here is consistency. Do you have the time and discipline to do 2 sessions of 30 min in a day? Then go for it. But if you are pressed for time, then select the time of day which works best for you and schedule your exercise accordingly.
 
Cheers
 
Rajiv

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Ignorance is not the same as stupidity but…
 
Working in a hotel and over breakfast (around 8a.m. ) an American asked for directions to Tintagel (in Cornwall) as he wanted to see the birthplace of King Arthur! He planned on driving there after breakfast “but would be back that evening for dinner"! The hotel was in Glasgow! Only about 500 miles each way! He didn't believe me (I “was just a waiter") so said he would ask someone who knew better! Apparently he did set off (according to the duty porter) but I never saw him again as I was on early shift that week. Maybe he got there.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Pros,
 
You’ll get a lot of weekly volume (the number of hard sets you do). You’ll also get good at a certain amount of exercises. For example, the starting strength workout routine has you squat for 3 sets, bench press or overhead press for 3 sets and then deadlift for 1 set.
 
This approach really helps you get good at the compound exercises.
 
Cons,
 
If you want to target a specific body part from many different angles with different exercises a full-body workout will make it harder to do this.
 
And you’d probably be better off with a more traditional bodybuilding split.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: There was one boy in my bio class, let’s call him R. At the start of the year, the teacher had instructed as to perform a simple lab testing the presence of glucose, lipids, and proteins in solutions. One of the solutions was a control, so their was only water in it. I was paired with R in the lab, and while I was setting up the chemicals we are going to use, I asked if R would do me a favor and fetch me the solutions. At that point, R proudly declared: “ I am sorry but I can’t, for I am allergic to glucose, lipids, proteins and water.” How did that kid even survive till now?

Just go get after it. Go train.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: I was at an event for high school students at MIT, so you’d expect that only some pretty smart kids would sign up right? Well I’m sure these kids were plenty good at whatever their area of expertise is, but their complete lack of knowledge on history was astounding. In a classroom filled with high school students, not a single team could get the order of the first four presidents right. My team lost because someone on my team answered without consulting the rest of us that Abraham Lincoln was the second president, and that FDR was the fourth. Not a single team could do it.

Soooo I was there at my little desk on a Saturday morning when a girl I had talked to came in screaming at me and calling me every bad thing she could think of because she got birth control pills and she put that damn pill “up there” every day and 5 months later she's pregnant anyway. Ooooook then. I didn't realize I had to explain what ORAL meant so she didn't actually swallow it … well there ya go.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My brother.
 
Last night, I was talking to him about earth science. Now, my brother is in 6th grade so he recently learned about the supercontinent Pangaea.
 
He then asked me about why dinosaurs were extinct. As I patiently explained the cause of their extinction, my brother interrupted and said,
 
"I thought they only lived in America."
 
I laughed and told him that they lived throughout the supercontinent. He disagreed and claimed that dinosaur bones had been only found in the US.
 
Although I was internally amused, I showed him some websites which disproved his claims.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: When I was a teenager, 13 or so, I was seated separately from my family on an airplane. This was the first time I’d ever been separated from my family while travelling. A very kind woman from Georgia was sitting next to me. She asked where I was from. I said from Utah. She’d never heard of it. She’d never even HEARD of one of the 50 states and she was from America. Now this was like 2003 or so. It wasn’t that long after the Olympics had been held in Salt Lake City. I tried describing its location on the map and referencing the Salt Lake Olympics. Nothing. I had to give up.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
The most ignorant American I have ever met is a man who once worked with my Vietnamese husband, who actually believed that the refugees who poured into the United States and Europe during the 1970’s were Northern Vietnamese Communists, aka “Viet Cong.”
 
As a war veteran, this guy believed it was his right and duty to harass, verbally abuse, and basically make my husband’s already difficult life a living hell. What made it especially awful is that my husband had an uncle who spent 16 years in a “re-education camp” for working directly with American soldiers during the war.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I also had a friend who was a diplomat’s son from the USA.
 
One day, my Philippino friends were discussing a mass attack between compounds of their Grandmas, and the death toll.
 
I said: “Thats absurd. That disgusting”.
 
And my ex-pat USA friend defended my Philippino friends disinterest in the futile loss of life…

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

I was flabbergasted.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
If you have access to free weights, these three barbell exercises are the best for building your full body:
Chest Press (with a slight incline)  for chest muscles, a bit of shoulders,  and triceps 
Barbell Deadlift for lower body, traps, and lower back
Barbell Rows for back and a bit of biceps
You can check out these three exercises in this 1 min video:
If you have access to just your body weight, then I would say these three exercises would be the best:
 
Burpee: full body 
 
Jumping Lunges: Lower Body Focus 
 
Pullup : pull muscles training 
 
Hopefully this helps :-)

title: How to workout
article:
Something you can tolerate doing every day.
 
Consistency is important for good health habits to work, so consider what routine you could realistically and reliably commit to (say) every day for the next month or so. Don’t be heroic. You’re just trying to establish a habit. You can add to it later, but initially, select something that you can get through in 10 minutes or less.
 
(If you habitually start the day with a cup of coffee or tea, you can build on that existing habit by exercising while you’re waiting for the water to boil. That’s 5 minutes. You can do this.)

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was traveling and overheard a conversation between an American and another traveller.
 
American: “Where are you from?”
 
Traveller: “Zambia.”
 
American: “Oh, you’re from Africa”.
 
Traveller: “Well, Zambia is on the Africa continent.”
 
American: “Yeah, but you being from Zambia is like me being from California.”
 
Traveller: “No, my being from Zambia is like you being from the US.”
 
Because America and Canada (moi!) are such large countries in terms of geography, it is sometimes hard to wrap our heads around equal populations fitting into fractions of the space.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Whilst travelling in Mexico an American tourist complimented me on my good English language skills, to which I thanked her and told her I was from the UK. 
She said “oh, the UK! Do you learn English there?”
I thought she was joking so laughed and just said “of course” to which she replied “but British is your first language right?”
 
Whilst on the same trip, actually on the same tour bus, a different American asked me where I was from. This time I said England so that they’d not have the confusion over English again, to which he replied “oh is that near New Zealand?”.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

In 9th grade (‘75) girl asked me what is it like to; live in a small town?; live in an igloo?; ride a dogsled?
 
Golfing in about 2000 I went to a local golf course and went to the snack bar to buy a pack of cigarettes for $2.50, gave the girl (probably 15–18 yrs. old) a $5 bill and she had to talk to her mother to figure out how much change to hand me back. I always said I would go back and marry that girl since I could have handed her a $10, told her it was a $100 and she probably wouldn’t have known the difference.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: I was in New York City one day, and a New Yorker picked up from my accent that I wasn’t an American. Further along into the conversation, he picked up an avocado and told me it was a mango (we were in a fruit shop). Maybe he was just pulling my leg, but it certainly seemed that he truly believed that a mango was the fruit with the black skin, green flesh, and big seed in the middle. He seemed very confident about his judgement, because (as he put it) “America is number one”, and therefore his judgement about what was a mango and what was an avocado should be followed.

Life fucking sucks sometimes, but what can you do? Keep on keeping on.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Dear Marco,
 
If you do “only” 200 push ups a day, you are doing a lot of pushups. Given that your goal is a bigger chest, pushups certainly will contribute to your reaching that goal. It is my opinion, however, that working out every other day and including a variety of chest-related lifts would better serve your purposes.
 
As to how long it would take to build your chest there are too many unknown important pieces of info, plus, the answer would be different for each individual; your “how long” question is unanswerable. Best of luck to you.
 
Truly yours,
 
Kela

title: How to workout
article:
ALWAYS warm up – 5-10 minutes on a bike, rowing machine, jumping jacks, run up and down your stairs, etc. Get the blood flowing and your muscles warm. Pick one exercise for each big muscle group – quads, butt and hamstrings, push, pull, and core. Do 3-5 sets for each exercise
Cardiovascular activity. Start by doing an aerobic activity, like walking or running, for a sustained 20-30 minutes, four to five times a week, says Bryant. ...

title: How workout exercises?
article: I am not sure what you mean by healthy workouts. All workouts can be healthy if you do them right and in the right amount for your goals and capabilities. Too much of anything can be harmful, and too little might not be effective. What you want to do and what you hope to accomplish, will dictate what sort of activity, in what way and how much of it would be healthy for you. So you really need to be more specific. But generaly working out is healthy, as long as you enjoy it, do it regularly, maybe working towards a specific goal, you don’t get injured and so on.

title: What is a good at home workout routine for intermediate beginners?
article:
There are many, and which is best depends upon the person and his goals.
 
But if you’re not doing anything, right now, might I suggest that you start with the Royal Canadian Air Force’s 
5BX 
program.
 
It’s simple, easy, takes no equipment, little space, and only a modest amount of time.
 
I’m certain it’s not what you’ll want to keep going with, for any length of time. But until you find something that suits you better, while you’re sitting on the couch deciding what to do, get up off the couch and do the 5BX.

title: How to workout
article:
This time last year, I was 205lbs. In two months, I lost close to 30lbs. Over the past year, I have hovered around 170lbs but have been slowly replacing fat with muscle. But last year, I looked in the mirror and decided that a year from then I would be fit again.
 
I started by working out 5 days a week. Then I started biking 6 days a week as well. I then started taking my diet serious. These last couple weeks I’ve been trying a free plan on bodybuilding.com. Chris Gethin’s 12 Week Muscle Builder.
 
I wake up everyday more physically fit than the day before.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article: Working out at home can help you a lot. It is one of the best and cheapest ways to stay active and many exercises can actually be done without requiring basic gym equipment. You can start with doing some yoga to stretch your body. That followed with some sit ups and crunches. Try and rest your muscles alternatively so that you give enough time to recover from the set. You can also include push ups and slowly and steadily by the day increase the strain on your muscles. Just remember, do not exert yourself more than what you can take as it can cause injuries.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was in America for a conference and I went to a grocery store to buy a pack of cigarettes. The cashier asked me for ID and I duly handed over my driver licence. Seeing it was from New South Wales, she asked me where that was. Fair enough. I told her it was in Australia. Then she said “I've never heard of the state Australia, whereabouts is it?”
 
I looked at her askance and told her it was a country in the Southern Hemisphere. She replied that she hadn't heard of the Southern Hemisphere, at which point I just shrugged and hoped the conversation would end.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
Hi Nigella - Thanks for reaching out! 
 
The short answer is 'no.' Doing the same thing every day is only going to cause you to plateau. Instead, change things up! So, for example, run one day, lift weights the next, do yoga the next and kickboxing the next. By keeping your body guessing, you'll avoid plateaus and continue to make gains week-in and week-out.
 
Hope this helps! If you have any further questions, feel free to email me at the address below.
 
--
 
Peter Weintraub | Permanent Weight Loss Expert at Fitness Retriever | peter@fitnessretriever.com

title: How to workout
article: Try the fitness program T25, and eat the right and healthy diet. Low carb, high fat and protein, and a lot of vegetables. Sleeping right is also a biggy. Go to sleep no later than 22:30, and wake up no earlier than 6:30. A great thing to do to get fit, is to just randomly play sports at various times of the weak. Avoid alcohol as much as possible. Smoking is OK, but bad for your lungs, and can cause cancer in both your lungs and your mouth. Swimming is also a great way to work on your whole body, but if your working out with the T25, it might be too much.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

Without groceries, I would starve.
 
My car runs on gasoline and magic. Put gas in the tank, turn the key and it magically moves about.

DataGrip is a powerful SQL tool, but whether it’s the best for you will depend on your tasks.
 
If you only work with one database, then that database’s native client may be the best option, especially if admin features are important to you.
 
DataGrip’s code assistance is top-notch, but as a side effect it can be slow for very large databases. It is, however, getting faster all the time, as speed is a priority for the product development team.
 
DataGrip isn’t free, but there is 
a one-month free trial
 so you can determine how well it meets your needs.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
Interesting how many answers don’t account for metabolic conditioning of any kind. Safely practicing these three movements will make you capable across all fitness parameters (strength, power, endurance, stamina, flexibility, speed, coordination, agility, balance, accuracy).
Rowing machine sprints (full body resistance training coupled with high intensity cardio)
Barbell Front Squats (leg and core strength)
Barbell Snatch (full body explosive strength; requires advanced coordination, balance, and flexibility; highly technical so you'll never get bored)

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

The Boston Tea Party came up and I kid you not one student said, “I thought Boston was a state and Massachusetts was the town in England Puritans came from.”
 
The teacher had no words, bless his heart. He calmly corrected the student as he stifled his chuckling.
 
This kid went on to become a cop in the same town as my high school. Which, even 10 years after graduating, is a source of humor for me.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article: In my opinion the best way is to design a workout timetable to fit around the ordinary things you do in a day, watch videos and learn different exercises. Make sure to think about what body parts you want to focus on for example (abs) you’d be doing planks/crunches etc. Dedicate a space where you want to get in shape and listen to something you enjoy to keep you motivated. Create goals for yourself and have good strategies to work your way in achieving it, consistently taking small steps will build up and hopefully you will get in shape! Good luck!

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
Morning workout and evening workout, both have its own pros and cons.
 
Morning workout can boost your metabolism and help you freshen up for the rest of the day to yourself. However many people face the challenge of working out.
 
Whereas, by evening, we have eaten food and have the energy to workout and push ourselves further. The challenge most people face here is to be able to get their work done and accommodate the workout time in their schedule late.
 
“At the end of the day, all that matters is, you had a workout be it morning or evening”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

He asked me where I was from. I told him that I am an Indian. To that, he said “Hi Chief” and he was not joking. I thought that it was a height of ignorance and funny as well.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
Depends on what your definition of “ Better ” is. If being a better runner is your goal, then sure, running is the way to go. If you want to have overall fitness then your best bet is a mixture of cardio ( running or some other exercise like biking ) and weight training. If you want to get stronger, then more weight training with some cardio thrown in is your best bet.
 
It all depends on what your fitness goals are. Just running will build up a certain kind of endurance and stamina but so will weight training. A mix of both is probably best.

title: What is the best workout for me?
article:
Barbell strength training, via Mark Rippetoe's Starting Strength program. It's very effective. In fact i don't think it would be possible to create a more effective program for just getting stronger.
 
I also do hill sprints for conditioning, twice a week at 80% effort on a 30 degree incline, for 15 - 20 seconds, with 40-45 seconds rest. 10 rounds each session. It's effective in that it's improved my overall stamina drastically, while maintaining muscle mass, and it doesn't make me sore (jogging destroys muscle mass and makes me very sore).

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was in a store some years back, buying foam rubber to make cushions for my couch. I found the type I wanted and said to the girl behind the counter, “I want two yards, please.”
 
Her response? “I can’t sell it to you by the yard. I can only sell it by the foot.”
 
Not realizing the problem, I repeated myself. “Just give me two yards.” She opened her mouth to reply, I looked at the expression on her face and said, “OK. give me six feet.”
 
On the way home in the car, I ranted about the American education system for a solid fifteen minutes.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article: A good workout routine at home should include a mix of cardiovascular exercises, strength training, and flexibility exercises. Examples of home workouts include bodyweight exercises like push-ups, squats, lunges, and planks, as well as cardio activities like jumping jacks, burpees, and jump rope. Incorporate resistance bands or dumbbells for added intensity. Aim for at least 30 minutes of exercise most days of the week and gradually increase intensity as you progress. Explore my Quora Profile for more home workout ideas and fitness tips.

title: How to workout
article:
I'm going to assume you are referring to a full body, strength training workout. As a general rule, start with the largest muscle groups and work your way to the smaller. This is so you will be training the most taxing muscle groups when you are freshest. Also, if you train biceps before back for example, your arms will be too fatigued to properly work your much larger back muscles. Larger to smaller. So a full body workout will be arranged like this:
 
Legs
 
Back
 
Chest
 
Shoulders
 
Triceps
 
Biceps
 
Core
 
Calves
 
Hope this helps.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
3–5 days a week is standard. You can train up to 6 days a week. The easiest way to split up your training would be Push, Pull, Legs. Day 1 all push exercises (chest, shoulders, triceps. Day 2 rest. Day 3 all pull exercises (back, biceps) Day 4 rest. Day 5 Legs.
 
Or go 3 days in a row with that routine. Take a day off then do the same thing again. That way you’ll hit every muscle group twice a week. I usually add core on push and pull days. Your key to success isn’t how much you train, but HOW you train! Consistency + Intensity = Results

title: What is a good weekly workout?
article: The best weekly workout plan is balanced and includes a mix of cardiovascular exercise (like running, cycling, or swimming), strength training (using weights or bodyweight exercises), flexibility exercises (like yoga or stretching), and rest days for recovery. Ideally, aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous activity per week, along with strength training exercises for all major muscle groups at least twice a week. Remember, the best plan is one that fits your personal fitness level and goals.

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
Go at a different time.
Be flexible with what you're doing (this requires more knowledge of working out). 
Ask to work in. 
Number 2 is my personal favorite. 
 
If someone is on a flat bench press, I might do incline. If the benches are taken, I'll look for cable presses or flye machines. If those are taken, I might do dips or pushups. 
 
By doing this, not only do I get my workout in faster, but I'll also be forced to mix up my routine and enact muscle confusion without even trying. 
 
That's how I turn a negative into a positive.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
That depends on three things:
 
1.) What state your body currently is at
 
2.) What state you’d like to be
 
3.) What you’re willing to do (time, energy, money, etc) to achieve those goals
 
How strong are you? How old are you? What ailments are you currently facing? What sports do you want to play? How strong do you want to be? What’s your body-fat percentage? What do you want to look like?
 
There’s absolutely no ONE BEST WORKOUT. There’s millions of good ways to do it, which is best for you depends on the above three questions.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
I can think of a few things that might happen :
You could get shoulder or elbow inflammation because of overuse and especially if you’re doing heavy weight each time you perform bench pressing.
You might not allow your muscle to recover from the tear down and not see any gains and as stated above could do yourself more harm.
Assuming you controlled the weight amd reps maybe you could do it if you did maybe a set of 20 a day with lighter weight .
You should consider these possibilities and take care not to overdo it.
 
Respectfully

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article: Yes. There are 1.2B people in the world who live on less than $1.50 per day. Given the number of people openly begging for money on Quora, it would seem a lot higher. Most truly poor people do not have computers or internet access, so they would of course not be on Quora. The “working poor” with jobs and some money do appear to be on Quora. title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
In the morning we produce more testosterone, so working out in the early hours before breakfast will boost up your testosterone even more. Testosterone in metabolic hormone, it builds muscle, burns fat. It’s considered to be more efficient to workout around 7–8 am.
 
Evening is a time when we produce cortisol. Its a hormone that breaks down muscle and store fat. Its also responsible for lack of sleep. Scientists thinks evenings are not good.
 
However you should listen to your body and look how it responds to different routines.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

I was utterly confused (evident by my expression), to which she responded by repeating herself loudly and pausing after each word (I’m Indian so she probably assumed I didn't speak much English) “DID. YOU. RIDE. A. CAMEL. TO. SCHOOL?”
 
BIGGEST face palm moment of my life.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:

If you're just starting out, fitness classes are a great place. From Zumba to CrossFit to Body Pump or Yoga, it's a supervised, directed area.
 
If you're interested in weight training, really just ask someone that looks how you want to look "What do you do?" Gyms can be awkward, but almost everyone loves to talk about their workout.

title: Is it good to do weightlifting every day?
article: No, it is generally not recommended to do weightlifting every day. Muscles need time to rest and recover between weightlifting sessions in order to grow and become stronger. Typical recommendations are to allow 1-2 days of rest between strength training sessions for the same muscle groups. Doing weightlifting every day can lead to overtraining, increased risk of injury, and plateaus in strength gains. A well-designed weightlifting program incorporates planned rest and recovery days to allow the body to adapt and improve.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

Within a few minutes I heard the slow, drawl of a man’s voice, “Thelma Lynn, come look at the name of this seed.” Yup, it was the jar of Niger seed, and I know exactly what he was thinking. Idiot.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
If you are looking forward to working out to make changes to your body (gaining muscles, losing fat…) it doesn’t make a lot of sense.
 
Your muscles will not be able to recover properly, which results in them not growing (or even getting weaker and smaller).
 
You should give your muscles a pause of 48 hours before exercising again.
 
This means that you can exercise two different muscle groups the day after, but you shouldn’t exercise twice a day, as your whole body will still not be recovered.
 
I hope this helps :)

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Results is a subjective term, but in my experience, you will at least feel results in about 2–3 weeks, and have noticeable improvement and gains in about 3 months.
 
Everyone’s genetics and workouts are different so your results and timing will vary.
 
My friendly piece of advice: make it a lifestyle choice to exercise, rather than using it as a one time or quick fix. Be consistent and make it a sustainable lifelong endeavor. At almost 60 year old, I will attest to its amazing benefits both physically and cognitively.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
I usually find a program and stick to it for 3 months before I move on to another program. But almost all the time I workout 5 times a week.
 
The current program I am following looks like this
 
Chest, Legs, Arms, Rest, Back, Shoulders, Rest with about 20–30 min of cardio before lifting based on the body part I am working that day with 30 min cardio on shoulders and arms days and 20 or 25 min on the other days. My current program has has about 6–7 different exercises on each day and rep ranges are in the 10–15 range.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
No one seems to have really answered the question.
 
Pros:
It helps you keep consistent.
You will build mental toughness, by having to do the same thing everyday.
Cons:
Not necessary to build a strong core. You could be doing better things with your time (like reading about more efficient ways to train :-) )
No recovery time. Treat abs the same as any other muscle group, by progressively overloading them, and you will get one hell of a strong core.
Not gonna help you actually see your abs (only diet is gonna do that!)

title: Do you workout?
article: I’m going to spare you the language joke that’s been made many times, and say that I definitely do go to the gym. While it is cheaper to work out at home or outside, the routines I can do on weight machines at a gym are far more beneficial to me than anything I’ve been able to do on my own. I like the benefits of being able to explore different classes and try new kinds of workouts. My gym also has a pretty great community of people who exercise around the same time, and it’s nice to have people hold me accountable.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article: Basically, laborers work out all day long. Depending on the kind of labor, just like the kind of workout, they will have varying amounts of strength and muscular endurance. Eventually, you would adapt. You would be tired at the end of the day and would accumulate fatigue over the week if you worked out every day, but you would eventually recover more quickly, maybe in a day or two. You would become strong and be able to work harder longer, but you would not likely develop your potential peak strength or hypertrophy.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
This is an entirely opinion based question, so don't expect any quality answers.
 
Running is cardio intensive, you're not going to get muscular, and you're more than likely going to run just about everyday. The gym is more for strength and size gains. You also don't exactly go to the gym everyday. You technically can, but you either have to work up to it for years or program it decreases in workload to keep your body from breaking down. 
 
Both take discipline and hard work.
 
Go with what matches your goal.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article: I do whatever I enjoy doing. When I do that I keep exercising and that's more important than anything else at my age. In the morning I jump for 15 minutes on a mini-trampoline. Mid-morning or early afternoon I do a 7 Minute Workout per an app on my cell phone. On Tuesdays and Thursdays I do yoga and lifting. title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Don't train your arms every day of you want to gain muscle. It won't work, give them 48–72 hours of recovery between concentrated training sessions.
Assuming you follow this advice, the timeline is still longer than most people like to hear. It takes about 1" of girth to visibly notice a change in size, which is ~10 lbs you need to gain. Assuming you can gain 2 lbs a month (meaning you're doing a pretty good job of training and eating) and you're looking at about 5 months of training to gain obvious muscle.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:

 - Biceps, delts, forearms, traps, lats

Simplest gym free weight routine:

2: Dumbbell rows
 
2: Barbell Squats

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:

Concentrating on one muscle a day by employing various exercises will help to ensure proper muscle workout and growth.
 
Also your diet plays a pivotal role in your muscle recovery and growth.
 
Muscles are not made in the gym, but in the kitchen. Happy lifting.

title: How workout exercises?
article:
For that last fuckin’ time…
 
Working your abs will NOT burn fat!
 
Successful, long-term fat loss is entirely down to your nutrition.
 
You can eat what you want, when you want to but you must stop eating as soon as your body tells you…”I’m satisfied.”
 
When you can do that (and you side-step emotional overeating), you’re going to lose weight and fat effortlessly. Without hunger. Without the dreaded yo-yo effect.
 
Stop looking for the “magic X”.
 
With X being supplement, exercise, diet, guru…whatever.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
Five basic exercises, done three times a week is sufficient.
 
Shoulder Press- 3 sets
Pull Downs- 4 sets
Bench Press- 4 sets
Cable Rows- 3 sets
Leg Press- 4 sets
 
All these can be done in machines, which is ideal to begin with. Repetitions should be in the range of 8-15.. Increase the weight slightly every set. (Pyramid)
 
In the remaining days you can walk for an hour, or jog for 20 minutes.
 
Diet and Rest are two other important areas to look at to make any kind of transformation. So look into that.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Years.
 
And I say years without using tren, steroids, or any boosters relative to the ones mentioned. You have to commit to a schedule and time your workouts, prioritize weaker muscle groups when you see that there is an imbalance, and take rest days. With persistence and high tolerance to pain you can get big within a couple years, given that you eat protein everyday and prioritize mass over lean physique.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
One of my many cousins in U.S. asked me over a cup of overly sweetened Starbucks coffee: “Oh, is there a Starbucks in London?” After I replied affirmatively and added about my experience at Starbucks in Cardiff, she further questioned, “Oh you mean there's Starbucks all over UK?”
 
I just continued sipping on the XH i.e. extra hot coffee (which by the way was colder than lukewarm).
 
Edit: She also had larger questions looming over her head like, “Does Toronto have same Starbucks and same coffee menu?”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
In March, 2008, when I was living in Germany, I called the Starwood VIP line (located in California, USA) to reserve two rooms for my family in the Gritti Palace in Venice over the Easter holiday. I spoke with Jerome. I booked canal front rooms and asked if there was anything planned in the hotel over the holiday, for example an Easter egg hunt for the children or a special Easter brunch.
 
Jerome wasn’t sure about the planned program for the holiday, instead asking, “Do the Italians celebrate Easter?”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Here's a bit of context.
 
I was flying to England to see my extended family. An American woman was sitting next to me.
 
It was a long flight, but finally we were approaching Heathrow. We were passing over some farmland on our final approach, and the woman sitting next to me said “What are those things down there?”
 
“What things?” I inquired.
 
“Oh, those weird rectangular things down there.”
 
“Do you mean the fields?”
 
Then, to my bemusement, came this gem:
 
“No, no, fields are 
always square!
”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: This may be one of the most ignorant question I have seen on Quora. No prize for guessing that what “legitimizes” this question (it’s got quite a following) is that it’s about those “ugly Americans”. A similar question about Venezuelans or Chinese would have elicited charges of imperialism, colonialism, etc. So yeah, it is offensive, and it is posed with that smug attitude that says I am so much smarter than that person. Somehow you’d expected shit on Quora to generally rise above kindergarten taunts.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: A few years ago I was at the supermarket doing our weekly shopping. Jicama (a Mexican/central American root vegetable) was on the list. There wasn’t any on the shelf where it usually was, so I asked an employee (a woman in her early 20s) if she had any jicama in the back. She looked at me like I was insulting her and said “Ah ain’t got no jicama! What da hell wrong witch you!” After I explained to her what jicama was she apologized for being so rude to me and admitted she thought jicama was a disease.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
A2A.
 
I don’t work out at home and never have.
 
I go to a powerlifting club I started 3 times a week and train and coach for about two hours.
 
My routine has varied a lot over the years but in general I squat 2–3 times a week, deadlift 1–2 times a week, bench press 2–3 times a week and do various other exercises to assist, chins, pull-ups, rows, power cleans, front squats, presses and curls. I usually do 1–5 work sets of each after 3–5 warmup sets.
 
I walk or ride a bike to work five days a week.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was a graduate student studying mathematics in Rochester, New York. In that place you can buy beer in supermarkets if you are over 21.
 
I was in the local supermarket, buying a 6-pack of beer. The clerk, a young lady, asked me for my ID. I didn’t have my driver’s licence with me, but I had my Canadian passport, so I showed her my passport.
 
She took it, turned it over, puzzled, and asked, “What is this?” She had never seen a passport before.
 
[Edit: After speaking with a manager, I got my beer.]

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article: Training abdominal muscles every single day doesn't make any sense, because you are not providing enough rest to it for growing.Instead ,treat your abs as the other body part and train them twice in a week not more than that .There is saying in fitness industry that “Abs are made in kitchen”,this statement is very much true .It doesn't matter how much you train them ,how hard you train them if your diet is not under check and your body fat percentage is not low then you are not going to see the abs.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
There is no best. There is no one size fits all routine. Generally speaking, a handful of compound exercises( No more than 10), split up over 2–3 workouts, with reps between 4–8 for upper body and 6–20 for legs works best for most.
 
There are 2 common denominators when people experience rapid growth:
When you are overtraining and you cut the volume of the workout in half.
When you have been doing the same workout(exercise selection, rep scheme, etc) for a long time and you switch everything around.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: Some years ago I was skiing in Switzerland and took some ski lessons from an American ski instructor. He asked me where I was from and I said, Australia. He asked me what Australia was like at that time. It being December I said that it was Summertime in Australia. He looked very puzzled, so I said “Yes, in the Southern Hemisphere the seasons are reversed”. He looked even more puzzled and said “Do you mean you call your hot period winter?” Obviously they don’t teach geography in American schools.

title: How often should I workout for best results?
article:
ChatGPT
 
剧烈锻炼的频率因个体差异、健康目标和锻炼类型而异。通常，要看到锻炼效果，需要考虑以下因素：
目标：你的锻炼目标是什么？是增加肌肉质量、减肥、提高有氧能力还是其他目标？不同的目标可能需要不同的锻炼频率。
健康状况：你的身体状况和健康历史会影响你的锻炼频率。如果你有健康问题或慢性疾病，需要根据医生的建议来制定锻炼计划。
锻炼类型：不同类型的锻炼对身体的影响不同。有氧运动、力量训练、灵活性训练等都有各自的频率要求。
个体差异：每个人的身体反应都不同，因此需要根据个人反应来调整锻炼频率。有些人可能需要更频繁的锻炼才能看到效果，而其他人可能只需较少的锻炼。
一般来说，如果你的目标是保持一般健康和体适能，美国心脏协会建议每周进行至少150分钟的中等强度有氧运动或75分钟的高强度有氧运动，以及至少两天的力量训练。如果你的目标是减肥或增加肌肉质量，你可能需要更频繁的锻炼。重要的是要在锻炼计划中留出足够的时间来恢复，以避免过度训练和受伤。
 
最好的做法是咨询医生或专业的健身教练，以制定适合你目标和健康状况的个性化锻炼计划。这将有助于确保你以安全和有效的方式锻炼，同时看到持久的效果。

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: I am thinking that this question refers to someone of normal intelligence who, for some reason, does not know what most people would consider common knowledge. When one asked the other where she was, he responded that she was in Bolivia; she had always wanted to go to Bolivia. He said that she didn’t even know where it was; she thought that it was somewhere in Europe!

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
