There was a tour group of American teenagers there and I heard their teacher ask them to be thinking of which Shakespeare play they'd like to study next. There was much chatter amongst the kids but one voice piped up loud and clear, “I want to do 
Shakespeare in Love
”.
 
The teacher's face was priceless, especially when she saw me and my (now) husband smiling at her. It still makes us giggle.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
“"Are you British boy?”
 
Slightly alarmed….“"Er, yes. Sort of. Sort of Canadian if it helps.”
 
“"I can never respect the English while you guys have troops on the streets of Dublin.”
 
I considered explaining that this hadn't been the case since the 1920s but wimped out.
 
“"Actually, I'm not English. You've probably never heard of it, but I'm from Wales.”
 
“"Sure I heard of Wales. Like the Princess of Wales, right?”
 
“"Well, sort of.”
 
“"So, tell me, do you see her often down the stores?”

It wasnt just a joke or an off-hand racist comment, he had been thinking about it a lot. He went into a long explanation on how he came to his ephimey. He dropped out of college later that year.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article: If I had a favorite sandwich ingredient, it would probably be avocado! Its creamy texture and mild flavor make it a versatile addition to almost any sandwich. Whether paired with turkey, eggs, or even veggies, avocado adds a rich, satisfying element that feels indulgent yet healthy. Many people love it for its nutritional benefits, like healthy fats and vitamins, making it both delicious and nourishing. It's the kind of ingredient that can elevate a simple sandwich to something truly special!

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
I'm sure there's many professional trainers that can answer this better than I can.
 
Speaking from a cardiac rehab specialist standpoint ONLY:. I must say that post-operatively we must take baby steps (so the same would be in effect for someone who had never entered the gym before). **Assuming only.
 
We would never work on cardio more than 12 minutes to reach peak heart rate and then we would do a back and bi’s OR chest and tri's .... we would NEVER do FULL body workout never ever ever 💪💪💪

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
It might be unfair to pick a child to answer this, but it happened and has stuck in my memory.
 
I’m Australian, and speak with an Australian accent. I was visiting a friend in Mississippi and met his family for lunch, and his sister, around 10 at the time, came up to me and asked in the most adorable Southern Drawl “Why do you speak like a Spanish person and not like us?”
 
She had so little experience of the world outside Mississippi that all non-drawl accents were automatically “Spanish”.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: Once upon a time I worked for a major corporate division that was expanding internationally pretty quickly. I was soon to be on my way to Penang, Malaysia. Some of the questions my colleagues asked me and comments included: “Do people in Malaysia live in trees?” and “Penang, Malaysia. That’s in China, right?” (it’s relevant to point out that some bright spark in HR sent my 2001 W-2 to ‘Penang, China’) and “Penang! So you’ll be close to our new site in Shanghai?” (yes, if 3000 miles is close)

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article: I like a fresh loaf of French bread cut long ways covered with butter, ham pastrami and roast beef then pepper jack cheese and provolone put it open face in the oven and let it toast to a bubbling Brown and meanwhile shreds lettuce ,chop tomato, peppercinis and black olives, chopped onion salt pepper and Italian seasoning and olive oil and fresh lemon squeeze or red wine vinegar. Mix it all up in a bowl and top your sandwich with it. Put the lid on and cut it into about four servings. Yum!!

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
One of the wonders of internet accessibility is that it allows people from all over the world to share their current situations and experiences, each as unique and valuable as the next. Truly wonderful insights and a free knowledge-sharing existence that no one before us has had such access to.
 
I would encourage everyone to think instead about the opportunities, the connections, and the possibilities in each of our lives, and you will soon see that none of us are poor, but in fact rich.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Cons? I don’t see any. That’s what I do….Twice a week I do a 14-exercise program that covers all the major muscle groups. Works very well for me as an old guy trying to maintain fitness, muscle mass, and bone health.
 
Probably would not be optimal for a juicy young bodybuilder…. They tend to do complicated “split” programs and work out more often.
 
Strength trainers and athletes tend to do fewer exercises and again, usually twice a week.
 
You have to take your goals into consideration.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
YES. As long as you’re working out correctly. But you don’t need a gym or even equipment to get a great workout. I’ve been working out outside of a gym on and off for about 13 years. Just make sure you’re challenging yourself with each workout, which should involve progressing in the exercises in some way.
 
If you have free weights at home (dumbbells, kettlebells, etc), it’s even easier to get a great workout in. And free weights in general require a lot more energy than machines.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article:
I like a slice of very thin, dense whole grain rye bread, spread with butter or good mayonnaise and topped with thinly sliced (pickled) onion, hard boiled eggs and fresh soft herbs. An open faced sandwich with lots of fiber, protein and vegetables.
 
Making my own mayonnaise is surprisingly easy. I use cold pressed “extra virgin” oil, not cheap soybean or vegetable oil, to give it flavor.
 
I’m looking forward to tomato season! Tomato sandwiches are delicious! Skip the white bread.

article: I don’t meet people or have personal experiences, so I haven’t met anyone in that sense. However, I can help discuss general ideas or share insights based on knowledge and research. Ignorance can be a complex issue, often tied to a lack of exposure to information or education, and it's important to approach such discussions with empathy and understanding. If you’re interested in exploring how to address or understand ignorance in a constructive way, I’d be happy to help with that.

title: How to workout
article:
First get urself Cardiac fitness. Say, jogging, then running, cross-trainers, rowing, spinning etc. Once you are a threshhold level, after a month or two, take a trainer.
Start with light weights, target bigger muscles.
Then after conditioning, schedule your work-outs, muscle groupings, pushing vs. pulling actions, concentric vs. eccentric training, so on and so forth.
Thing is go slow, aim high. Persevere, Endure.
Take a trainer or an experienced friend as spotter.
All the best.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?

Classmate: “Oh, is that in Mexico?”
 
Me: “… no… it’s a country in South America… nowhere near Mexico…”
 
Since it was a conversation it would have been fine had she been mixed up with the city of Columbia, but she didn’t even get the country right for that to have been an option.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
Full body routines are tye best when it comes to home workout.
 
Do a mix of burpees, pushups, lunges, jumping jacks, jumping squats, pullups(different grips). Emphasise on 1 exercise a little more on 1 day. For example someday do High reps of burpees, some days squats etc. Home workout are effective when you try innovation in them while arranging exercise variations. Play with reps, tempo, speed and trust me you will be proud of yourself after a month if you remain consistent

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: I've met many people who don't understand the difference between the immigration status of somebody who followed the rules, waited for years and spent a lot of money verses somebody who spends $160 on a tourist visa and decides to overstay (or doesn't bother with a visa and move here). Needless to say, the former is a legal immigrant and is welcome and the latter is an illegal immigrant. Serious, it's not rocket science so I don't know why people have such a hard time with it.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
Overall I would say that full body 2 or 3 times a week would be better than a split 5 or 6 times 
IF
, your assuming the split is only one or two muscle groups per session. E.g chest/triceps, back/biceps, shoulders/abs, legs. In this case, full body 2–3 times a week is generally better for natural lifters.
 
HOWEVER, 
an upper/lower split is usually better than both of the above overall if you can train 4 times a week (upper/lower/rest/upper/lower/rest/rest)

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
It doesn't make a significant difference, no. While it's true that anabolic hormones are naturally higher at night and shortly after we wake, they normalize for our waking state rather quickly. 
 
What matters FAR more is that you train, period. Morning or evening doesn't matter so much as making sure that you get in and do it, so pick the time that is going to allow you to be successful. The only bad workout is the one you skip. Don't major in the minors.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article:
While it's tempting to think that doing a full-body workout every day will help you reach your fitness goals faster, it's actually not a good idea.
 
Working the same muscles over and over can lead to overtraining and fatigue, which can compromise your performance and lead to injury. Instead, it's best to give your body time to rest, recover, and rebuild between workouts.
 
Try to give each muscle group at least 48 hours of rest before working it again.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article: Contrary to popular myth, nothing much. You’ll still get stronger and have a muscular body. She sees my name and the first thing that comes out of her mouth is “Do you have that weird Italian accent, like Mario does, or say ‘-a’ after every word?”
 
Needless to say, I worked on my own for the group project for the rest of the school year, and it worked out for me just fine.

title: Do you workout?
article:
In shot, almost everyday.
 
I actually am in confusion as I try to make a perfect routine. But for now I workout everyday. My rest is the day when I don’t feel like training and that does not mean I am cheating. The only reason my routine is not perfect is because I need a permanent rest day. Everyday I wake up I feel like working my ass off. Even in those days when my body feels like it can not move. Rest day is the greatest punishment for me.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
‘Where are you from?’, I was asked in New York one day.
 
‘Bombay’, I said, using the older name of the city now known as Mumbai.
 
‘Never heard of it’ came the reply. ‘Is it somewhere in the middle east considering that the name implies frequent bombings.’
 
As much as I wanted to laugh at hearing the explanation, the look of triumph on his face when he thought he'd figured out where this foreign land was based on its name made we want to cry.

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
I covet those who can fit in a workout between 12 p.m. and 4 p.m. That would be my ideal time to exercise if I could do so consistently. I feel more ready for exercise in the afternoon: more flexible, more mobile, more physically energetic. I also feel stronger and faster.
Your physical performance might improve
Your body gets warmer as the day goes on
Hormones are on your side
Late-day exercise can relieve stress
Might help replace bad habits

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
Different exercises for morning and evening. You're basically breaking down your muscles everytime you exercise in the gym. So if you have exercised a muscle set in the morning it's time to give it rest to recover and focus on a different maucle set in the evening.
 
Exercising the same muscle set twice a day will only injure you slowly over time and make you weaker. As a result, you will not get any gains from all your haedwork. Rest is key.

article:

She asked, “Do you still have the faux leather jacket in stock?”
 
She pronounced faux “fox.”
 
I worked with another woman who commented on a colleague’s heart attack by saying, “The thing about heart attacks is the heart has been 
atracked.”
 
Another colleague deadpanned, “I didn't realize you had your MD.”

title: Can I do a mixed workout every day in the gym?
article:
It depends on your goals, but yes, it’s okay.
 
In fact, a lot of fitness programs offer a twice a day workouts right after you are used to the program exercises, or when you want to lose excess fat an build muscle.
 
However, keep in mind that if you workout twice a day your body will burn more calories, hence it requires more calories. So if you can’t eat right, or you don’t have enough money don’t attempt this kinds of exercises.
 
Enjoy.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article: Maybe not the most ignorant, but I constantly befuddle cashiers by giving them dollars to equal a larger bill over the amount due. IE If the bill is $11, I’ll give them $21 to get a 10 in return and avoid a bunch of singles in change. Many try to give me back the single telling me I gave them too much. I have to explain to them it is correct. I’ve taken to just telling them to key it in and they will understand why. Some still don’t get it.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Rest!
 
The best part of doing one part a day is you get ample rest for that body part because you will train that body part again after a week.
 
That being said I have seen most of the professional bodybuilders training one body part per week. It helps them to train that body part intensely because they know it will always recover when they will train it again. There seems to me no other particular reason of training a body part per day!

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article: My favorite is the push-pull-leg split. I’ve done a few different routines. When I started, I did one muscle group each day of the week but found it was harder to make progress because there were long gaps between times each muscle group was worked. I’ve also tried full upper one day and full lower the next. Half body workout in one day was a bit too much; it took me 2 hours to complete my workouts. My current routine is the most balanced.

title: What is your favorite sandwich ingredient?
article: Oh, I have to say that nothing beats the classic combo of crispy bacon and fresh, ripe avocado! The smoky, savory crunch of bacon paired with the creamy, buttery texture of avocado. It’s pure sandwich bliss. The contrast of flavors and textures makes every bite a little bit of heaven. Add in some toasted whole grain bread, a sprinkle of salt and pepper, and maybe a dash of hot sauce—and you’ve got a sandwich that’s absolutely irresistible.

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article: A full body routine 3 days a week is definitely your best bet to get results without spending a ton of time at the gym. Working each muscle group 3 times a week is adequate to properly train your body. However, the one downside to this plan is that you may be fatigued at the end of your full body workouts and the muscle groups you work last may start to fall behind. To combat this, be sure to mix up which groups you work first at the gym!

title: How to workout
article:
To workout properly you have to find out what works for you. Each body is different and what works for me it might not work for you. What's your goal? To build muscles, andurance, weight losse? Set your goal first and if you want to build muscles you have to train each muscle at least one time per week. An example for 5 workout days per week:
 
Monday: Chest
 
Tuesday: Back
 
Wednesday: Legs+abs
 
Thursday: Shoulders+traps
 
Friday: Arms

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
If you could only perform three exercises period, I would recommend:
Squats
Deadlifts
Bench Press
To break it down by arms/legs/chest/back, I'd recommend:
 
Arms - barbel curls, skullcrushers, hammer curls
Shoulders - Pull ups, Military (Arnold) press, scarecrows
Back - Deadlifts, rows, reverse flye
Chest - Bench Press, Pushups, Db flye
Legs - Squats (front or back), calf raises, walking lunges
 
I'm not an expert, for what it's worth.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

When the nurse asked for her address my mum said she’s visiting from Cyprus. She didn’t expect the nurse to know it, it’s only a small island at the other side of the planet, so when the nurse asked where it is, my mum said “it’s in Europe”.
 
So the nurse said: 
“That’s fine, we’ll send the bill there. Could you please spell Europe?
”

I still make fun of her on this sometimes.
 
I think some of them are just fed with some ridiculously wrong information and concepts. Now who is feeding them those craps??

Being ignorant is one thing - displaying your ignorance at the top of your voice while a group of five talented musicians are playing is truly something else.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article: The biggest fitness myth is that you can “get abs" by doing abs exercises. The main reason people cannot see their abs muscles is because their body fat percentage is too high. As a guy, you will start to see your abs at a certain body fat percentage, ball park figure of 12%. At that point, you could do an exercises to make certain muscles more prominent but for most people ab exercises will do absolutely nothing without weight loss.

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article: When gain weight, you mean build muscle, it depends. If you're talking about a full body mass building program, which you probably are, then yes I'd say that it is. You are breaking down a lot of muscle at once and all of it rebuilds at the same time and then you repeat that, you'll gain weight much faster than a split. Personally, I do think that full body workouts are best. Just be sure you don't do deadlift more than twice a week.

title: Is running every day better than going to the gym every day?
article:
It sounds like you want to lose weight above all. In that case, the most effective thing you can do is watch your diet. Yes, exercise can help you lose weight, but only if it's with a good diet, too. In fact, exercise can make you GAIN weight because it makes you hungry and you THINK you can eat what you want since you just ran or lifted weights.
 
Diet to lose weight. Run to improve your heart. Go to the gym to improve your muscles.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article: A lot of good stuff! Some of the big ones are a reduction in total cholesterol, a reduction in fat weight if done consistently, and more even blood sugar levels. Just be sure you are appropriately resting your body, and being wary of any injuries. Diet and exercise do way better than most medicines in preventing the future onset of heart disease in the vast majority of people. It’s just the determination that is the magic ingredient.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:

1. Forget the fancy machines, do push ups instead
 
2. Start making dips your go-to exercise.
 
3. Jump lunges

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
I don't have a gym membership, so all the working out I do is at my house and at the local park. I have 2 varying work outs that I do depending what my goals are.
Run 3.2 miles with minor breaks between if my only goal is to drop weighr.
Run .75 miles, do 5 pull ups, bear crawl 40 meters, do 10 pushups with my feet inclined, do 10 burpees with a push ups, do a 40 meter wind sprint, repeat 5 times. That is if I want definition.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:

I also add weights to some of these exercises like the Russian Twist, for extra difficulty, and you may get some funny looks when you do the plank up and down exercise.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
Any muscle if worked out daily would not give you results for few basic identified facts:
Soreness of muscle.
Incomplete muscle recovery.
Lesser strength and endurance.
Tiredness.
Joints pain.
So the same goes for abs too. You can perform abs exercise on alternate days and side abs in between days.
 
Note: eating right is very important for muscle recovery and tissue repairing.
 
Hope you find it helpful.
 
#
HappyWorkout.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article: One that you will stick to long term. I am partial to a variety of stuff- Crossfit, weightlifting, yoga, running and occasional road cycling. If your favorite thing is Zumba, or racquetball, or pick up basketball, then do it. The more you enjoy it, the more likely you will stick to it and not let life get in the way. It doesn’t matter what I, or any other fitness professional think. What you will stick to is best for you.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

Canada is that park upstate - the real big one. Real cold, too”.
 
I just walked away.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article: In most cases, it is. That would be because you’ll have one day in between days to give yourself time to rest. title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article: It is advisable to follow different muscle group/muscle movement splits. Example: push, pull & legs. Upper body or lower body. Though a person resuming workout after a long time or performing workout for the first time may follow whole body workout for initial few days to get started.

title: Can I do a light workout every day?
article:

If you want to focus only on ST, then, it should be divided as per following-
 
CST- Chest, Shoulders, Triceps - One session a day
 
BB- Back and Biceps - One session a day
 
Legs - One session a day
 
And then you can repeat the same sequence again.
 
Hope it helps.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article: Total body workouts also improve proprioception the ability to tell where your body is in space. Better proprioceptive abilities improve balance and help prevent falls. With full-body training, you aren’t just strengthening and hypertrophying muscles, you’re training them in an integrated manner. Such an approach pays off with additional dividends you don’t get from focusing on one muscle group at a time.

title: Is it bad to do full body workouts every day?
article: Performing full-body workouts every day may lead to overtraining and hinder recovery, especially for beginners or those lifting heavy weights. title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
The issue is that if you train your full body to your maximum effort every day, you won’t be able to recover properly and suffer from over training and will actually make less progress.
 
This is why it is recommended to split your exercises and focus on different muscle groups everyday so that whilst you workout one set of muscle groups, the others get a chance to recover which is important for growth.

You also need a good workout program to follow as well.
 
I wrote an article that is backed by 4 scientific studies on the importance of nutrient timing.
 
You can find those studies here on my blog=>http://turnaroundfitness.com/
 
It's the first article you will see.
 
Tim

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Many years ago I studied in England with several Americans. I had planned a trip to Amsterdam and was telling an girl from Chicago about it. I mentioned that we were going to travel by ferry (this was before the Channel Tunnel). She asked me why we were going by boat… I said “because England is on an island”. She replied: “It is?”
 
Bear in mind that we’d already been living there for several months!

title: What is your gym routine?
article:
Hi,
 
I'm yet to get into intense work-out, but my Routine is something like this:-
 
Morning:-
 
5:00 am Wake Up
 
5:30 am 10 Park rounds (2 km of walking)
 
6:00 am 7 Min jog (1 Km)
 
6:10 am 10 Min Elliptical Machine
 
6:30 am 7 Min Jog (1 km)
 
6:40 am 15 Min Exercise Cycle (3 KM)
 
7:00 am 10 minutes of stretching
 
Evening:-
 
(I turn into Couch potato)
 
40 Couch Push Ups
 
20 Couch Leg Cru...
